@##/ /rgya gar skad du/ na maHtA rA e ka biM sha ti sto tra gu Na hi ta sA ka/ bod skad du/ sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal nyi shu rtsa gcig gis bstod pa phan yon dang bcas pa/
rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
OM! (I pay) Homage to You, Noble and Holy Tārā!
phyag 'tshal sgrol ma myur ma dpa' mo/ / spyan ni skad cig glog dang 'dra ma/ / 'jig rten gsum mgon chu skyes zhal gyi/ / ge sar phye ba las ni byung ma/ /
Homage to You Tārā, O swift and courageous One, Whose very eyes flicker like lightning, Thou Born from the open flower of the lotus-face Of the protector of the triple world.
phyag 'tshal ston ka'i zla ba kun du/ / gang ba brgya ni brtsegs pa'i zhal ma/ / skar ma stong phrag tshogs pa rnams kyis/ / rab tu phye ba'i 'od rab 'bar ma/ /
Homage to You whose face is filled With a hundred autumn moons, O Thou who glows with the delicate light Of a thousand assembled stars.
phyag 'tshal gser sngo chu nas skyes kyi/ / pad+mas phyag ni rnam par brgyan ma/ / sbyin pa brtson 'grus dka' thub zhi ba/ / bzod pa bsam gtan spyod yul nyid ma/ /
Homage to You, adorned with gold and blue lotuses Held in your hand, O Thou whose activities are generosity, perseverance, Austerity, tranquillity, equanimity and meditation.
phyag 'tshal de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor/ / mtha' yas rnam par rgyal bar spyod ma/ / ma lus pha rol phyin pa thob pa'i/ / rgyal ba'i sras kyis shin tu bsten ma/ /
Homage to You, O crest-jewel of the Tathāgata, Who has attained limitless victory. You are supported even by the Jīnas’ sons, the Bodhisattvas, Who have gone beyond ordinary states.
phyag 'tshal tut+t+wa ra hU~M yi ge/ / 'dod dang phyogs dang nam mkha' gang ma/ / 'jig rten bdun po zhabs kyis mnan te/ / lus pa med par 'gugs par nus ma/ /
Homage to You who, with the sounds “tuttara” and “hūṃ”, Fill the sensual worlds as well as space; and you are always Pressing the sevenfold world beneath thy feet And summoning all beings before you.
phyag 'tshal brgya byin me lha tshangs pa/ / rlung lha sna tshogs dbang phyug mchod ma/ / 'byung po ro langs dri za rnams dang / / gnod sbyin tshogs kyis mdun nas bstod ma/ /
Homage to You, before whom Indra, Fire-gods, Brahma, Wind-gods and Śiva all pay homage. Thou art also praised by spirits, zombies, Yakṣas, As well as by Gandharva sprites.
phyag 'tshal trad ces bya dang phaT kyis/ / pha rol 'khrul 'khor rab tu 'joms ma/ / g.yas bskum g.yon brkyang zhabs kyis mnan te/ / me 'bar 'khrugs pa shin tu 'bar ma/ /

Homage to You who, with the syllables “traṭ” and “phaṭ”, Completely destroy the distant magic implements (of enemies); With your right leg folded and left leg outstretched You trample them underfoot with a terrifying blaze.
phyag 'tshal tu re 'jigs pa chen mo/ / bdud kyi dpa' bo rnam par 'joms ma/ / chu skyes zhal ni khro gnyer ldan mdzad/ / dgra bo thams cad ma lus gsod ma/ /
Homage to You, O great horrific One, Tūre: Thou who destroys Māra’s forces And slays all opponents With merely a frown of your lotus face.
phyag 'tshal dkon mchog gsum mtshon phyag rgya'i/ / sor mos thugs kar rnam par brgyan ma/ / ma lus phyogs kyi 'khor los brgyan pa'i/ / rang gi 'od kyi tshogs rnams 'khrug ma/ /
Homage to You, adorned with the mūdra of the three jewels, With your fingers held up before your breast; Adorned everywhere with maṇḍalas And thy own blazing-fierce light, O horrific One.
phyag 'tshal rab tu dga' ba brjid pa'i/ / dbu rgyan 'od kyi phreng ba spel ma/ / bzhad pa rab bzhad tu t+t+wa ra yis/ / bdud dang 'jig rten dbang du mdzad ma/ /
Homage to You, whose tiara radiates a garland Of joyous and splendrous lights. By your constant, joyous calling of “tuttāre” You are mistress over Mara and the phenomenal world.
phyag 'tshal sa gzhi skyong ba'i tshogs rnams/ / thams cad 'gugs par nus ma nyid ma/ / khro gnyer g.yo ba'i yi ge hUM gis/ / phongs pa thams cad rnam par sgrol ma/ /
Homage to You, who can summon forth All the protectors of the earth (and its foundations). Thou, by frowning and sounding “hūṃ” with a tremor, Can completely protect all beings from misery.
phyag 'tshal zla ba'i rtse mos dbu brgyan/ / brgyan pa thams cad shin tu 'bar ma/ / ral pa'i khrod na 'od dpag med las/ / rtag par shin tu 'od ni mdzad ma/ /
Homage to You who wear the homed moon as a head ornament, And who art bedecked with fiery baubles. From the Buddha Amitābha who is in your chignon of hair You are constantly bathed in light.
phyag 'tshal bskal pa tha ma'i me ltar/ / 'bar ba'i phreng ba'i dbus na gnas ma/ / g.yas brkyang g.yon bskum kun nas bskor dgas/ / dgra yi dpung ni rnam par 'joms ma/ /

Homage to You who bum like fire at the end of an aeon; Thou, seated in the midst of a wreath of flames, Joyously, with right leg outstretched and left leg folded, You totally destroy the enemy forces.
phyag 'tshal sa gzhi'i ngos la phyag gi/ / mthil gyis bsnun cing zhabs kyis brdung ma/ / khro gnyer can mdzad yi ge hU~M gis/ / rim pa bdun po rnams ni 'gems ma/ /
Homage to You, who strike the earth with your hand And trample it with your feet. With a flash from your eyes, a frown from your brow, And the sound of “hum”, the seven-fold world is smashed.
phyag 'tshal bde ma dge ma zhi ma/ / mya ngan 'das zhi spyod yul nyid ma/ / swA hA oM dang yang dag ldan pas/ / sdig pa chen po 'joms pa nyid ma/ /
Homage to You, happy, virtuous and tranquil— Whose activity is Nirvana’s sphere of calm. Thou who art at one with the syllables “svāhā” and “oṃ”, Destroy all great sins.
phyag 'tshal kun nas bskor rab dga' ba'i/ / dgra yi lus ni rab tu 'gems ma/ / yi ge bcu pa'i ngag ni bkod pa'i/ / rig pa hU~M las sgron ma nyid ma/ /
Homage to You who, encircled by unalloyed joy, Smash the bodies of the enemy; Thou, O Tārā, who arise from the sound “hum”, Art also in the mantra decorated with 10 syllables.
phyag 'tshal tu re'i zhabs ni brdabs pas/ / hU~M gi rnam pa'i sa bon nyid ma/ / ri rab man dA ra dang 'bigs byed/ / 'jig rten gsum rnams g.yo ba nyid ma/ /
Homage to You who stamps her feet with the sound “tūre”, Thou whose essence is in the seed-syllable “hum”. You can pierce Mount Meru with the mandarāva tree And cause the three-fold world to quake.
phyag 'tshal lha yi mtsho yi rnam pa'i/ / ri dgas rtags can phyag na bsnams ma/ / tA ra gnyis brjod phaT kyi yi ges/ / dug rnams ma lus par ni sel ma/ /
Homage to You who hold the moon Just like a veritable ocean of gods. By saying “Tārā” twice and “phaṭ” once You completely purify all poisons.
phyag 'tshal lha yi tshogs rnams rgyal po/ / lha dang mi'am ci yis bsten ma/ / kun nas go cha dga' ba'i brjid kyis/ / rtsod dang rmi lam ngan pa sel ma/ /
Homage to You, monarch over all the assembled gods, Who art upheld by gods and spirits. With your brilliant and joyous armour You resolve all troubles and nightmares.
phyag 'tshal nyi ma zla ba rgyas pa'i/ / spyan gnyis po la 'od rab gsal ma/ / ha ra gnyis brjod tu t+t+wa ra yis/ / shin tu drag po'i rims ni sel ma/ /
Homage to You, with eyes huge and filled with the clear light Of the sun and the moon; By saying “hara” twice and “tuttāre” once You clear up all malevolent epidemics.
phyag 'tshal de nyid gsum rnams bkod pa'i/ / zhi ba'i mthu dang yang dag ldan ma/ / gdon dang ro langs gnod sbyin tshogs rnams/ / 'joms pa tu re rab mchog nyid ma/ /
Homage to You, with the three truths displayed, O Thou with the strength which comes from within. Thou, most perfect One, destroyest at will Malignant spirits, zombies and demons.
This praise and the accompanying root mantra are the homages to Tārā’s 21 forms.
rtsa ba'i sngags kyis bstod pa 'di dang / / phyag 'tshal ba ni nyi shu rtsa gcig / lha mo la gus yang dag ldan pa'i/ / blo ldan gang gis rab tu brjod pas/ /
This praise of the root mantras and twenty-one-fold homage* – for one Who recites it, wise and pious, full of faith towards the Goddess,
srod dang tho rangs langs par byas nas/ / dran pas mi 'jigs thams cad rab ster/ / sdig pa thams cad rab tu zhi ba/ / ngan 'gro thams cad 'joms pa nyid do/ /
And remembers it at even and at dawn on rising, it grants Ev'ry fearlessness, quells all sins, and destroys all bad migrations.
rgyal ba bye ba phrag bdun rnams kyis/ / myur du dbang ni bskur bar 'gyur la/ / 'di las che ba nyid ni 'thob cing / / sangs rgyas go 'phang mthar thug der 'gro/ /
Quickly he'll be consecrated by sev'n times ten million Conqu'rors. Thereby gaining greatness, he will reach at last the rank of Buddha.
de yi dug ni drag po chen po/ / brtan gnas pa'am gzhan yang 'gro ba/ / zos pa dang ni 'thungs pa nyid kyang / / dran pas rab tu sel ba nyid thob/ /
The most dreadful poison, whether animal, or plant or min 'ral, Whether he's devoured or drunk it, meets its end through his rememb'ring.
gdon dang rims dang dug gis gzir ba'i/ / sdug bsngal tshogs ni rnam par spong ste/ / sems can gzhan pa rnams la yang ngo / / gnyis gsum bdun du mngon par brjod na/ /
It completely stops the pain of those whom spirits, fevers, poisons Afflict—other beings' also. On reciting twice three sevens,
bu 'dod pas ni bu thob 'gyur zhing / / nor 'dod pas ni nor rnams nyid thob/ / 'dod pa thams cad thob par 'gyur te/ / bgegs rnams med cing so sor 'joms 'gyur/ /
One who wants a child will get one, one desiring wealth will find wealth, One obtains all one's desires; no hindrances, each will be subdued.
bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstod pa gsungs pa rdzogs so// //
The speech of all Buddhas, the praise of the Lady Arya-Tara by the Complete and Perfect Buddha, the Praise in Twenty-one Homages is complete.

d.crumb: 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa

f.d: 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa
PRAISE OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ (Attributed to Mātṛceṭa)
@##/ /rgya gar skad du/ Ar+ya tA rA sto tra/ bod skad du/ 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa/
(Ārya-tārā-stotra Praise of Ārya-Tārā
bcom ldan 'das ngag gi dbang po la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the Bhagavati Lord of Speech![12]
dad pa'i lteng ka rab tu rgyas pa la/ / 'dun pa pad+ma'i rtsa ba rab tu brtan/ / rtsol ba drag po pad+ma'i gdan la bzhugs/ / rje btsun sgrol ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
You sit on a lotus seat of strong effort, Its lotus roots of aspiration firm In the ground of faith fully developed, Venerable Tārā—homage to You!
'gro ba nyon mongs tshad pas gdungs pa la/ / thugs rjes bsil mdzad zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs/ / 'gro ba nyam thag sgrol ba'i lha mo ste/ / rje btsun sgrol ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
You sit on a moon seat, cooling with compassion Migrating beings scorched by the heat of defilements. Goddess, Saviouress of tormented beings, Venerable Tārā—homage to You!
tshogs gnyis shing rta'i 'khor lo lta bu yis/ / sgrib gnyis bcom nas sa bcur rab gnas te/ / lha mo'i tshul du 'khor ba ma stongs bzhugs/ / rje btsun sgrol ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
With the two accumulations as chariot-wheels You've conquered the two veils;[13] established in the Ten Stages, You stay as a Goddess until saṃsāra is empty, Venerable Tārā—homage to You!
nyon mongs mi g.yo ri ltar brtan pa'i sku/ / yon tan rab rdzogs sha lus shin tu rgyas/ / byams pas thugs g.yos nu 'bur rgyas pa can/ / rje btsun sgrol ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Your body, unmoved by defilements, is firm like a mountain, Well-grown, since nourished by Your perfect virtues, Full-breasted, since loving-kindness moves Your heart, Venerable Tārā-homage to You!
'khor bas ma gos sku mdog 'gying bag can/ / sgeg pa'i cha lugs rin chen rgyan cha can/ / dbu skra sngo ljang rigs lnga'i cod pan can/ / rje btsun sgrol ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Graceful, Your complexion unstained by saṃsāra; Of charming apparel, with jewel ornaments, Your hair blue-green,[14] with a diadem of the five Families, Venerable Tārā-homage to You!
zag med bde rgyas zhal ras 'dzum bag can/ / rnam snang las byung phrin las thugs rje can/ / bdud 'joms mda' gzhu thabs dang shes rab can/ / rje btsun sgrol ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Your smiling face spreads uncontaminate bliss; Born of Vairocana,[15] You have compassion and deeds. With Wisdom's and Means' bow and arrow subduing the Māras, Venerable Tārā—homage to You!
'jigs pa skyob mdzad phyag g.yas skyabs sbyin tshul/ / 'gro ba'i yid 'phrog na tshod bcu drug tshul/ / las kyi rigs tshogs ut+pal sngon po'i tshul/ / rje btsun sgrol ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
skye rgas na 'chi'i chu bo bzhi po las/ / sgrol ba'i gnyen po mkhas pa khyod lags te/ / byams pa'i gru 'dzin snying rje'i skya ba can/ / rje btsun sgrol ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

You are the skilful boatman who carries us over (tāraṇa) The rivers of rebirth, aging, sickness and death [To] the harbour (potalaka) of loving-kindness, with oars of compassion, Venerable Tārā-homage to You!
de ltar tshigs su bcad pa brgyad kyis ni/ / lha mo nyid la dad pas bstod pa las/ / des ni 'gro ba sems can thams cad kyis/ / myur du sangs rgyas go 'phang thob par shog /
Now that I have praised the Goddess so, In eight stanzas, with faith in Her, through this May every migrating sentient being Quickly win the rank of Buddhahood!
rje btsun ma sgrol ma la bstod pa/ slob dpon ma ti tsi tras mdzad pa rdzogs so//
The Praise of the Venerable Lady by Master Matriciṭa (sic) is complete. [Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson]

d.crumb: 'phags ma lha mo sgrol ma'i bstod pa don thams cad grub pa

f.d: 'phags ma lha mo sgrol ma'i bstod pa don thams cad grub pa
THE KING OF PRAISES CALLED THE FULFILLER OF ALL AIMS, A PRAISE OF THE ĀRYA GODDESS TĀRĀ (Attributed to Mātṛceṭa)

@##/ /rgya gar skad du/ Ar+yA tA ra de bI sto tra sarba ar+tha sA d+ha na nA ma sto tra rA dza/ bod skad du/ 'phags ma lha mo sgrol ma'i bstod pa don thams cad grub pa zhes bya ba bstod pa'i rgyal po/
Ārya-tārādevī-stotra-sarvârtha-sādhana-nāma-stotra-rāja The King of Praises Called The Fulfiller of All Aims, A Praise of the Ārya Goddess Tārā
mgon po thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the Lord endowed with Great Compassion, Āryâ-valokitêśvara!
zla ba skar ma'i tshogs ltar mkha' la mdzes/ / mgon po sems dpas bskor cing 'gro na'ang mdzes/ / zla ba dri med gdung ba sel ba bzhin/ / mi shes kun spangs 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal sel/ /

[As] the moon is fair 'midst the sky and constellations, The Protector, surrounded by 'sattvas,[16] is fair 'midst migrators. As the immaculate moon dispels distress, Free of all ignorance You dispel migrators' sorrows.
byang chub phyogs chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / / bsam gtan ting 'dzin rnam thar mang po can/ / sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan gyis brgyan pa la/ / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rab tu brgyan/ /

Endowed with the thirty-seven Aids to Bodhi, Dhyānas, and many samādhis and Liberations, You are adorned with the thirty-two Marks [of Great Beings] And further adorned with the eighty excellent Signs.
srung byed gsum dang ma 'dres dran gsum dang / / mi 'jigs bzhi brnyes yongs su dag bzhi mnga'/ / stobs bcu'i rtsal ldan skye la thugs rje che/ / bag chags kun bcom mi bsnyel rnam kun bcom/ /

You've found the three points needing no guard, three Special Awareness[17] And four Fearlessnesses, and have the four Purities.[18] Skilled in the ten Powers, You've great Compassion for beings. All imprints destroyed, You've overcome all kinds of lack.
rigs lngas nyon mongs lnga bcom ye shes lnga/ / sku lnga mngon par byang chub rnam lnga brnyes/ / lam lnga sbyong mdzad sangs rgyas lnga yi sku/ / phung po lnga spangs zag zad mngon shes lnga/ /
dus gsum rgyal ba kun gyi snying po khyod/ / yon tan kun gyi 'byung gnas rgyu yi mchog / chags sdang bral yang 'gro ba'i don gyi phyir/ / cha lugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'dzin pa khyod/ /
Essence of all the Conquerors of the three times, You are the source and supreme cause of all virtues. Free of greed and hatred, for the sake Of migrating beings You take diverse appearances.
sna tshogs phrin las sku mdog ljang gu can/ / dbu la 'od dpag med pas rab tu brgyan/ / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i cha lugs can/ / 'gro ba'i ded dpon sgrol ma khyod kyi sku/ /
You have a Body that's green, for all activities. On Your crown You're adorned with Amitābha, With the look of a universal ruler, Tārā, captain of beings, [such] is Your Body.
mdzes pa'i ral pa dbu rgyan cod pan dang / / dar dpyangs zla tshes sna tshogs rdo rjes mdzes/ / rna rgyan mgul rgyan dpung rgyan gdu bu dang / / ska rags zhabs gdub ba da'i smad dkris mdzes/ /
Your lovely locks are beautified with a crown, Diadem, ribbons, crescent and double vajra. Earrings, adornments of neck and shoulders, bracelets, Girdle, anklets and lower-leg wrappings adorn You.
rin chen nor bus spras pa'i do shal dang / / dpung rgyan se mo dos ni shin tu brgyan/ / bcos bu'i ras dang kha dog sna tshogs pa'i/ / dar dang lha yi dar zab na bza' mnabs/ /
Richly adorned with necklaces beset With precious jewels, shoulder-gems, strings of pearls, You are clad in raiment of coloured cloth, Variegated silk, and heavenly satin.
pad+ma'i rigs ni pad+ma las 'khrungs can/ / sna tshogs pad+ma mchog gi gdan la bzhugs/ / chags dang zhe sdang gti mug la sogs kyis/ / ma gos pad+ma dmar po bzhin du dag /
Of lotus birth, in the Lotus Family, You sit on a seat of a supreme all [-coloured] lotus, Pure like to a red lotus, untainted with Such [defilements] as greed, hate and delusion.
dbang po gshin rje chu lha gnod sbyin dang / / 'byung po me lha rlung lha srin po dang / / sa bdag steng gi lha tshogs ma lus rnams/ / phyogs skyong 'gro don sprul mdzad khyod kyi sku/ /
Your Body moves for migrators all guards of directions— Indra, Yama, Varuṇa and Yakṣa, Bhūta, Agni, Vāyu, Rākṣasa, Lords of the soil, and the host of upper gods.[21]
tshangs pa khyab 'jug dbang phyug lha chen dang / / drag po zhi ba u ma la sogs las/ / rgyal gyur lha yi lha ste sgrol ma khyod/ / khams gsum kun gyi dbang phyug chen por grags/ /
Tārā, You are the god of gods, triumphant Over such as Brahma, Viṣṇu, Īśvara, Mahādeva, Rudra, Śiva and Umā; You are renowned as sovereign of all the three Realms.
thod pa mi 'chang thugs rje'i thod pa can/ / ral pa rnam spangs shin tu dga' bas mdzes/ / g.yang gzhi dang bral mtshan dang dpe byad spras/ / thal bas ma bskus byams pas khyab pa'i bdag /
dbyu gu gsum spangs bslab pa gsum dang ldan/ / dur khrod gnas der chos kyi dbyings su rol/ / rked phran cang te'u la sogs sgra spangs nas/ / gsung dbyangs yan lag drug cus chos kun sgrogs/ /

No three staves[22] for You, but You have the threefold Training; Rejecting charnel-grounds, You dwell(?) in Dharmadhātu. You've given up sounds like the slim-waisted ḍamaru's, But proclaim all Dharmas with Voice of sixty qualities.
tshangs skud mi bsnams mya ngan 'das pa'i sku/ / mtshan spyod spangs nas dus gsum mnyam par spyod/ / log sred las byung gdung ba'i dka' thub spangs/ / dam pa'i brtul zhugs ma lus rab tu ldan/ /

Your Body, of one in Nirvana, wears no sacred thread; You've left off going by night, and go equally all times(?).[23] You've cast off(?) wrong cravings, rejected the bent ascesis,[24] And are fully endowed with every holy practice.
mtshon cha dor nas shes rab mtshon cha bsnams/ / zhe sdang rnam spangs sgrub pa'i rtsa rgyun gcod/ / phyogs 'dzin mi mnga' grub mtha' kun gyi bdag / chags pa mi mnga' kun la mkha' ltar spyod/ /
Rejecting sharp weapons, You wield the sword of Wisdom. Hatred abandoned, You cut off buried[25] roots. Having no bias, You've mastered every tenet. Having no greed, like space You go everywhere.
mtha' spangs nam mkha' lta bur khyod kyi thugs/ / shes bya'i dkyil 'khor thams cad khyod kyi sku/ / sgra dang brjod par snang ba thams cad gsung / / sgrol ma chos kun bsdus pa'i snying po can/ /
Your Mind is free of limits, just like space. Your Body is the entire sphere of knowables. Your Speech is every sound or appearance of speech. Tārā, You have the essence combining all dharmas.
zhi dang rgyas dang dbang dang mngon spyod dang / / dgug dang dgar dang sde rengs bskrad pa dang / / lkugs dang tshig 'phrog gzugs sgyur bsrung la sogs/ / dus gsum rgyal ba kun gyi phrin las can/ /

You have the rites of all the three times' Conquerors, Like calming, increasing, subjugating, bewitching, Summoning, driving away, expelling mobs(?), Silencing, robbing of speech, transforming, protecting.
sku yi dbang phyug gsung gi dbang phyug dang / / thugs kyi dbang phyug 'dod yon dbang phyug ldan/ / rdzu 'phrul kun 'gro yon tan brgyad dang ldan/ / chos sku mkha' ltar dbyer med rtogs gyur kyang / /
You have the eight Masteries—those of Body and Speech, Masteries of Mind and of Sense Objects, [Likewise too the Masteries of Place,][26] Magical Powers, Omnipresence and Qualities.
gzugs sku 'ja' tshon lta bur 'gro la ston/ / ji srid dkyil 'khor kun gyi bdag po mchog / sgrol ma 'gro ba 'khor ba'i gzeb las grol/ / gang gis dran na ngan song 'jigs pa dang / /
You've realized inseparably space-like Dharmakāya, But show Form-bodies, like rainbows, to migrators. Always, supreme chief of all the maṇḍalas, Tārā, You save migrators from saṃsāra's straits.

rgyal po rkun po me chus 'jigs pa dang / / seng ge stag sbrul srin po'i 'jigs las sgrol/ / 'byung ba 'khrugs dang gdon gyis bskyed pa yis/ / srog 'phrog nad kyi bye brag ma lus dang / / drang srong mkha' 'gro'i dmod gyur kun las sgrol/ /

If one thinks of You, You save from the fears of realms Of woe, the fears of kings, thieves, fire and water, The fears of lions, tigers, rākṣasas, snakes. From every kind of disease that robs of life, Produced by disturbance of elements or by spirits, And from all ṛṣis' and ḍākinīs' curses You save.

nor bu sngags dang sman sbyor 'dod pa bzhin/ / 'gro la 'jig rten 'das pa'i dngos grub kun/ / mos pas dran pa rnams la stsol pa yin/ / rgyal srid 'dod pas g.yul ngor rgyal ba dang / / longs spyod grags pa 'dod pa de dag dang / / bkur ba'i dri ngas bral 'dod spyod pa yin/ /

For sentient beings, like those who want to get jewels, Mantras or medicines, to those who think of You with Conviction You grant all supermundane siddhis. Those who want power [You make] triumphant in battle; Those who want wealth or fame, or wish to be free Of stains of slander, You bring [this] about.
gang gis bstod pas bde gshegs kun la bstod/ / dus gsum sangs rgyas kun gyi bskyed mdzad ma/ / sangs rgyas sras bcas ma lus khyod kyi sku/ / rje btsun sgrol ma yon tan phung po can/ /
Whoever praises You praises all the Sugatas— Mother producing all Buddhas of the three times, Your Body is all the Buddhas and their Offspring, Venerable Tārā, endowed with a heap of virtues!
tshangs pa khyab 'jug dbang phyug la sogs dang / / drag po zhi ba u ma dkar sham sogs/ / skul byed lu gu rgyud dang khro gnyer can/ / mA ma kI dang spyan dang gos dkar mo/ /
Impeller and leash of Brahmā, Viṣṇu and Īśvara and their sort, of such as Rudra, Umā, Sitā and Śama(?)![27] And Bhṛkuṭī, Māmakī, Locanā, Pāṇḍara-vāsinī![28]

'gro ba gang gis 'dul ba de don du/ / ji ltar khyad 'phags brjid pa'i cha lugs can/ / thabs tshul rnam pa mtha' yas ston pa'i sku/ / 'gro ba'i skyabs mchog rje btsun sgrol ma mchog / spyi bor 'od dpag med bzhugs phyag 'tshal lo/ /

For the benefit of migrators who cultivate [You], Your Body shows in infinite ways the method, How one may have the appearance of supernal splendour. Most Venerable Tārā, migrators' supreme Refuge, On whose crown sits Amitābha—homage to You!
'jigs pa brgyad skyob sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / grags pa mtha' yas sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / 'gro don sgrub pa sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / sdug bsngal nges sel sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ /
I bow to the Body of Tārā who saves from eight fears. I bow to the Body of Tārā of infinite fame. I bow to the Body of Tārā, the world's benefactor. I bow to the Body of Tārā, sure curer of sorrow.

phyag stong spyan stong sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / mkha' ltar mtha' yas sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / mtshan dang dpes brgyan sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / zla 'dra'i yan lag sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / nyi ma ltar gsal sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / dus gsum 'gyur med sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ /

I bow to the Body of Tārā of thousand hands and eyes. I bow to the Body of Tārā infinite as space. I bow to the Body of Tārā adorned with the Marks and Signs. I bow to the Body of Tārā whose limbs are like the moon. I bow to the Body of Tārā who is as bright as the sun. I bow to the Body of Tārā unchanging in the three times.
sa ltar rten gyur sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / chu ltar bsil mdzad sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / me ltar smin mdzad sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / rlung ltar rgyas mdzad sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ /
I bow to the Body of Tārā supporting like earth. I bow to the Body of Tārā cohering like water. I bow to the Body of Tārā ripening like fire. I bow to the Body of Tārā expanding like air.[29]

sman pa'i rgyal po sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / sman ltar nad 'joms sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / thugs rje'i chu rgyun sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / 'dul ba'i thabs mkhas sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / sgeg kyang chags bral sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ / thar pa'i lam ston sgrol ma'i sku la 'dud/ /

I bow to the Body of Tārā who is the Sovereign of Doctors. I bow to the Body of Tārā subduing disease like medicine. I bow to the Body of Tārā, the river of compassion. I bow to the Body of Tārā skilled in means of taming. I bow to the Body of Tārā lovely but free of desire. I bow to the Body of Tārā who teaches the way to Freedom.
stong nyid nam mkha' lta bu'i chos kyi sgra/ / 'gro ba ma lus pa la nges sgrogs pas/ / mu stegs [{]ri dgas [,]ri dwags [}]skrag mdzad seng ge che/ / rje btsun sgrol ma'i sku la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Great Lion, who by truly proclaiming to all Migrators the sound of the Dharma of Emptiness Like space, terrifies beast-like tīrthikas— Venerable Tārā, homage to Your Body![30]
mi phyed rdo rje 'dzin pa'i zhags pa dang / / chos sgrogs dung dang shes rab mda' 'dzin dang / / 'dren pa'i lcags kyu yid 'ong ut+pa la/ / snying rje gzhu dang lta ngan sdigs mdzub mdzad/ /
You hold a changeless vajra and a noose, A conch proclaiming the Dharma, a wisdom arrow, A driving hook, a pleasant utpala, A bow of compassion, raised forefinger of view.[31]
thugs kyi rnam par dag pa brda tshul du/ / rdo rje la sogs rtag tu byin brlabs pa'i/ / phyag brgyad mtshan ma brgyad kyis rab brgyan pa'i/ / rje btsun sgrol ma'i sku la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Your eight hands are adorned with the eight tokens, Vajra and so forth, which are blessed as signs In the manner of symbols of purity of mind— Venerable Tārā, homage to Your Body!
rdo rje sgrol ma rin chen sgrol ma dang / / pad+ma'i sgrol ma las kyi sgrol ma dang / / bdug pa'i sgrol ma me tog sgrol ma dang / / mar me'i sgrol ma dri yi sgrol ma dang / /
Surrounded by an entourage of twelve— Vajra-tārā, Ratna-tārā and Padma-tārā, Karma-tārā and Dhūpa-tārā, Puṣpa-tārā and
lcags kyu'i sgrol ma zhags pa'i sgrol ma dang / / lcags sgrog sgrol ma dril bu'i sgrol ma dang / / bcu gnyis 'khor lo'i tshogs kyis rab bskor ba'i/ / rje btsun sgrol ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Dīpa-tārā, Gandha-tārā,[32] then Aṅkuśa-tārā, Pāśa-tārā and Sphoṭa-tārā and Ghaṇṭā-tārā[33]— Venerable Tārā, homage to You!
mgon po 'od dpag med la phyag 'tshal lo/ / phyag na pad+ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / spyan ras gzigs dbang khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / 'jig rten dbang phyug khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to Protector Amitābha! Homage to you [also], Padmapāṇi! Homage to Lord Avalokita! Homage to You, O Lord of the World![34]
don yod zhags pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / khro rgyal rta mgrin khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / 'jigs pa brgyad skyob khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / phyag stong spyan stong khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to You, O Amoghapāśa! Homage to Krodha-rāja Hayagrīva! Homage to You who protect from the eight fears![35] Homage to You of a thousand hands and eyes!
thugs rje bcu gcig zhal la phyag 'tshal lo/ / dbang phyug chen po khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / rdo rje chos chen khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / de nyid don mchog khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to eleven-faced Compassion! Homage to You, Great in Mastery![36] Homage to You, O Great Vajra Dharma![37] Homage to You, Supreme Meaning of Truth![38]
'jig rten dbang rab khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / rdo rje spyan rgyas khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / ral pa gcig ma khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / lha mo khro gnyer can la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to You, O World's Highest Ruler![39] Homage to You, Vajra Large-eyed One![40] Homage to You, [Goddess] Ekajaṭā! Homage to You, Goddess Bhṛkuṭī!
thugs rje chen po khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / bud med sgyu 'phrul khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / ku ru ku l+le khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / lha mo gos dkar khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to You, Great Compassionate One! Homage to You, Apparition as a woman![41] Homage to You, [Goddess] Kurukullā! Homage to You, Pāṇḍara-vāsinī!
oM tA re tut+tA re tu re swA hA/
OṂ TĀRE TUTTĀRE TURE SVĀHĀ!
[Benefits]
gang zhig sdom pa de bzung nas/ / sgrol ma'i sku gzugs spyan sngar ni/ / khrus byas dang bas rtse gcig gis/ / bstod pa'i rgyal po 'dis bstod nas/ /
Should anyone have taken vows and before an image of Tārā Bathed, praised [Her] one-pointedly with faith with this king of praises,
gsang sngags bzlas brjod 'di byas na/ / rje btsun sgrol ma zhal bstan nas/ / gdung ba thams cad sel ba dang / / dngos grub ma lus byin brlab 'gyur/ /
And done this mantra recitation, Venerable Tārā then will show Her face, eliminate all distress, and inspire with every siddhi.
zla ba yar ngo'i tshes brgyad la/ / lci ba'i dkyil 'khor dbus su ni/ / rje btsun sgrol ma mchod byas nas/ / bstod dang gsang sngags 'di bzlas na/ /
If on the eighth of the waxing moon, amidst a weighty maṇḍala One worships Venerable Tārā, praises, and recites this secret mantra,
mgon po bzhin du bdag 'gyur te/ / sgrib pa rnams dang bral ba dang / / dri ngas skur pa dag pa dang / / rgyud gsum yon tan ma lus 'grub/ /
One will become like the Protector in nature, free of obscurations, And pure of any foul slander, achieve all qualities of the triple continuum.[42]
rgyal po g.yul du 'jug pa'i tshe/ / spyi bor snying po 'di bcangs na/ / bstod dang gsang sngags 'di brjod na/ / dgra bo 'dod sbyin dbang du 'gyur/ /
If a king, when entering battle, wears this essence on his crown And recites this praise and mantra, he will subjugate foes at will.
bud med gang zhig bud med kyi/ / dngos po las ni bral 'dod dang / / 'jig rten dgos pa mchog dang ni/ / 'jig rten 'das pa grub 'dod pas/ /
Any woman who desires to be free of womanly things, Or wants to achieve the supreme worldly purpose, or the supermundane,
khrus byas gos dkar bgos nas ni/ / bsnyen nas bsrung bar nges gnas te/ / yar ngo'i tshes brgyad mchod bstod bzlas/ / de dag the tshom med par 'grub/ /
If she bathes, puts on white raiment and on the eighth of the waxing moon, Fasting,[43] worships, makes praise and recites, she will achieve it without doubt.
'phags ma lha mo sgrol ma la bstod pa/ don thams cad grub pa zhes bya ba bstod pa'i rgyal po rdzogs so//
The King of Praises called the Fulfiller of All Aims, a Praise of the Ārya Goddess Tārā, is complete. It is a praise by Master Mātriciṭa. [Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson].
@#/ /'phags ma lha mo sgrol ma la bstod pa mu tig phreng ba zhes bya ba/
THE PEARL GARLAND, A PRAISE OF THE GODDESS ĀRYA-TĀRĀ (By Candragomin)
@#/ /rgya gar skad du/ Ar+ya tA ra de bi stod tra gu lu ta ma la sa d+ha nA ma/ bod skad du/ 'phags ma lha mo sgrol ma la bstod pa mu tig 'phreng ba zhes bya ba/
Ārya-tārā-devī-stotra-muktikā-mālā-nāma The Pearl Garland, a Praise of the Goddess Ārya-Tārā
rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to Venerable Arya-Tārā!
gang zhig bdag la de nyid ster mdzad/ / 'gro mgon zhabs la spyi bos btud de/ / sgrib pa nyon mongs dri ma bsal phyir/ / lha mo mtshog la bstad par bya'o/ /
I bow with my crown at the feet of beings' Protector, who's granted me the Truth (tattva). To remove obscurations, defilements and stains, I shall give praise to the supreme Goddess.
yi ge taM las skyes pa'i sku mchog / thugs rje nyi ma 'bum gyi 'od kyis/ / 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho skems par byed pa'i/ / sdug bsngal stongs par mdzad la phyag 'tshal/ /
Your Body born from the syllable tāṃ, with light of a hundred thousand suns Of compassion You dry up saṃsāra's ocean, emptying it of suffering—homage!
las kyi rnam par smin pa'i bud shing / / ye shes me yi dpung gis bsreg zhas/ / mchog gi dngos gub grub par mdzad ma/ / ris drug nyon mongs sel la phyag 'tshal/ /
You burn our fuel of karmic results on a bonfire of wisdom-knowledge, And make us realize supreme siddhis, cleanser of kleśa of six classes—homage!
rdzu 'phrul thogs med nam mkha'i lus can/ / thugs rjes srid pa'i mtsho chen bsgral nas/ / 'gro rnams thar pa'i gling du khrid pa'i/ / ded dpon chen mo khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
With magical body of space, unobstructed, You cross with compassion saṃsāra's great ocean And conduct migrators to the land of Liberation, great Captain—homage!
bris pa'i sku la gsol ba btab pas/ / des kyang grub chen brgyad po 'thob 'gyur/ / gang la gang 'dod dngos grub ster ma/ / 'dod rgu'i 'byung gnas khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
Even by making request to Your painted form, the eight great siddhis[5] are won. Granter to any of siddhis they want, source of all we need—homage to You!
lha nams rgyab phyogs rig sngags sdus nas/ / khyod kyi sku gzugs spyi bor blangs nas/ / phrin las rnam bzhi grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur/ / mthu rtsal thog med khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
Subduing with mantras hostile gods,[6] taking Your image upon one's crown Becomes a cause to achieve the four rites, You of power unimpeded—homage!
rna rgyan mgul rgyan longs sku'i cha byad/ / rin chen du mas sbras pa'i do shal/ / dpung rgyan se mo do yis brgyan ma/ / dpal gyi 'od can /khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
Adorned with the Saṃbhogakāya adornments— earrings, throat-jewel, necklace of many Gems, with armlets and strings of pearls, You with magnificent light-rays—homage!

khyod la gus pa'i blo mchog skyes pa'i/ / mi de'i rna bar bla ma'i man ngag / tshig gcig song bar ma gyur kyang ni/ / stong nyid bde ba'i nyams kyi drod snyoms/ / shes rab mchog skyed ma la phyag 'tshal/ /

In those who've developed supreme devotion towards You, even if not one word Of a guru's instructions has reached their ears, You produce the even heat of the Bliss-void experience, supreme Wisdom—homage!
khyod kyi gsung mchog brjod du med las/ / a li ka li rol pa'i sgra 'byung / / tud tA ra yis 'ur sgra chen pos/ / 'phags lam bsgrod pa khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
In Your supreme Speech, past description, come playful sounds of vowels and consonants. You proclaim[7] the Ārya Path with thunder of TUTTĀRA-homage!
d+ha na ta ra phaT kyi yi ges/ / bdud sde dpung bcas mi bzad 'joms ma/ / gzhan gyis mi thub drag rtsal chen mo/ / mthu stobs ldan pa khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
Tārā of wealth (Dhatta-tārā), with phaṬ irresistible subduer of Māra's tribe and forces! Invincible one of great terrible power, O Sorceress—homage to You!
lha dang klu dang dri za gnod sbyin/ / drang srong dang ni mkha' 'gro'i dmod sngags// byad stems la sogs pha rol 'khrul 'khor/ / 'joms par mdzad ma khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
Subduer of others' magic, such as curses and maledictions of devas, Nāgas,gandharvas,yakṣas, ṛṣis and ḍākinīs[8]—homage to You!
swA hAs drod kyi skye gan sa bshig nas/ / hU lu hU lus mngal gyi kha 'gog / sgo nga'i skye gnas oM gyis 'dzoms ma/ / tA res brdzus skyes sel la phyag 'tshal/ /
With svāhā destroyer of birth from heat, closing womb-doors with hūlu-hūlu, With om overcoming birth from eggs, with tāre miraculous birth stopping—homage![9]
stong nyid snying rdze'i bdag nyid can gyis/ / nang nyams phyi ru shar ba'i gzi mdangs/ / dpal gyi 'od zer shes rab 'bar ma/ / ma rig mun sel khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
In Your nature of Emptiness and Compassion aglow with Your inner thought outwardly seen, Blazing with glorious wisdom light-rays, dispeller of unknowing's darkness-homage!
ye shes me dpung 'bar ba'i 'od kyis/ / bar chad bdud kyi mda' lnga bsreg nas/ / sgrub pa rkyen gyi khar mi gtong ma/ / byang chub lam dgra sel la phyag 'tshal/ /
Burning the hindering māras' five arrows with light of the blazing bonfire of Gnosis, You don't forsake practice in face of misfortune, dispeller of foes of the Bodhi-path—homage!
sangs rgyas rnams kyi phrin las bdag mo/ / sku gsung thugs dang rdzu 'phrul kun 'gro/ / stobs bcu ma lus pha rol phyin ma/ / dbang phyug brgyad ldan khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
You whose nature's the Buddhas' activities! You with [their] Body, Speech, Mind, magic powers, Omnipresence, ten powers, all Perfections! You of eight Masteries[10]—homage to You!
sku yi rang bzhin shes bya'i dkyil 'khor/ / sbros pa dang bral nam mkha'i rang bzhin/ / chos kyi skya la gzugs sku rnam gnyis/ / sna tshogs du mar sbrul la phyag 'tshal/ /
Your Bodies' nature, the sphere of knowables:[11] Dharmakāya of space nature, free Of elaboration; and two Form-bodies You emanate many and varied—homage!
a li ka li tshos kyi g+han d+he/ / gsung dbyangs yan lag drug cu'i dbyangs kyis/ / tshogs drug yul la rang bzhin med pa'i/ / stong pa'i sgra sgrog khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
Your voice of the sixty melodious aspects, a Dharma bell[12] of vowels and consonants, Proclaims to objects of six classes[13] Voidness of non-inherent existence—homage!
'byor pa bral nas gzhan gyi sgo rtsar/ / rdza chag dum bur zas skom slong ba'i/ / mi des khyod kyi bsngags pa brjod na/ / rgyal srid ster mdzad khyad 'a phyag 'tshal/ /
One who, devoid of wealth, begs food and drink in potsherds at others' doors, If she should recite Your praises, You grant a kingdom—homage to You!
ri mo'i gzugs kyis a li ka lis/ / brgyan pa'i yang dag don gyi glegs bam/ / shes rab pha rol phyin pa'i bad ga nyid/ / ar+ya ta ra khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
Through Your pictorial image, a book of true meaning, adorned with the alphabet, Is of the Perfection of Wisdom's nature— Ārya-tārā, homage to You!
gti mug sgrol ba'i shes rab ral gris/ / nyon mongs mi shes 'khor ba'i g.yul bzlog / rmongs pa'i ma rig mun rum 'thug po/ / sel mdzad sgrol ma khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
With sword of wisdom that frees from delusion You rout defiled ignorance, saṃsāra's force. Lamp that dispels the dense darkness of bewildered unknowing—homage to You!
pad+ma dang ni zla ba'i gdan la/ / g.yas brkyang ba la g.yon pa bskum pa'i/ / zhabs kyi mthil la pad+ma'i 'dab ma/ / stong dang ldan pa khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
You, on lotus and moon seat, extend Your right leg and fold the left, Having a thousand lotus petals [beneath] Your soles—homage to You!
dus gsum rgyal ba kun gyi yum du/ / mtshon pa'i ud pal che'u legs ldan/ / phyag na 'khor lo rtsibs ma stong tshang / / mtshan mchog ldan pa khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
You have a large utpala, showing that You are Mother of all the three times' Conquerors; On Your hands You bear the supreme Marks of wheels with full thousand spokes—homage to You!
khams gsum spong byed bsam gtan rdzogs pas/ / 'ching ba'i thag pa mtha' dag gcad de/ / srid gsum 'dam gyis gos pa med ma/ / 'khor ba las sgrol khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
Your perfect dhyāna, which abandons the three Realms, cuts all binding ropes; Unstained by mud of the three becomings You save from saṃsāra—homage to You!
'khor los sgyur ba rgyal po'i cha lugs/ / rin chen bye brag du mas sbras pa'i/ / dbu skra 'thon 'thing lcang lor 'khyil ba'i/ / mi bskyod pas brgyan khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
Bedecked with many kinds of jewels like garb of a universal monarch, Your hair, dark blue[14] and coiled in braids, is adorned with Aksobhya—homage to You!
gang gis sgrol ma'i sku yi gzugs brnyan/ / mthong ba la ni mos gus skyes pa/ / dran pa tsam gyis ngan song sdug bsngal/ / ma lus sel mdzad khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
In whoever sees the image of Tārā's form, conviction grows; The thought alone dispels all sufferings of realms of woe-homage to You!
swA hA oM gyi phreng ba 'khor bas/ / sngags kyi nus pa nor bu sman ltar/ / rten 'brel sna tshogs 'char bar byed pa'i/ / phren las 'byung gnas khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
Encircled by garland of svāhā and oṃ, full of mantric power, jewels and medicines, Source of the rites that make arise diverse conditions—homage to You!
sku gsung thugs kyi yon tan rdzogs pas/ / smon 'jug mthar phyin 'gro ba'i don la/ / brtson 'grus myur mgyogs glog dang 'dra ma/ / le lo tshar gcod /khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
Complete in virtues of body, speech, mind, You've perfected wish and engaging:[15] Your energy's Swift as lightning to benefit beings, Ender of laziness—homage to You!
bag chags dang ni las grol nas/ / skye sgo bzhi chod yangs srid med pas/ / 'khrul med yon tan pha rol phyin ma/ / sngon sbyangs mya ngan 'das la phyag 'tshal/ /
bud med sgrol ma'i ming can de la/ / mos pa skyes nas gus phyag 'tshal na/ / de yis bsod nams sangs rgyas rgyur 'gyur/ / mthong thos don yod khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
If to a woman whose name is Tārā one develops respect and pays devout homage, The merits of this will be cause of Buddhahood-to You worthwhile to see and hear, homage!
nags tshal e ran ta'i gseb tu/ / tsan dan sa mchog skyes pa bzhin du/ / 'gro ba'i don mdzad lha rnams nang na/ / khyad du 'phags pa khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
Like white sandalwood growing among castor-oil plants (eraṇḍa) in a forest, Among the deities aiding migrators You are superior—homage to You!
mi 'jigs rnam pa bzhi po brnyes nas/ / bdag med seng+ge'i sgra chen bsgrags pas/ / 'jig tshogs lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis/ / 'joms par mdzad ma khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
You've found the four kinds of Fearlessness,[16] and with lion's roar proclaiming Selflessness Subdue the sixty-two wrong views of the personality[17]—homage to You!
rgyu skar tshogs nang nyi zla bzhin du/ / che ba rnams kyis nang nas khyad par/ / 'phags pa ri rab lhun po lta bu/ / 'gran zla med pa khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
As the sun and moon stand out like Mount Meru by their greatness Midst the constellations, You are without rival—homage to You!
bzhin bzang lam du zhugs pa'i dus der/ / khyod la gsol ba btab nas phyin na/ / dgra rkun nyes pa mtha' dag mi 'byung / / skyabs gnas bzang mo khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
When, Fair-faced, one sets out on a journey, if she goes making request to You, No harm from foes or robbers arises— Excellent Refuge, homage to You!
yud tsam mos pa byas pa des ni/ / 'bas bu ci bsam 'grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur/ / 'dod pa'i re ba skong bar mdzad ma/ / yid bzhin nor 'dra khyod la phyag 'tshal/ /
A moment's conviction becomes the cause to achieve whatever result one wishes; You who fulfil [all] hopes desired like a wish-granting jewel—homage to You!
'gro ba che'i 'du byed gtong ba'i/ / dus der mtshan mchog ta ra thos pas/ / des ni srid pa hrul por byed 'gyur/ / 'khor ba dag par mdzad la phyag 'tshal/ /
When a migrator is leaving this life's formations, to hear the supreme name, tārā, tears her becoming[18] in pieces, You who purify saṃsāra—homage!
'gro mgon khyod la bskyabs pa'i mi de/ / gnyen bshes rnams kyis spang bar gyur kyang / / ya rabs gong ma rnams kyis khur 'gyur/ / snang ba khul bar mdzad la phyag 'tshal/ /
A person with refuge in You, the Protector of beings, although her friends may desert her, Is taken in charge by superior people, O shedderof light—homage to You!
hu lu hu lu ta ra zhes pa'i/ / tshig de brdzod pa tsam gyis kyang ni/ / mkha' la spyod pa'i gnas su skye 'gyur/ / ngo mtshar bla na med la phyag 'tshal/ /
Simply by uttering the words, 'Hulu-hulu[19] Tārā!', one Will be reborn in a land of sky-soarers,[20] Highest of Marvels - homage to You!
[Benefits]
gang gi mu tig phreng ba'i bstod pa/ / 'di brjod yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab/ / sbyar dug la sogs 'khrul 'khor mi tshugs/ / 'jigs pa ma lus kun las skyob gyur/ /
Reciting this Pearl-garland Praise has inconceivable qualities. Poison and other contrivances cannot affect one; one's saved from every danger.
dud 'gro'i rna bar thos pas kyang ni/ / bsod nams de yis bde 'gro'i lus 'thob/ / 'khor lo bsgyur rgyal bran bzhin bka' nyan/ / ci bsam pa ni rtag tu 'grub 'gyur/ /
The merits of hearing it even with an animal's ears win a happy-realm body. Emperors hear one's orders like servants. One always accomplishes what one wishes.
lan grangs nyi shu rtsa gcig brjod na/ / dus min 'chi dang nad rnams phyir sol/ / 'di ni 'du ba 'joms pa'i sman yin/ / rgyal po'i chad pa las ni grol 'gyur/ /
If one recites it twenty-one times, untimely death and disease are abolished. It is a medicine subduing the body (?). It will free one from royal punishment.
rgyud la yon tan sna tshogs 'char zhing / / de yi bsgrub pa mtha' ru phyin 'gyur/ /
dri ma med pa'i snying po'i don mchog / bton pas rgyud la skye bar byed de/ / ting nge 'dzin stong phrag brgyad cu'i sgo 'byed/ / srid pa'i dra ba bcom nas 'tshang rgya/ /
Recitation makes grow in one the supreme, essential, immaculate meaning, And eighty thousand samādhi-doors opening, destroys becoming's net-one Awakens.
[Dedication]

lha mo khyod la mu tig phreng bas/ /
bstod pa'i bsod nams zla ba rgyas 'dra/ / 'gro rnams snying gi mun pa sel nas/ / ye shes snang ba shar bar shog cig /
May the merit of praising You, Goddess, with [this] Pearl Garland, like a full moon Dispel the darkness in beings' hearts and make light of wisdom-knowledge shine!

mu tig phreng ba'i bstod pa zhes bya ba/ 'phags ma sgrol ma la rig pa'i gnas rnam pa lnga la ma rmongs pa snyan ngag mkhan po rnams kyi gtsug gi nor bu lta bu/ slob dpon chen po tsan tra go mi 'am 'chi med zla ba zhes bya bas bstod pa rdzogs so// //

The Pearl Garland Praise, a praise of Ārya-Tārā by the great master Candragomin, also called the Immortal Moon, who was undeluded[21] about the five sciences and like the crown jewel of poets, is complete.

rgya gar gyi mkhan po ti paM ka ra shI dz+nya na'i zhal snga nas bod kyi ban d+he sgra bsgyur gyi lots+tsha ba nag tso tshul khrims rgyal bas bi ka ma la sh+r+'i la'i gtsug lag khang du bsgyur zhing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o// //

It was translated, revised and finalized under the eyes of the Indian upādhyāya Dīpaṃkara-Śrījñāna by the venerable Tibetan translator Lotsawa Nakts'o Ts'ültr'im Gyälwa, at the Vikramaśīla vihāra. [Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson.]

d.crumb: 'phags ma lha mo sgrol ma la bstod pa

f.d: 'phags ma lha mo sgrol ma la bstod pa

d.crumb: praise of the noble goddess tārā (Candragomin)

f.d: PRAISE OF THE NOBLE GODDESS TĀRĀ (By Candragomin)
@##/ /rgya gar skad du/_Ar+ya tA re de bI sto tra nA ma/ bod skad du/_'phags ma lha mo sgrol ma la bstod pa zhes bya ba/
(Ārya-devī-tārā-stotra)[22] PRAISE OF THE NOBLE GODDESS TĀRĀ
rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the Goddess Tārā![23]
bzlog dka' srid pa'i mun pa ni/ / 'joms byed nyi ma'i 'od dang mtshungs/ / thugs rjes brlan pa'i thugs mnga' ba/ / sgrol ma la ni rtag tu 'dud/ /
Saṃsāra's darkness, hard to repel, You overcome like light of the sun. To You with mind moist with compassion, Tārā, I forever bow.
shin tu rno ba'i sems rnams kyis/ / glang po che rnams gsol byed pa/ / lha mo seng ge khros pa yang / / khyod bstod pa las 'jigs shing 'bros/ /
Through You, Goddess, angry lions, who can slay great elephants Endowed with mind exceeding sharp,[24] are scared and run away on sight.[25]
mche ba'i mdung rtse rnon po yis/ / brag 'joms shing gi rtsa ba 'don/ / khyod kyi sngags ni bzlas pa las/ / 'jigs shing glang chen 'bros par 'gyur/ /
With the tip of his spear-point tusks he can split rocks or uproot trees; But when Your mantra is recited the elephant runs away, afraid.
phyogs dang nam mkha' ma lus pa/ / du bas khyab cing bzod par dka'/ / 'bar ba yis ni khro tshig pa/ / khyod bstod char pas me zhir 'gyur/ /
Hard to bear, it fills all space and quarters, overpoweringly,[26] Burning one's couch[27] with its blaze; and yet the rain of Your praise puts out the fire.
ma rungs gdengs ka las byung ba'i/ / phuT sgra sgrogs shing dug mang can/ / sbrul ni lha mo khyod bstod pas/ / nam mkha' lding ni bzhin du 'jigs/ /
Emitting hisses, which arise from its whole[28] hood, venomous,[29] A snake is frightened by Your praise, Goddess, as by agaruḍa's might.
ral gris gcod cing 'dral ba rnams/ / khrag gis yan lag bskus pa ste/ / khyod kyi ming tsam dran pa yis/ / chom rkun nus pa med par 'gyur/ /
Though they cut travellers[30] with swords and their limbs are stained with blood, Just because they hear Your name[31] robbers will become powerless.
rgyal po khros pas bran rnams kyi/ / skra nas bzung zhing zhags pas bcings/ / btson ra spangs te lha mo kye/ / khyod la bstod byed 'jigs med 'gyur/ /
When seized by the hair and bound in chains by servants of an angry king, One who praises You, O Goddess Who saves from prison, will have no fear.
dba' rlabs tshogs kyis phyogs bcu dang / / nam mkha' yang dag khyab byed pa/ / gru log na yang rgya mtsho las/ / khyod kyi 'phangs ni pha rol phyin/ /
When masses of waves fill up the ten directions and even the sky, Your servant,[32] in the ocean after shipwreck, reaches the other side.
khrag dang klad pa'i 'dam gyis byugs/ / de dag bza' ba la chags pa/ / khyod la bstod pa tsam gyis ni/ / sha za de ltar 'jigs par 'gyur/ /
Smeared with a slime of blood and brains, which they are fond of devouring, Piśācas, Goddess, are scared off by recitation of Your mantra.[33]
yan lag chad cing dri nga ba/ / khrag dang rnag ni sna nas 'dzag / khyod la bstod pa tsam gyis ni/ / mdze can 'dod pa'i lha 'drar 'gyur/ /
Lepers with tom limbs, noses adrip with stinking blood and bodily ooze, Just by gathering before You[34] become like gods of the Realm of Desire.
bkres skom gyis gdungs gcer bu dang / / slong ba [{]yi dgas [,]yi dwags [}]dang 'dra ba/ / khyod la bstod pa tsam gyis ni/ / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur/ /
Beggars resembling hungry ghosts,[35] naked, tortured[36] with hunger and thirst, Just by bowing down to You[37] are transformed into emperors.
'jigs pa chen po 'jigs byed pa/ / de ltar sems nas khyod bstod pas/ / dge ba gang bsags de yis ni/ / 'jig rten bde ba can thob shog /
By the virtue I've amassed through thus praising You, Pure One,[38] Frightener-off[39] of the Great Fears, may the world gain happiness![40]
'phags ma sgrol ma'i bstod pa slob dpon chen po tsan+d+ra go mis mdzad pa rdzogs so// //
The praise of the Goddess Tārā by Master Candragomin is complete. [Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson.]

It is said that with [this] Praise, the Master made a wooden image of Tārā raise Her forefinger. When he asked, 'Why do You do that?', She replied, 'This praise of yours is well-spoken.' She was known as the Tārā of the Raised Forefinger [41]
seng ge glang chen me sbrul chom rkun dang / / lcags sgrog chu dang sha za'i 'jigs pa ni/ / 'joms mdzad zla 'od phung po ltar 'dzin ma/ / sgrol ma bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal 'dud/ /

d.crumb: 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa smon lam grub pa

f.d: 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa smon lam grub pa
A PRAISE OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ, CALLED THE ACCOMPLISHER OF VOWS (By Candragomin)
@##/ /rgya gar skad du/ Ar+ya tA rA sto traM b+hi sa karmA sA d+ha nA ma/ bod skad du/ 'phags ma sgrol ma'i bstod pa phrin las sgrub pa zhes bya ba/
(Ārya-tārā-stotra-praṇidhāna-[Siddhi-]nāma)[42] A PRAISE OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ, CALLED THE ACCOMPLISHER OF VOWS
bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the Venerable Arya-Tārā!
tAM yig ljang gu ut+pal las byung ba'i/ / sgrol ma sku mdog ljang gu zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma/ / phyag gnyis sku la rin chen sna tshogs spras/ / yi dam sgrol ma lha la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
Appearing from an utpala and green syllable, Green of body, with one face and two arms, Body and arms bedecked with many jewels, To You, special deity[43] Tārā, homage and praise!
don grub la sogs rigs lngas dbu brgyan cing / / bcu drug lo lon 'dzum pa'i bzhin dang ldan/ / gzi brjid bzod dka' sna tshogs lhag par 'dud/ / yi dam sgrol ma lha la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
Five Jinas, like Amoghasiddhi, adorn Your crown. Sixteen years old, You have a smiling face. Your dazzling radiance ever subdues hosts of foes. To You, special deity Tārā, homage and praise!
phyag g.yas mchog sbyin phyag g.yon ut+pal 'dzin/ / sna tshogs pad+ma zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la/ / g.yas brkyang g.yon bskum tshul gyis rab tu bzhugs/ / yi dam sgrol ma lha la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
Your right hand grants boons; Your left holds an utpala. On variegated lotus and sun[44] disk You sit with right leg out and left leg folded. [To You, special deity Tārā, homage and praise!]
thugs rje'i spyan gyis 'gro la rtag tu gzigs/ / sku la 'jigs pa brgyad skyob sgrol ma 'phro/ / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal kun las sgrol byed pa'i/ / yi dam sgrol ma lha la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
Forever You look on beings with eyes of compassion. Your body emanates Taras who save from the eight fears. Rescuing from all saṃsāra's sorrows, To You, special deity Tārā, homage and praise!
zhi dang rgyas dang dbang dang drag po dang / / las tshogs thams cad myur du grub mdzad ma/ / phrin las thams cad yongs su grub byed pa'i/ / yi dam sgrol ma lha la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /

Making the Calming, Increasing, Subjugating, Fierce rites and All Rites[45] be accomplished fast, You carry out swiftly the ocean of [Buddha-] activities; To You, special deity Tārā, homage and praise!
seng ge glang chen me sbrul chom rkun dang / / lcags sgrog chu dang bgegs dang 'jigs pa brgyad/ / 'jigs pa kun las yongs su sgrol byed pa'i/ / yi dam sgrol ma lha la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
Saving completely from all the eight fears— Lions, elephants, fire, serpents and robbers, Fetters, the ocean, and piśāca demons— To You, special deity Tārā, homage and praise!
gdon dang rims dang smyo 'bog la sogs dang / / gnod byed la sogs dus min 'chi bas skrag / sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi byed pa'i/ / yi dam sgrol ma lha la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
[You pacify fully every suffering, such as Demons of sickness, plagues, insanity, Yakṣas and other fears of untimely death; To You, special deity Tārā, I pay homage.]
skye bo sngon bsags las dang nyon mongs kyi/ / mtshams med lnga dang mi dge bcu sogs sdig / sdig pa'i las rnams bdag gis ci bsags pa/ / de dag thams cad ma lus byang bar shog /
Karma amassed in past lives, and defilements; Whatever unbearable evil acts I've done, Such as the five immediate and ten unwholesome— Let all these be purified without remainder!
bdag ni da ltar skye ba 'di la yang / / rmi ngan mtshan ngan 'chi ltas dus min skrag / bkra mi shis pa thams cad dag gyur nas/ / tshe dang bsod nams longs spyod rgyas par shog /
In this my present rebirth also, let Bad dreams, ill omens, and untimely death, Foes and all ill fortune be cleared away, While lifetime, merits and enjoyments grow!
bdag ni ma 'ongs skye ba thams cad du/ / yi dam sgrol ma rjes su dran gyur nas/ / mchog dang thun mong dngos grub la sogs pa/ / las tshogs thams cad yid bzhin grub par shog /
In all rebirths yet to come, may I Recollect my special deity, Tārā, Realize all supreme and common siddhis And all my wishes, just as I desire, And govern each and every divine activity!
yi dam sgrol ma thugs rje che ldan pa/ / bdag gis rab tu brtse ba'i gdung sems kyis/ / bstod pa bgyis pa'i bsod nams gang bsags des/ / yi dam sgrol ma lha dang mi 'bral shog /
By the merits I've amassed through praising With intensely striving, longing mind Tārā, the compassionate special deity, Let me, O Worshipful Tārā, not part from You!
'phags ma sgrol ma'i bstod pa phrin las thams cad sgrub pa zhes bya ba/ slob dpon tsan+d+ra go mis mdzad pa rdzogs so//
The Praise of the Venerable Tārā called the Accomplisher of All Vows is by the great Master Candragomin. [Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson].
