f.d: @/ /'phags ma sgrol ma 'jigs pa chen po brgyad las sgrol ba'i bstod pa/

d.crumb: praise of ārya-tārā who saves from the eight great fears (Candragomin)

f.d: PRAISE OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ WHO SAVES FROM THE EIGHT GREAT FEARS (By Candragomin)
@#/ /rgya gar skad du/ ar+ya ta ra ma hA aSh+Ta b+ha yod ta re sta ba/ bod skad du/ 'phags ma sgrol ma 'jigs pa chen po brgyad las sgrol ba'i bstod pa/
(Ārya-tārā-mahā-aṣṭabhayôttārā-stava)[45] PRAISE OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ WHO SAVES FROM THE EIGHT GREAT FEARS
rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the Venerable Arya-Tārā!

khyod zhabs lha dang lha min ma lus phyag byas shing / / thugs rjes ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i sems can rnams la gzigs/ / mi mthun spangs pa'i sgrol ma khyod la ni/ / zla ba sbas pa zhes bya bdag gis bstod par bgyi/ /
All gods and asuras pay homage at Your feet. You look with compassion on beings in ill migrations. Tārā, Who's left off [all] that is unfitting! I, Candragupta,[46] shall write a praise to You.

glang po bsad pa'i khrag gis rkang lag dmar gyur cing / / lam du zhugs pa mthong nas rnam par gnon byed pa'i/ / seng+ge lam du khyod dran pas ni bgrod dka' ba'i/ / nags tshal shin tu rab tu stug por 'jug par 'gyur/ /
Paws red with blood of elephants it's slain, The lion sees the traveller and advances.[47] If on the way one thinks of You, it enters A forest extremely dense and hard to cross.
bar med myos chus dri ma can gyi khur tshos la/ / bung ba lding ba zar zing tshogs kyi sgras g.yos pa/ / yud tsam mi sdod gsod pa'i lam du ni/ / sgrol khyod la btud bcom par byas par 'gyur/ /
Spurred by the noise of swarms of millions of bees Circling his cheeks, which rut-fluid stains all over, Not pausing a moment, on his way to kill— If one salutes You, Tārā, he's[48] subdued.
'jig dus rlung stobs che bas spar ba yi/ / gnam ltar rgya che rab tu 'bar ba'i me/ / grong khyer 'ga' zhig gal te khyod kyi ming / / brjod byed de mod nye bar zhi bar 'gyur/ /
Kindled by fierce wind as of the Age of Destruction, Fire is blazing up as vast as the sky; Should some citizen[49] call upon Your name, Then immediately it is extinguished.
'khreg cing 'khyogs pa can gyi ri sul ljongs/ / lam zhugs mthong nas lam du rgyug pa yis/ / sbrul stobs che ba sgrol ma dran pa yis/ / dreg pa slar bcom phyir yang bzlog par byed/ /
In a constricted, tortuous, cave-like[50] valley, The mighty serpent spots the traveller and Darts up the path; but to remember Tārā Puts down its pride[51] and turns it back again.
chom rkun mtshon cha sna tshogs thogs pa yis/ / lam zhugs mthong nas nam par gnon pa yang / / sgrol ma'i zhabs ni dran pa'i stobs kyis su/ / yun mi ring bar bde bar khyim du 'gro/ /
Robbers brandishing various sharp weapons See the traveller and advance upon her; But by the power of thinking of Venerable Tārā, In no great time she safely reaches home.
nyin re brnyes nas smon byed la mkhas pa'i/ / sa yi bdag pos btson rar bcings pa yang / / khong sgril mi bzad sgrol ma'i zhabs dran pas/ / skad cig gis ni dum bu brgya chu 'gyur/ /
A lord of the earth,[53] who's skilled at making wishes Daily fulfilled, has one bound in prison; But think of Worshipful Tārā, and in a moment The unbearable shackles will be in a hundred pieces.
gyen du 'khrug pas tshangs gnas tsam 'phags shing / / nya dang chu srin 'jigs skrag byed pa'i lus/ / rgya mtsho'i dbus su gzings zhig gyur pa yang / / sgrol ma dran pas mi 'jigs pa nyid 'thob/ /
One's ship is broken amidst an ocean whose Commotion towers up high as the Brahma heavens, [By] fish and sea-monsters of terrifying forms;[54] But thinking of Tārā, one finds security.
lus ni mig sman dang 'dra sga ser skya/ / skams shing ltogs la lhag par rgyus pas 'brel/ / mi gsod byed pa la ni dga' ba yi/ / ro langs khyod zhabs dran pas bcom par 'gyur/ /
Tawny-haired vetāla demons, their bodies like kohl, Lean[55] and hungry, held together by prominent Sinews, delighting in slaying human beings, Will be subdued if one remembers You.
de ltar 'jigs pa brgyad las sgrol ba yi/ / bdud las rgyal ma dran pa'i bsod nams ni/ / gang zhig 'di ru bdag gi thob pa des/ / 'jig rten mtha' dag ma lus rig par shog /
Through the merit that I have gained here Thinking of Her victorious over the Māras Who in this way saves from the eight fears, May She be known to all the entire world!
'phags ma sgrol ma 'jigs pa chen po brgyad las sgrol ba'i bstod pa/ slob dpon dpal btsun zla ba'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so// //
The Praise of Ārya-Tārā Who Saves from the Eight Great Fears, by the Venerable Master Śri-Candragomin,[56] is complete. [Translated from the Tibetan bu Martin Willson.]

d.crumb: rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la kha che nye ma sbas pas bstod pa

f.d: rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la kha che nye ma sbas pas bstod pa
PRAISE OF THE THIRTY-TWO NAMES OF THE VENERABLE ĀRYA-TĀRĀ CALLED THE JEWEL-ORNAMENT-LIKE FULFILLER OF ALL AIMS (By Sūryagupta)
@#/ /rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la kha che nye ma sbas pas bstod pa bzhugs so/ /

([Ārya-tārā-bhaṭṭārikā-nāma-dvātriṃśatka-stotra Sarvārtha-sādhaka-ratnālaṃkāra-saṃnibha-nāma]) PRAISE OF THE THIRTY-TWO NAMES OF THE VENERABLE ĀRYA-TĀRĀ CALLED THE JEWEL-ORNAMENT-LIKE FULFILLER OF ALL AIMS
@##// /rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the Venerable Ārya-Tārā!
[Introduction]
rang bzhin mtha' bral yid 'ong mngon dga'i zhing / / yon tan lun grub bde chen rnam dag pa'i/ / chos kyi mtho bas dpal ldan po ta la/ / 'dod yon rin chen sbas pa'i zhing khams na/ /
Of boundless nature, a pleasant, delightful place, Potala's charming, high in properties Of pure Great Bliss and spontaneous virtues. In This land provided with precious sense-enjoyments,
gnyis med 'od gsal dbyings las ma bskyod kyang / / 'od dpag med pa'i thugs rje yin chen ltar/ / 'dzam gling chags chen skye bo'i don bsgub phyir/ / bud med mtshan dpes gzhan la snang mdzad nas/ /
Amitābha's jewel-like Compassion, Though he stirs not from the brilliant non-dual sphere,[8] Appears to others as Woman with Marks and Signs To benefit people of our world,[9] great in attachment.
sa bcu'i dbang phyug byams sems rig 'dzin dang / / rta mgrin la sogs khro rgyal khro mo dang / / lha dang lha min gnod sbyin dri za'i tshogs/ / rig pa'i rgyal mo la sogs skal bzang ma/ /
This Fortunate She, with friendly Masters of The Ten Stages, Knowledge-holders, fierce deities[10] such as Hayagrīva, hosts of gods, asuras, Yakṣas, gandharvas, Queens of Knowledge and others,
bstan pa rgya mtsho nam mkha'i rin chen mdzod/ / zab cing rgya che re skong dpag dka'i bcud/ / brjod pas don che thog mtha' bar dge ba/ / 'jigs dang sdug bsngal nyon mongs las grol ba/ /

Parts never in the three times[11] from the realized meaning Of the space-like gem-store of the ocean of Doctrine, The vast, profound essence, fulfilling hopes, hard to fathom, Useful to speak of, pure in its start, end and middle,
rtogs pa'i don la dus gsum 'du 'bral med/ / 'gro la mos pa'i skabs dang dus snang zhing / / sdig pa dag byed mtshan mtshog sum cu gnyis/ / thos pas grol phyir gzhan la brjod par bya/ /

Released from fears, defilements and sufferings. At wanted occasions and times She appears to migrators. Her thirty-two supreme Names, which purify evil, I'll tell to others, that they may be saved through hearing.
[The thirty-two Names]
chos nyid sbros bral bde chen zab mo'i don/ / gnyis med blang dor med par thugs su chud / / mtshan ma'i rtog pa skye med dbyings su grol/ / dus gsum gcig tu mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas ma/ /

Buddhā! knowing all the three times as one, You pierce the Deep Meaning, Great Bliss and the simple True Nature, Non-dual, with nothing to accept or reject, Released from conceptions of signs, in the unborn sphere![12]
dgongs pa'i don la mnyam nyid mi g.yo yang / / brtse ba'i thugs rjes sems can gzhan don la/ / mdzad pa'i thabs kyis gang la gang 'dul ba'i/ / ma nges cir yang 'char ba'i sprul pa ma/ /
Emanator! appearing in manners indefinite, Taming all by means of Deeds for the good Of other sentient beings with loving compassion, Though unmoved from Sameness as to the intended aim![13]
shin tu dpag med ya nga'i gnas rnams su/ / 'jig pa brgyad sogs gdon gyis nyen pa la/ / bsnyems pa med pa 'phrul gyis blo gros kyis/ / 'khor gyi 'jigs pa sel ba'i rje blon ma/ /
Chief Guide![14] You dispel saṃsāra's fears, Such as the eight fears, by magic, intelligently, Without pride, in those evil spirits oppress, In places of exceeding measureless terror!
gzhon nu'i lus la tshul khrims dri bsgom nas/ / khrel yod ngo tsha shes pa'i gsang gos bskris/ / chog shes rnam dag mdzes pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan/ / 'chal pa'i skyon gyis ma gos khrims btsun ma/ /

You of noble morals! In youthful body, You're used To the scent of morality, not clad in immoral faults But in secret robes of consideration and conscience; The beautiful ornament, pure contentment, adorns You.
rnam shes sdug bsngal rgya mtshor bying ba la/ / 'dren pa'i thugs rje thabs kyi zhags pa yis/ / 'gro drug byang tshub skam sar 'don mdzad pa'i/ / srid pa'i skyon gyis ma gos khyad 'phags ma/ /

Superior One! Unstained by Saṃsāric faults, With the cord of kindly compassionate Means[15] You fish out Migrators of six realms, their consciousness sunk in the ocean Of sorrow, onto the dry land of Awakening.
snang stong gnyis med mkha' da byings zung mjug cing / / rtogs pa'i rigs pas gnas lugs don la sbyor/ / ting 'dzin thabs kyis bde ba'i ye shes bskyed/ / dus gsum sangs rgyas bskyed pa'i yum gcig ma/ /

Sole Mother producing the Buddhas of the three times! Through samādhi applying united intuitive knowledge Of the sphere of non-dual appearance[16] and Void to its object, The Mode of Existence, You generate blissful Gnosis.
skye rgas na 'chi'i chu bo rgal dka' ba'i/ / rgyad lnga mi dge rab kar 'khyam pa la/ / snying rdze byang chub sems kyis gru gzings kyis/ / sdug bsngal chu bo sgrol ba'i kun sgrol ma/ /

Saviouress! ferrying over the river of suffering The five lines,[17] who wander in agony of unvirtue In hard-to-cross floods of birth, aging, sickness and death With Your boat of Bodhicitta and Compassion!
'gro ba 'gron po srid pa'i lam rgyun rnams/ / zag med bde ba'i nor gyis 'phongs pa la/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i rin chen gser gling gis/ / thar pa'i grong du 'dren pa'i ded dpon ma/ /
Leader! Who guides to Liberation's city The caravan of migrators on saṃsāra's roads, Bereft of the wealth of uncontaminate Bliss, By the land of gold and jewels of Omniscience!
khams gsum 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal khang pa na/ / dug gsum gcong gis zin pa'i nad pa rnams/ / dam chos bdud rtsi sman gyis chu rgyun gyis/ / sdug bsngal zug rngu sel ba'i sman mdzad ma/ /

Doctor! removing the pain of suffering from The patients gripped by that chronic disease, the three poisons, In triple-realmed saṃsāra's house of sorrow, With streams of healing nectar of True Dharma!
'dod bas gdung ba'i skye bo chags can la/ / rin chen gter mdzod 'phags pa'i nor bdun dang / / zag med yon tan gdul bya'i bsam pa bzhin/ / dgos 'dod re ba skong ba'i nor bu ma/ /
Jewel! fulfilling hopes, desires and needs Of greedy beings tormented with desire, A storehouse of riches, the Āryas' seven Treasures And uncontaminate virtues at disciples' will!
snyigs ma'i skal par nad mtshon mu ge'i/ / sems can dus min blo bur 'chi ba la/ / skye 'chi 'pho 'gyur med par thugs chud nas/ / dus gsum bsgres rgud med pa'i rigs 'dzin ma/ /

Bearer of Knowledge![18] of no change or decay In the three times, perceiving there's no birth or passing away In the sudden untimely death of beings by sickness, Weapons or famine in this degenerate eon!
rang rgyud nyes pa'i dmig gis bcom pa la/ / bzod pa'i go gyon shes rab mtshon cha yis/ / nyon mongs log dpung rnams 'jom mdzad cing / / 'khor ba'i g.yul las rgyal ba'i dpa' mdzad ma/ /
Heroine! victorious over saṃsāra; Wearing the armour of Patience, with Wisdom's sword You overcome the troops of perverse defilements In those overpowered by the faults in their own mind.
'gro kun srid pa'i nyes pas skom pa la/ / chags med bdud rtsi'i chu yis 'gro rnams la/ / rgyun chad med par rab tu tshim byed cing / / nad med chos kyi 'khor lo rab bskor ma/ /
Turner of the wheel of healthy Dharma! Uninterruptedly satisfying migrators, Thirsty because of the faults of Becoming in all Migrations, with water of nectar of non-attachment!
gzi brjid 'od kyis gza' bdud zil gyis gnon/ / mkhyen pa'i zer gyis blo'i pad+mo 'byed/ / thugs rje'i 'od kyis srid pa'i chu klung skems/ / mthon dman kun la gsal ba'i rta bdun ma/ /
lha bran skar tshogs nang na zla nya'i zhal/ / nyes pa'i gza' bral sgrib pa'i rab rib bsal/ / nyon mongs gdung ba'i tshul khrims bsil zer can/ / yon tan ri bong 'dzin phyir yid 'ong zla rgyas ma/ /

Full Moon! pleasant since bearing the hare of virtues![21] With full-moon face 'midst constellations of servitors,[22] Free of bad planets, You clear obscurations' poor vision, Your rays of Morality cool for those scorched by defilements.
bsam gtan rdzid bur nyams kyi pad sdong 'khrungs/ / drod rtag lo 'dab bde ba'i de sar rgyas/ / gdangs ba'i dri bsung ba'i 'khor tshogs tshims/ / bying rgod 'dam gyis ma gos chu skyes ma/ /

Lotus! Your stem of mind grown in the pool of dhyāna, You're unstained by mud of agitation and fading. Your petals of Heat-signs[23] and stamens of bliss have developed. Open, Your sweet scent satisfies swarms of bees.[24]
rnam dag gangs rir nub pa'i rtsal che rdzogs/ / rigs pa'i mchu sder mu stegs ri dgas 'joms/ / bdag med sgra'i nyan thos wa tshogs sgrags/ / theg dman zil gyis gnon phyir mi 'jigs ma/ /

Fearless One![25] since You outshine the Hīnayānists, Perfect in skill by Your power in snow mountains of Purity, Conquering with reasoning's teeth and claws[26] tīrthika beasts, Frightening the śrāvaka fox-pack with roar of Non-self.
dga' ba'i tshal nas byang chub stobs chen rdzogs/ / ting 'dzin chang gi nus mthus glang chen myos/ / dran pa'i mtshon chas bag med g.yul ngo 'joms/ / mos pa'i rgya mtshor 'jug pa'i rab brtan ma/ /

Very firm one![27] entering the sea of conviction, Perfect in Bodhi's strength in the garden of Joy, An elephant drunk by the power of the wine of samādhi, Conquering recklessness with the sword of mindfulness!
'khor ba myang na thang la 'khyam pa la/ / theg chen myur 'gyog shugs kyi zhon pa la/ / rdzu 'phrul rkang pas theg chen lam bsgrod nas/ / smon lam shes rab rdzogs pa'i cang shes ma/ /
Thoroughbred! perfect in wisdom and vow, You take The wanderers in the desert of saṃsāra On Mahāyāna's swift mount over the way Of Mahāyāna, on feet of psychic power.[28]
nyon mong dug la spyod kyang zhen pa med/ nyes tshogs skyon gyis ma gos sku mdog mdzes/ / ma yengs chos nyid zab mo'i mdang la gzigs/ / ngo mtshar mdzes pa skyed pa'i rma bya ma/ /

Peahen![29] producing wonderful beauty, unharmed Though You eat the poison of the defilements, of lovely Colour, unstained by faults and hosts of defects; You see undisturbed profound True Nature's splendour.
stong pa'i mkha' ltar lta ba'i gshogs rlabs gcod/ / ngan song gcong rong g.yang sar nyams nga med/ / brdul zhugs mchu sder rtogs pa'i klu rgyal 'joms/ / tshangs pa'i gsung snyan ka la bing ka mA/ /

Kalaviṅkā! with sweet Brahmic voice! Flapping wings of View cut Emptiness[30] like the sky, You have no fear of the cliff of the realms of woe; Bill and claw of practice subdue nāga-kings of conceptions.[31]
bskal pa'i mun nag nyes pa'i rdul khrod du/ / rin chen sems stor btsal ba'i don chen du/ / zhi gnas lhag mthong snum gyis sgron me bskyed/ / ma rig mun pa sel ba'i snang gsal ma/ /

Lamp! removing the darkness of ignorance— For the aim sought by those who've lost their jewel minds In dust-clouds of faults in the black dark of this eon You make a lamp with the oil of Quietude and Insight.
bag chags g.ya' bral kun gzhi me long gis/ / rtog med sgrib pa'i dri ma rnam bsalanas/ / bsal ba'i thugs la brtan pa'i gzugs brnyan shar/ / gnas lugs rang bzhin gsal ba'i mdzes ston ma/ /

Clear revealer of beauty![32] of the Mode of Existence's nature— In the ālaya's mirror, free of the rust of imprints, The stains of conceptless obscurations cleared, Its stable image arises in [Your] clear mind.[33]
lnga phung btson rar yid kyi btsin bu de / / bdag 'dzin nyon mong lcags kyis bcings pa la/ / stong nyid rnam thar rtogs pa'i lde mig gis/ / sdug bsngal 'ching las sgrol ba'i thar byed ma/ /

Liberator! You free from the bondage of suffering The prisoner mind in the prison of the five heaps, Bound in the chains of defilements that grasp a self, With the key of realizing Emptiness-deliverance.[34]
mtshan ma'i yul ngan sdig pa'i smag rum na/ / snyoms las le lo gnyid kyis non pa la/ / brtson 'grus glog dang chos kyi 'brug sgra yis/ / gsal zhing go bar sgrogs pa'i dbyangs chen ma/ /

Great-voiced One! proclaiming for clear understanding With thunder of Dharma and lightning of Joyous Effort To those weighed down by sleep and idle laziness In the darkness of sin, in the lair(?)[35] of signs.
'jig tshogs phung po mi gtsang dur khrod nas/ / lta ba'i tshe srog rtag chad mthar shi la/ / byang chub rga shi med pa'i bdud rtsi yis/ / skye 'gag med par gso ba'i bdud rtsi ma/ /

Amṛta! healing without birth or cessation With nectar of Bodhi, deathless and ageless, View's life, Dead in the extremes of permanence and destruction In the cemetery of Personality's filthy heaps![36]
le lo g.yeng ba'i bsod nams ra ba na/ / nyes spyod dgra kun dge ba'i nor 'phrog la/ / dran pa so pa bslab bya nyams skabs su/ / shes bzhin mes rtses bsrung ba'i 'tsho byed ma/ /
Guarding Life-giver! sentinel of alertness In case the watchman of mindfulness breaks instructions When foes of misdeeds all rob the wealth of virtues In merit's stockade of laziness and distraction!
log lta'i than pas dge ba'i myur gu gdungs/ / byams pa'i sprin 'dus thugs rje'i chu rgyun gyis/ / dad pa'i zhing spangs byang chub lo tog rnams/ / smin pas 'jig rten gso ba'i 'tsho byed ma/ /

Life-giver healing the world! since when the sprouts Of virtue are scorched by the drought of perverse view, From Your cloud-mass of Love the downpour of Compassion Soaks Faith's field and ripens the leaves of Bodhi.
nam zhig srog gi dbang po 'gag pa'i tshe/ / bshes gnyen srog dang bral nas gshin rjes khrid/ / nyams thag nga ros 'o dod 'bod pa la/ / 'jigs pa skyob pyir srid gsum gnyen cig ma/ /
Sole Friend in the three becomings! for when the life Faculty ceases, and we are led by Yama, Bereft of life and friends, and scream aloud With roars of pain, You rescue us from fear.
rtsod dus lnga brgya'i skye bo dug lnga rag / sangs rgyas bka' smod mkhas pa'i skul bsngo/ / log ltas byang chub bar chad byed pa'i/ / dgra bo myur du gsod pa'i mkha' 'gro ma/ /

Ḍākiṅī! swiftly killing foes when beings Of five hundred Ages of Strife,[37] with the five gross poisons Abuse Buddha's Word and plague wise people's bodies, And by perverse view obstruct Enlightenment!
shes rab mig bu ma rig ling thog gis/ / mdongs nas mi khom g.yang sar ltung ba la/ / bsdu ba'i lcags kyus bzung nas yang dag lam/ / ma nor drang por 'jug pa'i lam ston ma/ /

Way-shower! When, the film of ignorance blinding Our wisdom eye, we fall down the cliff of unfreedom,[38] You grasp us with the hook of Your [Means of] Attraction And put us unerringly straight on the perfect Path.
sems bkyed stobs dang smon lam 'phel stobs kyis/ / dus gsum mi bshol thugs rje phyi shol med/ / sems can don la 'khor ba ma stong bar/ / dam bcas skyo dub med pa'i byams sems ma/ /
Friendly-minded one! tireless in Your promise To work for beings until saṃsāra's empty, By power of Bodhicitta and growth of vow Of undelayed Mercy, not tarrying in the three times!
rtogs pa'i chos nyid mkha' la 'gro gyur kyang / / gdug pa 'dul phyir khro mo'i skur sprul nas / / sangs rgya[as] bstan pa'i bar chad byed pa yi/ / dgra bo myur du gsod pa'i sgrol byed ma/ /
Saviouress! swiftly killing enemies Who make obstruction to the Buddha's Doctrine When, though You move in the space of realized True Nature, You emanate in fierce forms to subdue the vicious!
[Benefits]
de ltar mtshan gyi me tog bcu rtsa gnyis/ / dpe byad brgyad cu 'bras bu'i bstod pa ni/ / don kun grub byed rin chen rgyan 'drar 'dzes/ / rgyal ba kun gyi bstod pa'i rgyal po mchog /

Such praise of the fruit of the [thir]ty-two[39] flowers of Marks And eighty exemplary Signs is beautiful as A jewel adornment accomplishing every aim, The supreme monarch of praises of all the Conquerors.
mtshan thos pas ni skal pa stong gi bar/ / ngan song mi skye las ngan sdig sgrib 'dzad/ / glo bur 'jigs pa kun las thar byed cing / / blo ldan rigs dang skal par ldan par byed/ /

Through hearing the Names, for a thousand eons you'll not Take woeful rebirth; bad karma, sins, obscurations Are spent; you're freed from all accidental perils; It makes you intelligent, fortunate and well-born.
gang zhig gtsang sbra nang par sngar langs sta/ / sbro zhing gus par mi yengs ting 'dzin gyis/ / gsum 'am 'dun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig sogs/ / klog gam kha ton brjod pa rab bsgrags na/ /
Should you first take purity in the morning[40] Then proclaim them, reciting aloud or reading With undistracted concentration, in joy And devotion, three, seven, twenty-one [times] or more,
tshe rabs sngon gyi las ngan bag chag sad/ / nyon mongs mi dge sdig sgrib 'byang bar byed/ / mtshams med lnga dang nye lnga la sogs/ / sdig pa stobs chen ma lus dag par byed/ /

'Twill consume[41] bad karma and imprints from previous lives, Cleanse defilements, non-virtues, sins, obscurations, And purify every strong evil, such as the five Immediate and the five approaching them.
ngan 'gro sdug bsngal 'ching ba gcod byed cing / / srid pa'i sdug bsngal kun las grol bar 'gyur/ / mchog dang thun mong yon dan rdzogs par byed/ / rgyal ba kun gyi sras su dbang bskur zhing / /
It will cut the bonds of the suffering of realms of woe And free from all the sufferings of saṃsāra. Supreme and ordinary virtues will be perfected. You're consecrated as heir of all the Conquerors.
byams sems mkha' 'gro lha sarin sde brgyad kyis/ / grogs dang rje bor bkur ba'i gnas su mthong / / bag la nyal dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams/ / dag cing sangs rgyas go 'phang myur du 'thob/ /

The Friendly-minded, ḍākinīs and the eight classes Of spirits[42] befriend you and see you in honoured place.[43] Predispositions and obscurations of knowables Are purified and you quickly attain Buddhahood.
tshe 'dir 'jigs pa gnod sbyin srin po dang / / 'byung po ro langs sha za mang po'i tshogs/ / grib gnon la sogs rtsub cing sdang sems kyis/ / gnod pa'i 'jigs pa dran pas sel bar byed/ /
As to fears of this life, remembering clears away Fear of harm by greedy and rough beings, such as Polluting demons and hosts of many yakṣas, Rākṣasas, spirits, vetālas and piśācas.
pha rol dmag tshogs gcan zan mi rgod dang / / rkun po dug sbrul rgyal po'i chad pa dang / / seng ge glang po stag dang me dang chu/ / 'jigs pa brgyad sogs dus min 'chi ba rnams/ /
Hostile armies, wild beasts, savages, The eight fears—robbers, venomous serpents, royal Punishment, lions, elephants, tigers, fire, Water—and other [means of] untimely death:
mtshan 'di dran pas mos pas rab brjod na/ / sdug bsngal zhi zhing sdig las thar par 'gyur/ / mdze dang rims dang dug nad la sogs pa'i/ / gnod pa'i sdug bsngal zhi zhing sel bar byed/ /
Remembering and reciting these Names with conviction Pacifies suffering and liberates from evil. It quells and removes the suffering of such harms As leprosy, epidemics and poisoning.
grags dang bkra shis bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur/ / dpal dang tshe dang rang bzhin rgyas gyur te/ / nor dang longs spyod bu tsa 'phel bar 'gyur/ / shes rab 'phel zhing bstan chos rig par 'gyur/ /

gtsug lag mkhas shing tha snyad rgyal 'gyur te/ / rten 'brel gsal zhing drod rtags yon tan 'byung / / mngon shes 'char zhing skye ba dran par byed/ / gzi brjid ldan zhing yid 'ong mthong dgar 'gyur/ /

Versed in the sciences, you will conquer conventions. Dependence clear, virtues and signs of Heat arise.[44] Superknowledges come; you remember [past] rebirths; You will be radiant, pleasant and bright to behold.

gsung dbyangs tshangs pa'i dbyangs bzhin snyan 'gyur cing / / ngag tshig gsal zhing lus sems dpa' bar byed/ / gang dang gang du skye ba thams cad du/ / sangs rgyas kun gyis rtag tu mi spang zhing / / dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten cing mi 'bral bar/ / 'dod pa'i don nams thams cad 'grub par 'gyur/ /

Your voice will be sweet, resembling the tones of Brahmā; Your true words clear, your body and mind will be strong. Everywhere, wherever you are reborn, You'll never be abandoned by all the Buddhas. Relying inseparably on your Spiritual Friend, You will accomplish all the aims you desire.
rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bstod pa don thams cad grub par byed pa/ rin chen brgyan 'dra zhes bya ba/ kha che nyi ma sbas pas mdzad pa rdzogs so// //

The Praise of the Thirty-two Names of the Venerable Ārya-Tārā called the Jewel-omament-like Fulfiller of All Aims, by Sūryagupta of Kashmir, is complete. [Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson.]
srag+d+ha ra sto tra
SRAGDHARĀ PRAISE OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ (by Sarvajñamitra)
@##/ /rgya gar skad du/ srag+d+ha ra sto tra/ bod skad du/ phreng ba 'dzin pa'i bstod pa/
Ārya-tārā-sragdharā-stotra Sragdharā Praise of Ārya-Tārā
'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
OṂ. Homage to the Venerable Ārya-Tārā!

nyi ma 'char ka'i snang ba ltar dmar lha mchog rnams kyi mgo yi gtsug gi nor bu'i dpal/ / phun sum tshogs pas dmar ba smug rtsi gsal po dngar bkod shin tu yun ring ma lon 'dra'i/ / 'phags ma khyod zhabs dag la thal sbyar cod pan gyis mnan yan lag mchog btud bdag gis ni/ / gus pas sgrol ma phongs skyabs bstod pa gser gyi me tog phreng ba rnams kyis mchod par bgyi/ /

Your feet, O Āryā, Saviouress, Giver of Refuge from misfortune, that are worshipped by highest gods And adorned with red lac tint freshly put on by contact with the splendid perfection of the Lovely jewels on their heads, red like the rising sun's light, I too, head bowed in adoration By pressure of hands joined in a crest,[8] celebrate in devotion with flower garlands of new praises.

skad ngan ngu ba'i bzhin ldan rgal bar dka' ba'i sdug bsngal me la lus dag rnam ltung ba/ / ci dang ci bya zhes rmongs lan gcig min pa'i rtsom pa byas kyang 'bras dang bral bas skyo/ / mkha' la nyi zla'i dpal ni gzhan las mang du thos nas blta bar re ba bcas gyur pa'i/ / mig nyams gzhan gyi 'gro ba lta bu bdag ni sdig 'joms khyed la gus pas rten par bgyid/ /

In the fire of suffering, hard to escape, my body has fallen. Unlucky, I flee in all directions, Perplexed — whatever am I doing?— weary of uselessness of efforts repeatedly undertaken. Like one with damaged eyes, who has heard much from others of the sun and moon's beauty in the sky, I am bound by the wish to see, and guided by others, come for protection to You, the destroyer of evil!

khyed kyi thugs rje sems can rnams ni kun la bye brag med par 'jug pa ma lags sam/ / de dag gzung bas bdag 'dra yang ni de dag nang du gzung bar 'gyur la gdon mi za/ / mtha' dag 'gro ba'i sdig pa'i mun par tsha zer can gzugs nus pa la yang do zla med/ / de lta mod kyi kye ma bdag smad nyes byas ngan pas brjid cing sdug bsngal ldan pa nyid/ /

On every path of sentient beings, surely, Your Compassion operates without distinction; By grasping them, it certainly manages to grasp, amidst them, even one like me. Your power without match is the disk of a sun for the darkness of the evils of the entire world. Even so, I am afflicted: indeed, alas! for shame! wrong-headed, evil action torments me.

skal ba zhan pa bdag smad smad pa zhig ste nyin byed 'od zer gyis kyang mun pa sel/ / gangs can las byung 'jug ngogs chus dkrigs pa yi dum bu 'khyags shing bsil ba dag tu bsgom/ / rin chen gling gi lam srang dang ni nor bu'i phug yangs khang pa dag gi nang du dbul/ / 'jig rten kun gyi yum gcig ma khyod mgon du byas kyang mgon ma mchis so bcom ldan ma/ /

Woe, O woe! unhappy me! Whose dark is not dispelled even by the light of the sun! Thirsty upon the chilly bank, rocky and snow-flecked, of the daughter of the Himālaya![9] A pauper, in his house where is a cache of abundant gems from the broad way of the Isle of Jewels! Without protector, Blessed One, although I have chosen Your Ladyship, sole Nurse[10] of all worlds, as protection![11]

nu ma'i rgyu las lan mang dag tu rnam par ngu ba'i bu la ma yang skyo bar 'gyur/ / nyi ma so sor dam pa ma yin don gnyer rnams la rab bskul pha yang khro ba 'dzin/ / 'jig rten gyi ni re 'dod 'bras bus yangs ldan dpag bsam shing chen 'khri shing mchog ni khyod/ / mngon par don gnyer don rnams kun la stsol gyi nam yang rnam gyur de dag ci yang med/ /

gang la nyon mongs tshogs kyi me 'bar lus can de dang de yis sgrol ma nga nyid cis/ / bdag nyid zhal bzhes dam bcas sdug bsngal 'og tu bying ba bdag la 'bras bu ldan par mdzod/ / srog chags rnams kyi sdug bsngal shugs ni rtsub cing zil gnon 'di dag ji snyed 'phel gyur pa/ / yang dag rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas theg par smon lam blo mnga' rnams kyi brtse ba'ang de snyed nyid/ /

'Whoever's body is burned in the fire of the swarm of afflictions, I it is who am his Saviouress.'— Now I am plunged in the underworld of suffering, fulfil this promise that You have revealed! Great as injuries, abuse and floods of suffering of living beings grow, at last, So does the compassion of those whose thoughts are fixed on the vow of the Vehicle of the Perfect Buddhas.[13]

de ltar bstod pa'i tshig gi zol gyis cho nge'i sgra dag gsang mthon sgrogs shing lag bsgreng la/ / gzhan dag gis kyang btang snyoms bya bar 'os pa min na yum gcig khyod kyis lta yang ci/ / gzhan dag rnams kyis mngon 'dod 'byor par 'dod pa khyed las thob pa rnams mthong bzhin/ / mi dge las byung nang gi gdung ba rgyun chags bzod blag med pas shin tu yang yang sreg /

If one thus cries aloud, arms raised a howl of lamentation in the semblance of words of praise, No other is entitled to be indifferent; how much less, O Mother! such a one as You? Seeing that, thanks to You, requests of others for wealth are allowed, and their desires are [all] fulfilled, I am consumed anew by continuous internal fever, born of discontentment, and unendurable.

gal te kho bo sdig can lags na khyod la gus pa chen po 'di ni ci phyir 'phel/ / khyod nyid gcig pu'i mtshan gyis kyang ni thos dang dran pas 'phral la sdig pa sel bar byed/ / de lta na yang bdag gi bya ba'i khur dag dong ba ji ltar lags zhes bden gsungs pa/ / nad pa 'chi bar 'gyur yang sman pa'i snying rje rgya chen phan pa khon par bgyid dam ci/ /

If I am wicked, then how is it that this great devotion I have towards You is increasing? Just by the hearing and recalling of Your name, You alone snatch away evil forcibly. How can You abandon this task, Your function, and push me aside? Let this be explained, Truth-teller! When a sick person is going to die, does a physician with much compassion withhold what would help?

sgyu mang ser sna nga rgyal phrag dog rang skyon tha chad rnams kyis dus mnyam rim par yang / / du ma dag gi thun mong char gyur tshogs khang ja mo bzhin du bskor bar gyur pas na/ / khyed kyi zhabs pad mchod pa skad cig tsam yang ma rnyed gang de'i don du khyad par las/ / phongs pas yi ge dman par tshig 'di bkod do bdag gi 'dod pa don med ma gyur cig /

Like the monastery's camel, shares of which are owned in common by several, I am driven,[14] At the same time or in succession, by my worst faults, such as pretension, avarice and pride: To venerate Your lotus feet I find not even a moment. Particularly with that object, I have composed these lines of syllables, sad and pitiful- through this may my wishes not be vain!

dus mtha'i rlung rab 'khrugs pas dkrugs pa'i chu ni g.yo zhing 'gul ba'i rlung 'khor ral pa can/ / rab 'khrugs kun du bskyod cing rba rlabs ngos brdabs sgra grag gad rgyangs chen po sgrogs pa las/ / gru chag chu ru snying rje ngu ba'i cho nge dang ldan g.yo ba med cing zhan gyur pa/ / lha mo khyod la bstod pa rnams kyis 'phral la chu gter 'gram du rang dga' thar bar 'gyur/ /

Whirling wind like the end of the world whisks the water around in frivolous billows, rolling and heaving, Which with a violent shock are tossed, huge, on the shore to break, crashing, crushing, in roars of mirth. From this, let those shipwrecked and sinking, paralyzed in misery, cry out in pitiful lamentation, They, Goddess! for whom Your praise[15] is supreme— at once, spontaneously, they are thrown out on the ocean's shore.

du ba 'tshubs pa sprin 'dra khong nas rab byung me stag mkha' khyim nang du rnam par rgyu/ / me dpung me lce 'phro zhing rab 'bar drag po'i khang par mal stan dag la rab 'khod pa/ / thal sbyar cod pan ldan pas khyed la btud byas ldab ldib dag tu gsol ba 'debs pa rnams/ / glog rab 'gyu ba'i rtse dga' rab 'bar chu 'dzin shugs kyis skad cig nyid la sgrib par byed/ /

Out of swirling clouds of smoke rises in the sky[16] a mansion; in it billows up, With crackle of sparks, a terrible blaze of swift flames, entering the house, where lie at ease in bed Some who, joining their hollowed palms on their heads in reverence to You, stammer out their songs of entreaty. In a moment they are covered by fast water-giving clouds arising, lit by the play of flashes.

myos pa'i chu rgyas 'gram pa gnyis ka'i ngos la babs pas bung ba dag gi phreng ba can/ / hUM zhes bya bas bos par gyur pa'i gling chen zla bos zhe sdang me sbar gnyis 'thung gi/ / so rtse rab tu mtho ba'i khyogs la blangs pa'i lus can dag gis khyod rjes dran pa na/ / rtse mo che ldan mgo rtse'i rdzong la 'dug cing rab tu dga' bas 'chi bdag phyir zlog byed/ /

When from the mountainsides of both an elephant's temples, filled with rut-fluid, hang festoons of bees, So that he's inflamed with anger towards rival elephants summoned by his trumpeting; And with the tip of his tusks, he lifts one's body up from beneath, as on a high swing, remembering You Death is averted, and thrilled with delight one sits as if in the fortress of the peak of his broad-topped head.

mdung [{]rings [,]ring [}]drag pos bsnun bsad mi yi mgo dang gsal shing dag gi 'khri shing dga' ston can/ / nags tshal stong par chom rkun lag rtses ral gri g.yo zhing brdeg par gzas pas dregs rgyas pa/ / khro gnyer dang bcas smin 'khyog zur mig gis bltas mig can rnams ni khyed mtshan dpal gyi gzhi/ / gsal bar 'dri ba'i gnas la bsam pa'i smyu gu skyo med rnams kyis bran du bkol bar byed/ /

In the lonely forest, whose festive creepers[16] are stakes that bear the heads of men killed with violent blows From missiles, the bandits are all puffed up with arrogance, like boils; with their finger-tips, they hold Glittering swords; they scowl, their eyes dart sidelong glances, 'neath crooked brows. But one the pen of whose thoughts Tires not of writing clear words upon the splendour and majesty of Your Name, can bind them in servitude.

rab rno sder mo'i rtse ni rdo rje lta bur bsnun pas glang chen myos pa'i klad 'gems nas/ / khrag mang rab tu zags pas bkrus pa'i ral pa gsal po 'jigs rung ya ngas phrag pa khebs/ / khros te rgyang nas steng du 'phyong 'dod mche ba rnon po gtsigs pa'i kha can [{]ri dgas [,]ri dwags [}]dgra/ / khyod la 'os pa'i bstod pa don ldan tshig dag bkod pas skrag ste log nas 'gro bar 'gyur/ /

With a ferocious, lightning-like stroke of his harsh claws, he gouges the temporal bumps of a ruttish elephant, Sending a trickle of viscous blood to wash his monstrous expanse of dense mane, parted on the shoulders. Angry, close and ready to pounce on one, the foe of beasts, the lion, whose jaws are full of sharp teeth, Turns around trembling and goes away, if one's object of speech is the milk of praises composed for Your delight.

gdengs can rnam 'gyur du ba'i khyim dang mun pa'i dbyibs can gsal bar phud sgra dag gi tshogs/ / byed pa dang ldan kha gdangs ro 'dzin thag pa gshin rje'i zhags 'dra che zhing g.yo ba dag / sdig pa las byung slar yang khyod skyong bdag nyid khyod kyi yon tan bgrang bar lhur len pas/ / ut+pal phreng ba'i rgyan gyis 'byor pa bung ba myos pa'i phreng bas dkris ltar 'dzin par 'gyur/ /

In forms of darkness, like coils of smoke, hideous serpents fill [the air] with violent hissing sounds. Busily their extended tongues dart from their open mouths. They are the ropes of Yama's nooses Met with because of sin. But if one's supreme concern is You, if one's great aim is to reckon Your virtues, Then he wears magnificent ornaments— garlands of water-lilies, girdled by swarms of delighted bees.

rje bo'i smin ma bskyod pas 'jigs pa dag gis rgod cing 'phyag pas drangs la co do gzings/ / g.yo zhing sgra sgrogs bran khol rnams kyis rtsub mor smra byed zhags pa'i mdud pa dam pos bcings/ / bkres skom dag gis kha dang mgrin skams gang zhig 'phags ma sgrol ma'i zhabs la skyabs 'gro ba/ / de ni byams pa'i gnyen gyis spangs kyang mtha' med rgud pa de dag 'phral du gtong bar 'gyur/ /

Frightened by the frown of their chief, impassioned royal soldiers drag one by one's ill-attached hair. Agitated, talkative servants, yelling in fury, bind one round with bitter knotted cords. One's throat and lips are dry with hunger and thirst. But one's free at once of this infinite misfortune, If one goes for Refuge to the feet of Ārya-Tārā, though abandoned by friends and kinsfolk.

sgyu ma 'phrul pa'i lam gyi rim pas rnam par 'gyur ba du ma dag gis chas byas shing / / log pa'i gzugs tsam rjes su 'tsham pa'i mtshon cha'i 'od zer tshogs ni rab tu mi bzad ldan/ / mi ro las bton rgyu ma'i thag pa'i tshogs kyi phreng bas rnam par spras pa'i srin po rnams/ / khyed rgyud las btus gsang sngags dran pas sdig pa phrogs pa'i srung ma gzhom med byed par 'gyur/ /

Terrifying rākṣasa demons, creating by series of works of magical transformation, many Changes of attire, false forms and dazzling, noisy weapons[18] suited to their undertakings,[19] And who wear garlands composed of piles of spun entrails from corpses, bestow inviolable protection On one who eliminates difficulties by remembering mantras extracted from Your Tantra.

glang chen sgra sgrogs char sprin lus can myos byed chu bo'i rgyun dang ldan pas mun gtibs shing / / mtshon cha 'od zer rnams ni glog rab 'gyu ltar rab gsal mda' yi char 'bab g.yul ngo 'gyed pa'i tshe/ / rnam par snang ba'i dgra bo dpung pa'i stobs ni rab mchog ldan pa rnams kyis bkag gyur pa/ / khyod kyi dgra bo gsod pa'i dpa' bo gcig gis 'phral du dgra yi sa gzhi phye mar rlog /

When darkness of pent-up streams[20] of rivers of rut-fluid from elephants, which are like thundering clouds made solid, Is lit in flashes by the glint of weapons, and a rain of arrows falls—in time of battle, When he is obstructed by enemies full of hatred, mighty in the strength of their arms, With the increase in power given by You the single hero crushes violently the field of foes.

sdig spyod dag gi rjes 'brang phol mig chabs can dag las rnag khrag rul pa rab 'dzag cing / / sha lpags myags pa la chags rtsa yi sgo yi bu gar 'gul ba'i srog chags kyis zos lus zad rnams/ / khyod zhabs nye bar brten pa'i sman mchog ri lu gus shing chags pa yis/ / sa le sbram dang mtshungs pa'i lus dang pad+ma dkar po ltar yangs mig dang ldan par 'gyur/ /

Those full of sickness caused by evil conduct—their wasted limbs devoured by worms that ooze through the mouths Of the pits of fistular ulcers fixed in putrid flesh and skin exuding stinking pus and blood— If intent on devotional practice of worship at Your feet, a remedy like the choicest pills, Become quite beautiful in form, similar to gold, their eyes extended and lotus-like.

gang gi rna ba'i snod na bla ma rnams kyis gnang ba'i man ngag slong mo mi gnas shing / / thos pa'i nor dang bral bas mkhas pa'i tshogs rnams dag tu lkugs pa nyid du khas len gang / / de yang khyed la gus pa'i nus pas rgyan rnams thams cad mdzes byed 'byor par bcas pa yis/ / ngag gi dbang phyug thob nas mi bdag mdun sar rgol ba'i seng ge'i khri dag 'phrog par byed/ /

One in the begging-bowl of whose ears the alms of sacred instructions offered by gurus do not repose, And who is reduced to silence in learned conversations because he is lacking in wealth of knowledge, By the power of devotion to You gains mastery of speech, is furnished with all the ornaments, Decorations and high rank, and at the royal court wins the thrones of the eloquent.[21]

sa gzhi mal stan rdul gyis lus bsgos skyed ngos ras ral yan lag dag ni rnam par mngon/ / shig gi tshe dag rab gtser gzhan gyi grong khyer mdun du gyo mor zas ni don gnyer ba/ / khyod mnyes bgyid la brtson pas na chung mchog gis bzung ba'i rnga yab 'dzum gyis rab mdzes shing / / myos pas long ba'i gnyis 'thung sos gtams gdugs gcig gyen du bteg pa'i sa gzhi 'dzin par 'gyur/ /

One whose limbs are exposed by the tom rags about his hips, dust-dark from sleeping on the ground, Who crushes lice alive to beg in front of others' houses for a scrap in a sherd to eat;[22] If he undertakes Your worship, receives a wide land, with its one royal parasol raised above him, Strong with the tusks of ruttish elephants beautiful with the smiles of lovely young women bearing chowries.

g.yog dang las mtha' bzo dang dbang po gso ba'i thabs kyi rnam grangs dag gis rab skyo zhing / / skye ba snga mar rab bsgrubs bsod nams bsags pa'i dge 'bras nor ni thob par ma gyur pa'i/ / nor med rnams kyis skye bo bkres pa'i yum gyur phongs las 'da' bar mdzad pa khyod la don/ / don du gnyer na slar yang gser gyi tshogs kyi gter dag sa las 'thon pa thob par 'gyur/ /

Those who, wearied of the succession of means-solicitation, service, trading, crafts and farming-Do not meet with property as the happy result of heaps of merit acquired in former lives, Once they have requested wealth of You who transcend fortune,[23] Mother of miserable people, Then these poor folk encounter hoards, vomited from the earth, of golden treasure [in abundance].

'tsho ba chad las ngo tshar gyur cing gos zad chung ma dag gis rab tu spyo bar byed/ / bdag nyid gso phyir rang gi skye bo bu dang grogs po gnyen gyis ring du spangs pa yis/ / khyed la rang gi sdug bsngal zhus pas rang gi khyim thab bud med gdu bu'i sil sil sgras/ / gnyid log sad par 'gyur zhing rta rmig rtse mos mtshams brkos khang khyim rnams kyi bdag po byed/ /

One who, deprived of livelihood, knows not what to do, reviled by his wife in tattered garments, And avoided at great distance, since they are selfish, by his kindred, children, friends and relatives, Having informed You of his sorrow is master of a house whose bounds are roughened by horses' hooves, Where he is woken from his slumbers just by the jingling of bangles of the women of his harem.

'khor lo phyogs kyi 'khor lo la sbyor bud med mtshan brgyan 'od zer g.yo zhing che ba dang / / glang chen gtso bo mche ba drug ldan rta mchog spu kha sngo bsangs rma bya'i mgrin ltar 'tsher/ / nor bu nyi ma'i 'od zer ltar gsal dri med yon tan mdzod 'dzin mdzod khengs dang / / dmag dpon dpal sde ldan par bcom ldan 'das ma khyod kyi bka' drin cha shas phra las 'gyur/ /

That the wheel may touch the horizon,[24] that the wife be adorned with the marks and of far-shining radiance. That the best elephant have six tusks, that the finest of horses have brilliant blue coat like a peacock's neck, That the jewel be of spotless qualities, shining with sun-like rays, that the treasurer be rich in treasure, The general lead an army of heroes, comes about, O Lady, by a small share of Your favour.

tsan+dan chu yis dri zhim nor bu'i rdo la mdzes mas dus btab rtse dga' la chags pas/ / sdu gu ma yi bde ba'i nyer spyad mgron du bya ba mngon par gsang ba rab bsgrubs shing / / ral gri 'od zer gyis sngo spom mtho dpung pa gtun shing dang 'dra dpung rgyan rol pa can/ / khyod kyi rigs drug rig 'dzin dbang po ma la ya yi me tog tshal du rang dgar 'gro/ /

At will, the king of the vidyādharas goes to the pleasure grove[25] of Malaya, where his lovers give him Assignations on rocks of gemstone, fragrant with sandal water, out of fondness for play with their dear one Treating him with true hospitality constantly renewed; for by Your mantras he has gained siddhi. Bracelets glitter on the bar[26] of his noble, muscular arm, darkened[27] by the rays of his sword.

nu ma'i thon 'khor do shal gyis brgyan mig dkyus ring po rna ba'i ut+pal la 'gran cing / / lha mo yid 'ong man+da ra ba dang ldan ze 'bru gsar pa'i dris myos bung ba can/ / dril chung sgra yis rjes 'brel rab tu gsal bar rkang gdub yid 'ong sgra snyan sgrogs par byed/ / 'dod pas myos dga' gzhon nu ma rnams gus dang bcas par khyed mgon ldan pa don du gnyer/ /

Pearl necklaces press between their breasts, blue lotuses in their ears vie with their elongated eyes; Noble mandāra flowers in their tresses distil a fresh perfume whose scent intoxicates black bees. The constant tinkle of [bells on] their girdles is magnified by the musical ornaments upon their feet. The heavenly maidens, devoted and delighting in amorous raptures, long for him who takes Refuge in You.

rdzing bu'i nang logs rin po ches spras gser gyi pad ldan ze'u 'bru rdo rje phreng ba can/ / yongs 'du'i ljon pa las 'phro dri bzang dang ldan me tog rdul gyi bla re mthor bres te/ / pi wang gling bu sgrogs mkhas lha yi grong gi dga' ba rnams kyis snyan par rab bsgrags pa'i/ / dga' ba'i skyed tshal bgrod pa khyod la mchod pa bgyid pas yun ring nyams su myong bar 'gyur/ /

By a pond with gem-covered banks, garlanded with golden lotus plants with diamond filaments, The coral trees that emerge from it throwing off an awning of sweet pollen from their flowers,[29] While charming girls from the town of 'immortals',[30] skilled on flute and vīṇā, give a concert of exquisite beauty, One who has engaged in Your worship experiences long the festival in Nandana garden.[31]

nang gi byed pa khyod la gtad pa'i bsod nams mthu ni rab 'bar yongs su smin pa yis/ / ga pur e la li shi shun pa a ka ru dang na la da phye'i dri ldan chu/ / 'dod pa'i dregs pas rab 'bur bud med nu ma'i skyibs su rba rlabs 'khyil gnas dal 'bab pa/ / sman min chu yi zer ma dang ldan chu rtsed mdzes ma dag dang lhan cig rtse bar 'gyur/ /

In the River Mandākinī,[32] whose water is scented with powder of spikenard, aloewood, cinnamon, Camphor, cloves and cardamom, whose ripples abate in eddies in hollows in between ivory[33] breasts Swelling with amorous elation: in sport in the surging river whereby some drops are far less sluggish,[34] Those who by setting their heart on You have developed a glowing force of merits dally with beautiful women.

tshig mtha'i gtso bo dul ba'i khur gyis cod pan dud pa rnams kyis bka' la phyag byas shing / / mtho ris steng du lha yis glang chen khrol khrol rgyan gyis spud pa'i lus can la zhon te/ / spu lang rab rgyas lus can bde sogs lag pa'i thag pa khyogs kyis rgyun du bskyil gyur pa/ / khyed kyi spyan ras phog pas dag byas lag pa rdo rje ldan pa'i lhas skyong byed/ /

Heads bowed beneath the burden of discipline, chiefs among the gods venerate his authority In the lap of heaven; he's mounted on the celestial elephant, whose limbs are splendid with sounding ornaments. Wantonly encircled close by the swinging garland of Śacī's arms, the hairs of his body thrill.[35] Purified by Your glances' alighting, he governs the land of the gods, distinctive vajras[35] on his forearms.

gtsug gi rin chen rgyan gyis mnan bzhugs bde bar gshegs pa nam mkha'i dpal 'byor bla re can/ / nyi ma 'char ka bye ba lta bur rab gsal 'od zer rgyas pas 'jig rten gsum 'gengs shing / / brtan par g.yas brkyang zhabs gcig gis mnan khur gyis tshangs dbang drag po khyab 'jug rnams 'dud pa'i/ / khyed sku bsgoms pa skye ba la brten rnams kyis srid pa'i 'jigs pa gcod pa'i slad du 'gyur/ /

Your form, crowned with a jewel crest of Sugatas on their seats, is canopied with the heavens' splendour;[36] The triple world is pervaded by its radiance, more intense than ten million newly risen suns. Beneath the weight of one leg's stride of its bold ālīḍha stance bend Brahma, Rudra, Indra and Viṣṇu. When meditated on, for those liable to rebirth it is the destruction of fears of Becoming.

khro bo dang bcas mtshon cha'i 'od zer rab 'bar phyag dbyig cha yis nam mkha'i khongs dag khyab/ / gdu bu'i gdengs can dag gi gdengs ka mi bzad mi 'phrogs spyod ldan sdang rnams skrag mdzad bzhad/ / cang te'u drag po tshabs cher brdungs pa'i tshe na ro langs rnams ni drag por pheg rdob cing / / bag med rgyas pas ca co chen po sgrogs par byed pa'i drag mor la la dag gis mthong / /

Some perceive You full of anger, raising shimmering weapons with arms like tree-trunks of which a fragment Would fill the interior of space;[37] with conduct none can frustrate, snakes with terrible hoods as armlets; Dispersing foes with tumultuous laughter, like the tumult caused at the moment of striking a ḍamaru, Or the mighty uproar of vetāla demons in madly excited loud play violently clapping their hands.

la las ba spu re re las byung nam mkha'i khyon gnas sa dang sa 'og dag na gnas/ / mtho ris la gnas tshangs dbang drag po la sogs mi dang lha dang grub pa'i dri za klu/ / phyogs tshogs khyab pa'i 'od zer la bzhugs bde gshegs brgya phrag sprul pa mtha' yas dag gi sku/ / ngo mtshar 'jig rten gsum gyi phyag 'os brtan g.yo bkod pa'i dngos po ma lus ngo bor ro/ /

Others, in every single hair of Your body see the expanse of space, those on and in the earth,[38] Brahmā, Indra, Rudra and so on at ease, the Maruts, humans, siddhas,gandharvas and nāgas; And the manifold emanations of infinite hundred Sugatas, on light-rays invading the Universe, Excellent One whom the three worlds should praise, of the nature of all existence composed of the animate and the fixed.

la las rgya skyegs li khri'i tshon dang nyi zhon dmar ba nyid ltar shin tu dmar ba dang / / de bzhin gzhan gyis snum zhing 'od ldan mthon mthing rdo bcag btags pa'i phye ma ltar sdo dang / / la las 'o ma'i rgya mtsho bsrubs pa'i 'od ltar ches lhag dkar dang gser 'od lta bu ste/ / khyed sku sna tshogs ngo bo nye bar bzhag pa dang 'brel dbye bas tha dad shel bzhin no/ /

kun mkhyen ye shes sgron mas shes bya mtha' dag gsal byas de nyid dag gi dbang gcig pu/ / kun rig nyid dam de yi sras kyis khyod kyi yon tan tshogs kyi grangs ni mngon sum mkhyen/ / bdag 'dra gtor ma spyod pa sgrogs pa lta bur kha gdangs ku co che bar 'don pa gang / / de ni mi bzad sdug bsngal gdung bas nad bskyed sems kyi rgud pa bzhad gad dag gi rgyu/ /

Unique observer of the reality of all that is to be known, clear by the light of Omniscient Knowledge, The Omniscient or His Offspring perceives directly the tally of Your multitude of qualities; But what one like me can croak, when he has opened wide his mouth, is as the cawing of a crow. This failure is cause of ridicule of my mind, in which it occasions pain as of fever, with horrible suffering.

bdag gis zhu ba gang lags de ni nang gi dang por khyed kyis khyad par du mkhyen te/ / 'on kyang lhag par de brjod ngal ba'i sgrub byed mi mkhas bdag rang sems tshim pa yi rgyu/ / don shes zin yang gnyen 'dun byams pa'i mdun du sdug bsngal ldan pas tshig gis sdug bsngal ni/ / dug bzhin skyugs par gyur na snying yang seng zhes byed cing rnam par gnas par tshor ba bzhin/ /

What I wish to tell You about, You already understand before, in detail; but to make The extra effort of speaking it is, for my own foolish heart, a cause of satisfaction, Just as, vomiting any sorrow like a poison, by speaking before an affectionate relative Although his meaning was already known, through lightening his heart an afflicted person finds well-being.

dge legs kun dga'i rgya mtshor zla ba'i cha shas gsal po bsil ba'i gzigs par stsal du gsol/ / ye shes nyer bstan dag gis rgyas par mdzod cig thugs rjes sdig ldan nang gi mun pa sel/ / gang phyir 'gro ba dag na khyod bstod chu yis yid ni dag par byas pa kho bo la/ / skye dgu rnams kyi dge legs gnas ni don yod khyod kyi yon tan bstod tsam gcig pu mthong / /

Moon crescent, manifest in an ocean of joy in what is right! Grant us Your refreshing vision![39] Make us develop by teachings on Your knowledge, You who are all Compassion, scatter our inner darkness! When my mind has been purified in the water of Your praises, I'll be in the supreme state of bliss: This I know, because the praise of Your virtues is alone unfailing in the world of beings.[40]

khyod kyi yon tan tshogs kyi cha tsam bstod nas bdag gis 'di tsam zhes par ma nges pa'i/ / bsod nams bkra shis 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ro myang 'gro ba'i bar du spyad bya ba/ / gang thob de yis 'jig rten 'di ni 'phags pa 'jig rten dbang phyug zhabs mthil bkra shis kyi/ / bde legs rtags can bde gshegs sras po'i sa gzhi bde ba can zhes bya de myur du bgrod par shog /

In praising a fraction of Your abundance of qualities, I have gained an undetermined amount of merit, To be enjoyed until Liberation, tasting the sweet juice of the fruit of a propitious wish; Through this, may the world progress to a speedy arrival at that land of Sugatas' Offspring that bears The auspicious Swastika mark of the soles of the noble Lord of the World,[41] and is known by the name of Sukhāvatī!
phreng ba 'dzin pa'i bstod pa paN+Di ta chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i bshes gnyen gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so//
The Sragdharā Praise of Ārya-Tārā is complete. It is the work of Ven. Sarvajñamitra of Kashmir, grey with the dust of Tārā's feet.[42] [Translated from the Sanskrit by Martin Willson]

d.crumb: 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa
