PRAISE OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ (by Akṣobhya-vajra)
@/ rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa bzhugs so/ /
@#// /rgya gar skad du/ ar+ya ta ra stod tra/ bod skad du/ 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa/
(Ārya-tārā-stotra) PRAISE OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ
rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the Venerable Ārya-Tārā!
rig pa las skyes dbyings na bzhugs/ / spros med rtog bral bde ba che// rnam dag don dam byang chub sems/ / sgrol ma chos sku phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to Tārā, the Dharmakāya, resting in the Realm[7] born of Knowledge,[8] Great Bliss, simple[9] and free of concepts, quite pure, Ultimate Bodhicitta![10]
gzhon nu'i tshul ldan mdzes pa'i sku/ / kha dog mtshog ldan brdzid pa'i zhal/ / lha mo'i dkyil 'khor dbus na bzhugs/ / sgrol ma longs spyod phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to Tārā, the Saṃbhoga-kāya, the beautiful Body with youthful manner And radiant face of the finest colour resting amidst a circle (maṇḍala) of goddesses!
thugs kyi gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor nas/ / yang dag rig pa'i gzugs 'phro ma/ / 'gro drug sems can sgrol mdzad ma/ / sgrol ma sprul sku phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to Tārā; the Nirmāṇa-kāya, sending out, from Her secret heart Maṇḍala, forms of perfect Knowledge, saving beings from the six destinies!
log rtog ma rig gnyid spangs nas/ / thugs mchog shes bya kun la khyab/ / yang da ga rdzogs sangs rgyas mchod brnyes/ / sgrol ma sangs rgyas phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to Tārā Who is Buddha! Whose supreme Mind, free of wrong concepts And sleep of unknowing, pervades all knowables! Who receives honour of perfect Buddhas!
bde chen zhi ba mya ngan 'ad sa/ / dam pa'i chos mchog ye shes bcu/ / pha rol phyin pa bcu ston ma/ / dam chos sgrol ma phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to Tārā Who is true Dharma, showing Great Bliss, Nirvāṇa's Peace, The highest of holy Dharmas, the ten Wisdom-knowledges,[11] and ten Perfections!
dus gsum bder gshegs thams cad kyis/ / sku dang gsung dang thugs grub ma/ / 'dus pa'i ye shes mkha' 'gro ma/ / sgrol ma dge 'dun phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to Tārā Who is Saṅgha, Who's realized the Body, Speech and Mind Of all Sugatas of the three times, the Ḍākinī of the combined Wisdom-knowledges!
'gro ba'i sdug bsngal zhi 'dod pas/ / khams gsum po la rjes su chags/ / ma ltar brtse ba'i lha mo'i gzugs/ / 'dod chags sgrol ma khyod phyag 'tshal/ /
Homage to Tārā the Desirous, Who, wanting to calm migrators' sorrows, Devotes Herself to the three realms in the form of a Goddess Who loves like a mother!
srid pa'i rang bzhin da ga par mkhyen / / khams gsum po la chags mi mnga'/ / rgyal ba bskyed mdzad yum gyi sku/ / chags bral sgrol ma khyod phyag 'tshal/ /
Homage to Tārā free of desire, Who, knowing saṃsāra's nature is pure, Has no attachment to the three realms-the form of the Mother, Producer of Conquerors!
thabs dang shes rab mnyam spyor bas/ / snyid dang zhi la mi gnas pa/ / 'dod chags ma yin chags bral min/ / mi gnas sgrol ma khyod phyag 'tshal/ /
Homage to Tārā the Non-abiding, Who by uniting Method and Wisdom Abides in neither saṃsāra nor Peace, neither desirous nor free of desire!
sangs rgyas kun gyi ye shes sku/ / gti mug mdongs pa'i sems can gyi/ / ma rig mun pa sel mdzad ma/ / bde gshegs sgrol ma khyod phyag 'tshal/ /
Homage to You, Sugata-Tārā, Body of all the Buddhas' Gnosis, Dispeller of darkness of ignorance from sentient beings delusion has blinded!
sangs rgyas kun gyis yon tan tshogs/ / khengs pa zil gnon sems can gyi/ / nga rgyal ri bo 'joms mdzad ma/ / rin chen sgrol ma khyod phyag 'tshal/ /
Homage to You, O Jewel Tārā, collection of all the Buddhas' virtues, Subduer of the mountain of pride of sentient beings overpowered by arrogance!
sangs rgyas kun gyi dri med gsungs/ / 'dod chags kyis gdungs sems can gyi/ / srid pa'i gdung ba sel mdzad ma/ / pad+ma 'i sgrol ma khyod phyag 'tshal/ /
Homage to You, O Lotus Tārā, immaculate Speech of all the Buddhas, Dispeller of saṃsāra's torments[12] for sentient beings pained by desire!
sangs rgyas kun gyis mdzad pa mtshog / phrag do ga gis bsnun sems can gyi/ / phrag dog zug rngu 'byin mdzad ma/ / 'phrin las sgrol ma khyod phyag 'tshal/ /
Homage to You, O Karma-Tārā, supreme Deeds of all the Buddhas, Extractor of the thorn of envy from sentient beings smitten with envy!
sangs rgyas kun gyis rdo rdze'i sku/ / khong khro bcom pa'i sems can gyi/ / zhe sdang mtshon cha gcod mdzad ma/ / rdo rje sgrol ma khyod phyag 'tshal/ /
Homage to You, O Vajra-Tārā, Vajra-body of all the Buddhas, Annihilator of weapons of hate in sentient beings oppressed by anger!
gzugs brnyan lta bu'i sku 'dzin ma/ / phra dang rags pa'i gzugs dang bral/ / mtshan dang dpe byad rnam par spras/ / rdo rje'i sku la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
Homage and praise to Your Vajra Body, You Who bear a form like a reflection, Free of gross or subtle matter and furnished with the Marks and Signs!
sgra brnyan lta bu'i gsungs brjod pa/ / brjod dang yi ge rnam par spangs/ / tshig dang ngag gi lam las 'das/ / rdo rje'i gsung la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
Homage and praise to Your Vajra Speech, You Who utter speech like an echo, Abandoning syllables and phrases, transcending the ways of words and language![13]
rmi lam lta bu'i thugs mnga' ma/ / dngos dang dngos med sogs mi mthong / / rtag dang chad pa sogs mi shes/ / rdo rje'i thugs la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
Homage and praise to Your Vajra Mind, You Who have a mind like a dream, Not seeing real, unreal or other,[14] not knowing eternity or destruction!
rdul bral mkha' khyab sgrol ma la/ / phyag bya phyag byed mi dmigs par/ / yan lag med cing lus med pa'i/ / gzugs med rdo rdze'i lus kyis 'dud/ /
To Tārā dustless and space-pervading I bow with formless vajra body, Without limbs and without frame, observing no homage nor object of homage.
rtog med sbros bral sgrol ma la/ / bstod bya bstod byed mi dmigs par/ / sgra dang ba[t]jod pa rnam bral ba'i/ / brjod med rdo rje'i tshig gis bstod/
To Tārā simple and without conceptions I give praise with speechless vajra words, Free of sounds and utterance, observing no praise nor object praised.
tshor bral dmigs med sgrol ma la/ / bsam bya bsam byed mi dmigs par/ / 'dzin pa med cing rig bral ba'i/ / rdo rje sems kyis rab tu 'dud/ /
To Tārā free of feeling or object[15] I make obeisance with vajra mind, without apprehender or cognizing, observing no thinking nor object of thought.
slob dpon a k+Sho b+h+ya badz+ras mdzad pa'o// //
By Master Akṣobhya-vajra. [Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson.]

d.crumb: 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa

f.d: @/ /'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa/
PRAISE OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ (by Dīpaṃkara-bhadra)
@/ 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa bzhugs so//
@##/ /rgya gar skad du/ a+yar ta ra stod tra/ bod skad du/ 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa/
(Ārya-tārā-stotra) PRAISE OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ
rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the Venerable Ārya-Tārā!

'jig rten gsum mgon yum sgyur spyan yangs ma/ / dus gsum sangs rgyas thams cad bskyed pa'i yum/ / gnyis med ye shes ngang las ma g.yos kyang / / thugs rje'i dbang gi 'gro don sna tshogs mdzad/ / byams pa'i yum gyur khyod la phyag 'tshal 'dud/ /

Wide-eyed Mother, Protector of the three worlds! Mother producing all the three times' Buddhas! Though You move not from the state of non-dual Gnosis, Your power of Compassion works diverse good for migrators. I bow in homage to You, O kindly Mother!

sku mdog ljang ku 'phrin las sna tshogs mdzad/ / yon tan rab rgyas bcu drug lon pa'i tshul/ / 'gro la rab dgyes zhal ni 'dzum pa dang / / zhi ba'i spyan gyis 'jig rten gsum la gzigs/ / thugs rje che mnga' khyod la phyag 'tshal 'dud/ /

Your Body green, You perform all Buddha-activities. Like a sixteen-year-old, mature in qualities, Gladdening sentient beings, with smiling face And peaceful eyes You look on the three worlds. I bow in homage to You of abundant Compassion!

byang sems rang bzhin zla ba gad na du bting / / nyon mongs mi bskyod rdo rdze'i skyil krungs bcas/ / sgrib pa kun spangs pad+ma'i gdan la bzhugs/ / zag med bde rgyas zla ba'i rgyab yol can/ / zag med bde ba che la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

A moon of Bodhi-mind nature is spread as Your seat; In vajra-position, undisturbed by the defilements, You sit on a lotus seat, all obscurations abandoned, Your backdrop a full moon of bliss uncontaminated. Homage to You of great uncontaminate bliss!

na bza' mchog dang rin chen du mas spras/ / phyag g.yas mchod sbyin sgrub la dngos grub sbyin/ / g.yon pas ud pal skyon bral dag pa'i rtags/ / phyag gnyis thabs da nga shes rab zung du 'brel/ / mtha' bral zung 'jug sku la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Arrayed in superb clothing and numerous gems, With right hand, boon-granting, You give practitioners siddhis; In the left, a faultless utpala, sign of purity.[16] Your two hands are Method and Wisdom united. Homage To You of the Union Body, free of extremes!
lus ngag yid kyis khyod la phyag byas pas/ / lta ba dman dang sgrub mchod dman pa dang / / nyon mongs dbang gyur dam tshig nyams pa dag / khyed la bzod gsol thugs rdzes gzung du gsol/ /

Because of my homage with body, speech and mind, Pray pardon my low views, my inferior practice And worship, and damage to pledges controlled by defilements! Please will You support me with Compassion.

yon tan mtha' yas mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i sku/ / khyed la dga' bas rdul tsam bstod pa'i/ / khyod kyis zhal ni rtag tu mthong ba dang / / yang dag lam mchog gad ma ngag bstan pa'i/ / mtho ris thar pa'i lam mchog bdag la gsol/ /

Your Body's adorned with Marks of infinite virtues. Through my praising but an atom with joy in You, Grant me the everlasting view of Your face And the supreme Path to high rebirth and Liberation By showing advice on the supreme, perfect Path!

byams pa'i yum gyur bdag la dgongs nas kyang / / bdag cag 'khor bcas bsrung zhing bskyab pa dang / / tshe 'di'i rkyen rnams khyed kyis bzlog pa dang / / phyi mar ngan song sgo rnams bcad pa dang / / bdag gi dge blo khyed kyis rgyas par mdzod/ /

Thinking of us, O Mother of loving-kindness, Guard and protect us and our entourage, Turn aside [bad] conditions in this life, Cut off the entrance to realms of woe in the next, And make a wholesome mind develop in us!
'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa slob dpon mar me mdzad bzang pos mdzad pa rdzogs so// //
The Praise of Ārya-Tārā by Master Dīpaṃkara-bhadra[17] is complete.
kha che'i mkhan po b+hud ta ka ra bar ma dang / lo tsa ba dge slong chos kyi ye shes kyis bsgyur zhing zhus pa'o// //
It was translated and revised by the Kashmiri upādhyāya Buddhākara-varman and the translator Gelong Ch'ökyi Ye-she.[18] [Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson.]

d.crumb: seng ldeng nags kyi sgrol ma la bstod pa

f.d: @/ /seng ldeng nags kyi sgrol ma la bstod pa/
PRAISE OF KHADIRAVAṆĪ TĀRĀ (by Nāgārjuna)
@#/ /rgya gar skad du/ kha d+hi ra d+ha ra sto tra/ bod skad du/ seng ldeng nags kyi sgrol ma la bstod pa/
(Khadiravaṇī-tārā-stotra) PRAISE OF KHADIRAVAṆĪ TĀRĀ
'phags ma seng ldeng nags kyi sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to Ārya-Khadiravaṇī-Tārā!

'phags ma'i pho brang seng ldeng nags na sgrol ma rtse/ / u dum wa ra seng ldeng rgya shug n+ya gro ta/ / tsan dan 'brab bu gsum stong dza ti li shi'i tshal/ / kha zum kha bye me tog shing lo nyams dga'i gnas/ /

High Ārya-Tārā's palace is in the Khadira Forest, A grove of glomerous figs,[13] khadiras, jujube trees, Banyans, sandal, three thousand fruits, nutmeg and doves, A pleasant leafy place of flowers open and closed.

ljon shing 'bras bu smin dang ma smin taM po la/ / yan lag brgyad ldan chu ni lhung lhung sgra snyan la/ / rma bya ne tso khu byug bzhad rnams sgra snyan sgrogs/ / stag gzig rgyug cing e nas gar byed dom dred mchongs/ /

Among the close-packed[14] trees and fruit, ripe and unripe, There sweetly trickles water with the eight qualities;* Sweet, joyous cries of peacocks, parrots and cuckoos resound; Tigers and leopards run, stags frolic and bears leap.[15]

lce spyang glu len spre spre khri snyan be'u snun/ lha'i bu mo gzhon nu nags na drug ldan len/ / dge slong klu grub seng ldeng nags na grub chen mdzad/ / sgrol ma gshegs bzhud zhing khams gnas la phyag 'tshal bstod / /

skye med thugs rdze'i mtsho las pad ma mar gad mdog / me tog zla mdzes bud med rin chen bcud kyis mdzes/ / ngang pa'i 'gros ltar bgyid zhing gnyis 'thung dreg bzhin gzigs/ / bde gshegs thugs rje'i rlan gyes gang mos skur ston ma/ /

On the flower of an emerald lotus from unborn Compassion's lake, And moon, fair woman beautified with the finest of jewels, Going with gait like a goose and looking with elephant's pride, Tender with a Sugata's Pity, You show forms at will.

gser gyi pad mas snyan rgyan ud pal dar dpyangs can/ / rin chen rtse bran dbu la don grub cod pan bzhugs/ / mu tig btso ma byu ru'i chun 'phyangs 'gur chu mdzes/ / phyag zhabs gdu gu dpung rgyan skya reg dar sgeg ma/ /

With golden lotus earrings, and ribbons of utpalas, On the jewel crown on Your head sits Amoghasiddhi as crest. Hanging strings of fused pearls and coral adorn Your neck,[17] Beauty with anklets, bracelets, armlets and silken sash!

thugs rje 'khor ba las sgrol phyag na pad mo yis/ / spyan gyi chab las lha mo sku 'khrungs 'od dpag med/ / smon lam mthu yis brtse chen gzhan gyi don la brtson/ / zhing mchog rnam dag seng ldeng nags kyi gzhon nu ma/ /

Compassionate Saviouress from saṃsāra! Goddess born From the tears of Him with Lotus in Hand,[18] by the power of the vow Of Amitābha; most loving, striving for others' good, Young maiden of the pure supreme place, Khadira Forest!

zhal gyi pad ma yid 'ong bzhin ni zla ltar rgyas/ / chu skyes spyan mdzes dkyus ring dkar nag mdangs gsal ba/ / mgor skyes khur bu gser gyis sgra brgyan bung ltar gnag / bi'i rdzi 'dra snum zhing mdzod spu dung 'khyil ma/ /

Your lotus face is pleasing, a face like the full moon; Your lovely lotus eyes are long, clear white and black. Your hair is adorned with golden pores and black as bees, And smooth as the lord of mice(?);[19] Your ūrṇā[20] curls like a conch.

bden gnyis phyag ni ud pal kha 'byed bdag sogs kyi/ / gti mug mun sel snying gi chu skyes kha dbus na/ / ud pal g.yon bsnams ye shes rgyas mdzad g.yas pa yis/ / 'gro rnams bung ba'i me tog sngon po kha 'byed ma/ /

In Your hands—the two Truths—open utpalas dispel delusion's darkness In self and others: at Your heart's budding lotus, the utpala Held in Your left [hand] increases Wisdom-knowledge; the right Opens its blue flower to the bees of migrating beings.

sri+ed par lhungs nas mya ngan smre sngags 'don pa la/ / sems can don mdzad seng ldeng nags nas bzhengs la gshegs/ / lang tso dar bab 'o ma rgyas pa'i nu 'bur can/ / sna tshogs thabs kyis srid zhi g.yo zhing bskyod mdzad ma/ /

To benefit sentient beings, who've fallen into saṃsāra In sorrow and lamentation, You rise and leave Khadira Forest, O youthful maiden possessing breasts swollen with milk,[21] Who by all means stirs and moves [us in] saṃsāra and Nirvāṇa!

khyu mchog spyang mo 'gying bag lte ba pad ma can/ / dza ti tsam pa li shi dri ngad bzang por ldan/ / phyag zhabs pad ma ltar da mar 'khor ba'i skyon ma gos/ / pan tsa li ga lha dar stod smad brgyan byas ma/ /

One with bull's eye[lashes],[22] graceful, Whose navel bears a lotus,[23] Endowed with the excellent fragrance of nutmeg,[24] cloves and magnolia,[25] Hands and feet red like a lotus, unstained by faults of saṃsāra, Adorned above and below with divine silks and pañcalika!

nyi tshe'i sku min khyab pas thugs rje'i 'phrin las sku/ / thub pas rgya mtshor gsungs pa glu grub snying po yis/ / nags su gzigs so sems can dal gyis khur chen khyer/ / tshangs tshings srid pa'i nags nas zhi bar sgrol mdzad ma/ /

Your Body's non-local, pervading, a Body of Deeds of Compassion, A perfect boat[26] for the sea of the Sage's Teachings, in essence Seen in the forest,[27] slowly bearing the great load of beings, Ferrying them to Peace from saṃsāra's impervious thickets.

bsgres mo gzhon nu'i tshul 'dzin sangs rgyas kun gyi phyi/ / ming tsam dran pa nyid kyis 'jigs las bskyob mdzad ma/ / yun ring 'khor bar mi skyo zhi bar mi gnas pa'i/ / sa bcu'i dbang phyug rgyal sras rnams kyi thugs rje ma/ /

Old woman of youthful appearance, following[28] all the Buddhas, You the mere recollection of Whose name delivers from fears! Unwearied by long in saṃsāra, not resting in Nirvana, Compassion of Conquerors' Offspring with mastery of the Ten Stages!

rje btsun yon tan mtha' yas bdag gis brdzod mi nus/ / kun tu rtogs spangs ye shes mnga' brnyes chos kyi sku/ / gzhan gyi don phyir sku ni seng ldeng nags na gshegs bzhud mdzad/ / srid las bdag grol nags kyi bu mo phyag 'tshal bstod/ /

Venerable One! I cannot describe Your infinite virtues. Dharmakāya, free of imagining, possessed of Gnosis! Unshakable Body[29] going about in Khadira Forest! Forest maid free by nature[30] of saṃsāra! Homage and praise!

'od zer ral cig ser sngo g.yas g.yon phyogs char gshegs/ / zhi khro'i phyag gnyis rdo rje a sho gri khug thogs/ / snga phyir bzhud cing dpe med gus ldan bsnyen bkur mdzad/ / mdzes ma nye 'khor 'od zer ral cig phyag 'tshal bstod/ /

On right and left come yellow Mārīcī and blue Ekajaṭā, Peaceful and fierce; their two hands hold vajra, aśoka and kartṛ.3l Going before and after, with unmatched devotion they honour You. Beauty Mārīcī and Ekjaṭā wait on! Homage and praise!

sngon mchod phyi nas gdugs khur rigs rgyal bu mo'i tshogs/ / rnga yab ting shag rnga gling pi bang glu gar 'gengs// lha'i bu mo bco lnga rgyan ldan na bza' mdzes/ / sna tshogs sku yis mchod bsnams rol la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /

Worshipped and followed by parasol-bearers and maids, queens of knowledge,[32] Who satiate with chowries, cymbals, shawms, vīnās, songs and dances! Fifteen daughters of gods with adornments and beautiful dresses In manifold forms hold offerings: to this display, homage and praise!

nags tshal lha mo sku mdzes dge ma 'khor bcas la// bdag gis bstod bgyis mi bzad dge ba bzang po des/ / 'gro ba kun la thugs rje'i chu'i nyon mongs kun dag nas/ / srid pa'i nags nas zhi ba'i tshal du phyin par shog /

By the excellent, inexhaustible[33] merits of my giving praise To the beautiful, virtuous Forest Goddess and Her attendants, May all migrators, their kleśa cleansed by the water of Mercy, Go from saṃsāra's thicket to the grove of Peace!
gzhon nu kha ti ta re ma la bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug pa/ slob dpon 'phags pa klu grub kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so// //
The Praise in sixteen stanzas to the youthful Khadiravaṇī-Tārā, by Master Ārya-Nāgārjuna, is complete.
SARVA-MAṆGALAM! [Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson.]

d.crumb: rdo rje phag mo sgrol ma la bstod pa

f.d: @/ /rdo rje phag mo sgrol ma la bstod pa/
PRAISE OF VAJRAVĀRĀHĪ TĀRĀ (by Candrakīrti)
@#/ /rgya gar skad du/ badz+ra bA[:]rA hI tA ra sto traM/ bod skad du/ rdo rje phag mo sgrol ma la bstod pa/
Vajravārāhī-tārā-stotra PRAISE OF VAJRAVĀRĀHĪ TĀRĀ
rje btsun ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the Venerable Tārā!

stong nyid snying rdze phag mo che/ / sgrol ma'i sku la phyag 'tshal lo/ / smra bsam brjod med pha rol phyin/ / sgrol ma'i gsung la phyag 'tshal lo/ / dri med ye shes zla ba'i thugs/ / sgrol ma'i thugs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Homage to the Body of Tārā, great Sow (Vārāhī) of Emptiness and Compassion! Homage to the Speech of Tārā, Perfection[34] without words, thought or speaking! Homage to the Mind of Tārā, the mind of immaculate Moon of Gnosis![35]
zla 'od srid pa'i mun sel ba/ / 'joms byed nyi ma'i dkyil dang mtshungs/ / thabs dang shes rab yon tan ldan/ / sgrol ma la ni rtag tu 'dud/ /
Moonlight dispelling saṃsāra's darkness like an overpowering solar disk! To Tārā, endowed with the qualities of Method and Wisdom, I bow forever.
'gro la bu bzhin rtag tu gdung / / srid gsum rnam thar gsum la 'god / / seng ldeng nags la rab gnas shing / / 'jigs pa brgyad las shin tu skyob/ /
You always love migrators like Your children, and fix the three realms in the three Liberations.[36] Living in the Khadira Forest, You save us strongly from the eight fears.
sgrol ma la ni phyag 'tshal bstod / / mngon par da ga' ba'i zhing khams su/ / rdo rje mkha' 'gror skur ston cing / / 'gro ba'i sgrib gnyis sbyong mdzad pa/ / sgrol ma la ni phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
Tārā, I pay homage to You. In the Pure Land Abhirati[37] You show the form of Vajra-ḍākinī,[38] Tārā, homage and praise to You!
dpal dang ldan pa'i zhing khams su/ / rin chen mkham 'gror skur ston cing / / 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal nad sel mdzad/ / sgrol ma la ni phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
In the Pure Land Glorious[39] You show the form of Ratna-ḍākinī, Dispeller of migrators' sickness of sorrow, Tārā, homage and praise to You!
bde ba can gyi zhing khams su/ / pad+ma mkha' 'gror skyar ston cing / / bde ba chen po'i ngang la gnas/ / sgrol ma la ni phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
In the Pure Land Sukhāvatī You show the form of Padma-ḍākinī, Living in the state of Great Bliss, Tārā, homage and praise to You!
rnam par dag pa'i zhing khams su/ / las kyi mkha' 'gror skur ston cing / / phrin las rnam bzhis 'gro don mdzad/ / sgrol ma la ni phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
In the Pure Land of Viśuddhi You show the form of Karma-ḍākinī, Helping migrators with the four rites, Tārā, homage and praise to You!
mtha' dbus med pa'i zhing khams su/ / pha rol phyin ma'i skur ston cing / / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas tshogs dang bcas/ / sgrol ma la ni phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
In the Pure Land An-anta-madhya You show the form of Pāramitā,[40] With the assembly of Buddhas of ten directions, Tārā, homage and praise to You!
dur khrod brgyad kyi zhing khams su/ / rdo rje phag mor skur rton cing / / me dpung 'bar ba'i dbus na bzhugs/ / sgrol ma la ni phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
In the Pure Land of the eight charnel grounds You show the form of Vajra-vārāhī, Amidst a blazing mass of fire, Tārā, homage and praise to You!
paN+Di ta zla ba grags pas bstod pa mdzad pa rdzogs so// //
The praise by the paṇḍita Candrakīrti is complete. [Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson.]

d.crumb: 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa

f.d: 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa
PRAISE OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ (By Atīśa)
@##/ /rgya gar skad du/ Ar+ya tA rA sto tra/ bod skad du/ 'phags ma sgrol ma la bstod pa/
(Ārya-tārā-stotra) PRAISE OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ
rje btsun ma 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the Venerable Arya-Tārā!
lha dang lha min cod pan gyis/ / zhabs kyi pad+mo la btud de/ / phongs pa kun las sgrol mdzad cing / / sgrol ma la ni phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Gods and asuras with their crowns bow down to Your lotus feet; Liberator from all problems, [Mother] Tārā-homage to You!
rab 'bar dra bas khyab pa yi/ / mnar med me yis gdungs pa la/ / thugs rjes bdud rtsi'i char 'bebs ma/ / sgrol ma la yang phyag 'tshal lo/ /
On those Avīci's fire torments, filling them with a blazing net, Your compassion rains down nectar— Tārā, further homage to You!
'gro drug gnas su yun ring du/ / yang dang yang du 'khor ba yis/ / dub pa dag la bde chen gyi/ / bde ba mchog gi ngal so mdzad/ /
To those tired of circling long, again and again, among the six Destinies, You grant the rest, supremely pleasant, of Great Bliss.
gzhan don mdzad pa'i lha mo khyod/ / dran pa tsam gyis phongs sel ma/ / thugs rje brtse ldan khyod kyis ni/ / srid pa'i 'ching ba las grol mdzod/ /
Goddess who works the weal of others! Just to think of You dispels problems! You, endowed with love and compassion, liberate from saṃsāra's bonds.
dus rnams rtag tu sems can la/ / bu bzhin snyoms pa'i lha mo khyod/ / 'gro ba'i lo tog thams cad la/ / char rgyun 'bebs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Goddess who at all times is impartial towards sentient beings, On the whole crop of migrators You rain incessantly—homage to You!
nyi ma zla ba ji bzhin du/ / 'gro ba sems can thams cad kyi/ / mun pa'i gdung ba sel mdzad ma/ / lha mo mchog la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Like the sun and moon, dispeller of distress of darkness for All migrating sentient beings, Supreme Goddess-homage to You!
pad+ma zla ba ut+pa la/ / de bzhin dri med gdan stengs su/ / sku mdog sngo ljang 'gying bag can/ / ut+pal bsnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
On a lotus and moon seat immaculate as an utpala, Your body blue-green coloured, graceful, You hold an utpala—homage to You!
bskal pa grangs med gsum du tshogs bsags shing / / bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa kun spangs nas/ / bsdu dngos bzhi yis 'gro rnams sdud mdzad ma/ / thugs rje dang ldan ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Three countless eons You've gathered Merits and Wisdom, Cast off all the hindering obscurations, And with the four Means of Attraction attracted migrators, O compassionate Mother—homage to You!
sku yi skyon spangs mtshan dang dpe byad ldan/ / gsung gi skyon spangs ka la ping ka'i dbyangs/ / thugs kyi skyon spangs shes bya mtha' dag mkhyen/ / bkra shis dpal 'bar ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
ji ltar nor bu chu 'dang ltar/ / lha mo khyod kyis rtag par ni/ / 'gro ba'i sems rnyog sel mdzad cing / / 'gro don brtson la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Like the water-clearing gem, Goddess, You forever clear The mud of sentient beings' minds and strive for their welfare—homage to You!
gang gis khyod kyi mtshan bzung cing / / bstod dang bsgrub pa byas pa rnams/ / rtag tu 'bras bu yod par mdzad/ / mi bsnyel khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Those who do retain Your name, praise You, and do practise You, Always do You make fruitful, Unforgetful One - homage to You!
rje btsun ma sgrol ma la bstod pa dI paM kA ra shrI dz+nyA nas mdzad pa rdzogs so// //
The Praise of the Venerable Tārā by Dipaṃkara-śrī-jñāna is complete.
rgya gar gyi mkhan po de nyid dang / bod kyi lo tsA ba tshul khrims rgyal bas bsgyur ba'o//
Translated by that Indian upādhyāya himself and the Tibetan translator Ts'ül-tr'im gyāl-wa. [Translated from the Tibetan. by Martin Willson]

d.crumb: seng ldeng nags kyi sgrol ma

f.d: rje btsun bcom ldan 'das ma seng ldeng nags kyi sgrol ma la bstod pa/ mkhas pa 'i gtsug rgyan zhes bya ba/
PRAISE OF THE VENERABLE LADY KHADIRAVAṆĪ TĀRĀ CALLED THE CROWN JEWEL OF THE WISE
(commonly known as LEk-Dr'I-MA[6]) By Gedün-dr'up, First Dalai Lama
na mo Ar+ya tA ra ye/
'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug thugs rje'i gter la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to Ārya-Avalokiteśvara, the treasure of Compassion!
[Praise]
legs bris dpal gyi bdag po gser gyi mngal/ / lha yi bla ma glang gdong dpal gyi mgrin/ / pad+mo'i gnyen sogs lha brgya'i gtsug rgyan gyis/ / zhabs pad gus mchod sgrol ma'i zhabs la 'dud/ /
Devas,[7] Lakṣmī's husband, gold-hatched Brahmā, Bṛhaspati, Gaṇeśa and Śiva, Sūrya and more-crown-jewels of hundreds of gods Revere Her foot-lotus[8]- at Tārā's feet I bow!

thugs rje chen po'i thugs rje'i rnam 'phrul gyis/ / dus gsum rgyal ba'i ma/khyen brtse nus pa rnams/ / rab mdzes 'phrin las lha mo'i skur bstan nas/ / phongs pa kun skyob sgro la ma'i zhabs la 'dud/ /

By compassion magic of the Greatly Compassionate,[9] The three times' Conquerors' Wisdom, Mercy and Power Appear in the lovely form of the Goddess of Action, Who saves from all want—at Tārā's feet I bow!
dbyings rig rnam dag pad zla'i gdan steng na/ / margad mdog can zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma/ / lang tsho rab rgyas g.yas brkyangs g.yon bskums zhabs/ / thabs shes zung 'brel ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
On a lotus seat, for pure understanding of Emptiness, Emerald-coloured, one-faced, two-armed girl, In full bloom of youth, right leg out, left drawn in, Uniting Method and Wisdom[10]-homage to You!
nu 'bur rab rgyas zag med bde ba'i gter/ / zhal ras zla ba rgyas pa'i 'dzum dkar can/ / zhi ba'i nyams ldan thugs rje'i spyan yangs ma/ / seng ldeng nags kyi mdzes ma khyod la 'dud/ /
Prominent, full breasts, treasures of undefiled bliss, Face with a brilliant smile like the full moon, Mother with calm-mannered, wide, compassionate eyes, Beauty of Khadira Forest—to You I bow!
g.yu yi ljon shing yal ga brkyangs 'dra ba'i / / 'jam mnyen phyag g.yas mchog sbyin phyag rgya ni/ / mkhas rnams dngos grub mchog gi dga' ston la/ / mgron du 'bod 'dra khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Like the outstretched branch of a heavenly tree of turquoise, Your supple right hand, in the gesture of Granting Boons, Invites the wise to a feast of supreme siddhis As if to an entertainment—homage to You!
phyag g.yon dkon mchog gsum mtshon skyabs sbyin gyis/ / 'jigs pa brgya phrag mthong ba'i skye bo rnams/ / ma 'jigs nga yis myur du bskyab bo zhes/ / gsal bar mtshon pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Your left hand gives Refuge, showing the Three Jewels;[11] 'You people who see perils of hundreds of kinds! Do not be frightened, I shall quickly save you,' It dearly signifies—homage to You!
phyag gnyis ut+pal sngon pos mtshan pa ni/ / 'gro kun srid pa'i bde la ma chags par/ / thar pa chen po'i grong du zhugs shig ces/ / brtson pa'i lcag gis bskul 'dra khyod la 'dud/ /
Both hands signal with blue utpala flowers, 'Saṃsāric beings! Cling not to worldly pleasures, Enter the dty of the Great Liberation!' Like prods with a stick for Energy—to You I bow!
pad+ma rA ga'i mdangs ldan 'od dpag med/ / mnyam bzhag bdud rtsis gang ba'i lhung bzed bsnams/ / 'chi med dngos grub stsol bas spyi bor brgyan / / bdag gi 'chi bdag 'joms pa khyod la 'dud/ /
Ruby-coloured Amitābha holds In meditation an alms-bowl full of nectar And, granting the deathless siddhi, adorns Your crown, Subduing the lord of my death—to You I bow!
tshogs gnyis mtho ris bzo ba'i 'du byed kyis/ / gzhal med lha yi yid bzhin nor bu rnams/ / mdzes mdzes gcig tu bsdus pa'i yid 'phrog rgyan/ / kun gyis brgyan pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Formed by the builder of heaven[12]—Merits and Wisdom- Inestimable celestial wish-granting gems[13] Most beautiful, combined in captivating Ornaments, fully adorn You—homage to You!
margad ri bos 'ja' tshon gyon pa bzhin/ / sku stod lha rdzas gos kyi ga shal can/ / phra zhing ldem la mdzes pa'i rked skabs ni/ / pany+tsa li rka'i sham thabs 'dzin la 'dud/ /
Like an emerald mountain clothed in rainbows, Your upper body is draped in heavenly silks;[14] Your lovely, supple, slender waist supports A skirt of pañcalika[15]—to You I bow!
g.yas na mya ngan med pa'i 'od zer can/ / zhi ba'i nyams ldan gser ma/dog nyi 'od 'phro/ / g.yon na ral gcig nam mkha'i mdzes pa 'phrog / khro chags brjid pas mdzes pa de la 'dud/ /
On Your right, Mārīcī of the aśoka, Peaceful, golden, radiating sunlight. On Your left, Ekajaṭā, sky-blue,[16] wrathful But loving and bright, O Beauty—to You I bow!
drug ldan glu dang mdzes pa'i gar la mkhas/ / gdugs dkar rnga yab pi wang gling bu sogs/ / rab 'byams mchod rdzas 'dzin pa'i lha mo'i tshogs / / nam mkha' gang bas mchod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Skilled in musical songs[17] and gorgeous dances, Holding white parasols, chowries, vīṇās, flutes And endless such offering-objects, hosts of goddesses, Filling space, make offering—homage to You!
dpal mo [( ]36ba[) ]legs brjod ma dang ri skyes sogs/ / yid 'ong 'chi med bu mo stong dag gis/ / khyod drung bran mo tsam yang thob dka' ba/ / mdzes sdug lha mo'i sku la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Lakṣmī, Śacī, Pārvatī and thousands Of other attractive daughters of the gods Hardly come up to maid-servants before You— In goddess's form so lovely, homage to You!
thugs rje'i chu 'dzin rgyas pa'i klong yangs nas/ / gsung snyan tshangs dbyangs sprin gyi rnga sgra can/ / gdul bya'i 'dzin mar yan lag brgyad chos char/ / kun tu 'bebs mkhas ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

From the vast expanse of clouds of Your Compassion, Whose thunder is Your sweet voice of Brahmic tones, On the earth of disciples You're skilled in letting fall The eightfold rain of Dharma[18]—homage to You!
shes bya kun gzigs yon tan rgya mtsho'i gter / / ji bzhin ma lus brjod par su yis nus/ / blo gros thogs med stobs bcu mnga' ba'i thugs/ / mkhyen rab mthar phyin ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Ocean-like treasure of virtues, seeing all knowables! Who could describe You fully as You are? Your mind has the ten Powers of unobstructed perception— Mother perfect in Wisdom, homage to You!
zhi ba brnyes kyang thugs rje'i gzhan dbang gis/ / sdug bsngal rgya mtshor bying ba'i 'gro ba rnams/ / thugs rje'i phyag gis myur du 'dren mdzad ma/ / brtse ba mthar phyin ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
You have found Peace; yet governed by Compassion, You swiftly draw out with compassionate hand Sentient beings sunk in a sea of sufferings— Mother perfect in Mercy, homage to You!
zhi rgyas dbang dang drag po'i 'phrin las rnams/ / rgya mtsho'i rlabs bzhin dus las mi 'da' bar/ / lhun grub rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug mdzad ma/ / mdzad pa mthar phrin ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Your Calming, Increasing, Subduing and Fierce Activities, Like the tides[19] of the ocean, never late, You enter without effort or interruption, Mother perfect in Action—homage to You!
'jigs chen sdug bsngal brgyad dang 'byung po'i gdon/ / nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib pa'i 'jigs pa rnams/ / khyod zhabs dran pa'i mod la skyob mdzad ma/ / nus pa mthar phyin ma la/ phyag 'tshal lo/ /
The eight dread calamities,[20] harm by evil spirits, Obscurations of defilements and knowables— From these dangers You save us as soon as we think of You,[21] Mother perfect in Power—homage to You!
[Requests]
de ltar skyabs 'os khyod kyis lus can rnams/ / nad rims gdon bgegs dus min 'chi ba dang / / rmi lam ngan dang mtshan ma/ ngan pa sogs/ / 'jigs pa kun las myur du bskyab tu gsol/ /
Refuge thus worthy! From all dangers such As evil spirits, demons, sickness and plague, Untimely death, bad dreams and evil signs, Please protect embodied beings swiftly!
'jig tshogs lta ba'i ri sul gnas bcas te/ / gzhan las mchog tu 'dzin pas sems khengs shing / / pha rol khyad du gsod pa'i sbar khyim can/ / nga rgyal seng ge'i 'jigs pa bskyab tu gsol/ /

He dwells between the mountains of wrong views Of selfhood,[22] puffed up with holding himself superior, With long claws of contempt for other beings, The Lion of Pride—please save us from this fear![23]
dran shes lcags kyu rnon pos ma btul zhing / / 'dod yon myos chu 'thungs pas 'thoms pa pa'i mthus/ / log pa'i lam zhugs gnod 'tshe'i mche ba gtsigs/ / gti mug glang po'i 'jigs pa bskyab tu gsol/ /

Untamed by sharp hooks of mindfulness and awareness, And dulled by the maddening liquor of sensual pleasures, He enters wrong paths and shows his tusks of harming, Delusion's Elephant-save us from this fear!
tshul min yid byed rlung gis bskul ba las/ / nyes spyod dud sprin 'khrug pa'i klong dkyil na / / dge ba'i nags tshal sreg pa'i nus pa can/ / zhe sdang me yi 'jigs pa bskyab tu gsol/ /
Driven by the wind of wrong attention, Amidst a tumult of smoke-clouds of misconduct, It has the power to bum down forests of merits, The Fire of Anger—save us from this fear!
ma rig 'thibs po'i khung du mngon zhen cing / / gzhan 'byor phun tshogs mthong tshe mi bzod par/ / gdug pa'i dug gis myur du khyab byed pa'i/ / phrag dog sbrul gyi 'jigs pa bskyab tu gsol/ /
Attached to its dark hole of ignorance, It cannot bear seeing the wealth and excellence of others, But quickly fills them with its vicious poison, The Snake of Envy—save us from this fear!
brtul zhugs dman pa'i 'brog dgon 'jigs rung dang / / rtag chad mya ngam thang la rab rgyu zhing / / phan bde'i grong dang dgon pa kun 'joms pa'i/ / lta ngan rkun po'i 'jigs pa bskyab tu gsol/ /

Roaming the fearful wild of inferior practice[24] And ghastly desert plains of the two extremes,[25] They sack the towns and retreats of ease and bliss, The Thieves of Wrong Views—save us from this fear!
mi bzad srid pa'i btson khang ra ba ru / / lus can rang dbang med par 'ching byed cing / / sred pa'i sgo lcags dbye dkas 'khyud pa yi/ / ser sna'i lcags sgrog 'jigs pa bskyab tu gsol/ /
In the unbearable prison of saṃsāra It binds embodied beings, with no freedom, Clasped by the lock of Craving, hard to open— The Chain of Avarice—save us from this fear!
shin tu brgal dka' srid pa'i rgyun phyogs khyer/ / las rlung drag po'i rkyen dang nye ba las/ / skye rga na 'chi'i rba glong rab 'khrug pa'i/ / 'dod chags chu bo'i 'jigs pa bskyab tu gsol/ /

It sweeps us towards the stream of Becoming, so hard To cross, and, conditioned by karma's stormy blast, Waves of birth, age, sickness and death convulse it, Attachment's Flood—please save us from this fear!
kun tu rmongs pa'i mkha' la rab rgyu zhing / / nges pa don du gnyer la lhag par 'tshe/ / thar pa'i srog la rgol ba'i gdug pa can/ / the tshom sha za'i 'jigs pa bskyab tu gsol/ /
They wander in space of darkest ignorance, Sorely tormenting those who strive for Truth, Of lethal danger to Liberation, the Fell Demons[26] of Doubt—please save us from this fear!
khyod la bstod cing gsol ba btab pa'i mthus/ / dam chos sgrub pa'i 'gal rkyen zhi ba dang / / tshe dang bsod nams dpal dang 'byor pa sogs/ / mthun pa'i rkyen rnams yid bzhin 'grub par mdzod/ /
Through these praises and requests to You, Quell conditions bad for Dharma practice And let us achieve life, merits, wealth and plenty And other helpful conditions as we wish!
[Prayers]
zhing mchog bde ba can der 'gro ba kun/ / 'dren pa 'od dpag med pas rjes bzung nas/ / dka' ba brgya phrag spyad pa med par yang / / myur du sangs rgyas sa la reg gyur cig /
In Sukhāvatī Pine Land, let all beings Be received by Amitābha, Guide; And though not practising hundreds of arduous things,[27] Let them quickly reach the Buddha Stage!
bdag kyang rtag tu tshe rabs dran pa dang / / byang chub sems dang nam yang mi 'bral zhing / / rgyal sras spyod pa rlabs chen tshol ba la/ / brtson 'grus chu bo'i rgyun bzhin bsten par shog /
May I always remember previous lives, Never be parted from the Bodhi-mind, And maintain Energy like the flow of a river In pursuing the Buddha-child's powerful conduct!
rang don bsgrub la nam yang mi re zhing / / gzhan don 'ba' zhig bsgrub la gzhol ba dang / / spyan dang mngon shes smra mkhas bzod pa sogs/ / gzhan don byed pa'i rkyen rnams tshang bar shog /
Never hoping to benefit myself, Devoted only to benefiting others, Let me have all that's needed for helping others— The Eyes, Superknowledges,[28] Eloquence, Patience and so forth!
rab 'byams zhing du rgyal ba'i dam chos kun/ / rgyas par byed la nam yang mi zhum zhing / / rtag tu sems can kun don bsgrub pa'i phyir/ / rgyal ba'i go 'phang bde blag thob gyur cig /
So that in infinite worlds I may spread all The Conquerors' True Dharma, never dismayed, And always work the weal of all sentient beings, Let me swiftly gain a Conqueror's rank!

rje btsun bcom ldan 'das ma seng ldeng nags kyi sgrol ma la bstod pa mkhas pa'i gtsug rgyan zhes bya ba 'di ni / shAkya'i dge slong dge 'dun grub pa dpal bzang pos yun ring du gsol ba btab ste/ byang chub chen po'i dben gnas theg chen pho brang du legs par sbyar ba'o// //

This Praise of the Venerable Lady Khadiravaṇī Tārā, called the Crown Jewel of the Wise, was composed by the Buddhist monk Gedün-dr'up-pa Päl-zang-po after long practice at the Great Enlightenment retreat at T'ek-ch'en P'o-dr'ang.[29]
Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson.
