PRAISES AND REQUESTS TO THE ASSEMBLY OF DEITIES OF THE VENERABLE MOTHER OF THE TWENTY-ONE HOMAGES
By Matisāra (Lo-dr'ö Gyats'o)
@##/ /na mo A r+ya tA re ya/
Homage to Ārya-Tārā!
Praises
rab 'byams rgyal ba kun gyi 'phrin las las/ / legs 'khrungs khams gsum 'gro ba thams cad kyi/ / skyabs mchog thugs rje'i gter gyur rje btsun ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs kyi pad+mor 'dud/ /
Well-born of the holy Actions of all universal Conquerors! Supreme Refuge of all the three Realms' Beings! Venerable Treasure of Compassion! - I bow at Your lotus feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors![4]
'phrin las skad cig glog ltar myur pa yis/ / rgyal sogs bsgrub bya'i dgra dang log 'dren sogs/ / thams cad bran ltar dbang du 'gyur mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

With divine actions quick as instant lightning, You make the foes of the Conquerors or objects of practice, And Ganesh and others, all as obedient as slaves— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
nad rims gdon bgegs dus min 'chi ba dang / / rmi lam ngan dang sgrib pa ngan pa sogs/ / mi mthun mun pa ma lus zhi mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gud phyag 'tshal/ /
Demons of sickness and plague and evil spirits, Untimely death, bad dreams and obscurations— All such dark adversity You quell! — Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!

yon tan legs tshogs bsod nams dbang thang dang / / dpal 'byor phun tshogs grub gnyis thams cad dang / / 'phags nor bdun rnams rab tu rgyas 'dzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

All qualities, good collections, merits and power, Glory, excellence, and two kinds of realizations,[5] And the Āryas’ seven Treasures, You fully develop— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
snod bcud bkrag mdangs gzi brjid kun spel zhing / / khyad par 'chi med rig 'dzin mchog ster zhing / / 'chi bdag g.yul las rnam par rgyal mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

Of beings and world You increase all the splendour and majesty, Granting the special, deathless, supreme siddhi,[6] And You conquer in battle the Lord of Death! — Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
sgrub po thar par bgrod pa'i cha rkyen du/ / yid 'ong mos pa'i tshogs rnams thams cad kun/ / nyur du 'gugs shing mthun pa'i las mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

As requisites for practitioners travelling to Freedom, You quickly summon each and every pleasing And longed-for collection, and do conducive actions— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
khyod nyid yid la dran pa tsam gyis kyang / / phyogs skyong bcu sogs 'byung po'i tshogs rnams kun/ / bran bzhin gus pas legs par 'dus mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

By the mere mental thought of You, You make All assemblies of spirits, such as the ten Directional Guardians, gather with servile devotion— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
pha rol gdug pa'i bsam sgyor ngan pa yis/ / rigs sngags mnan gtad byad ma rbod stong sogs/ / ma lus rang mthu rang la bzlog mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

Should evil ones, thinking and acting to injure others, Bring down on us magic spells, curses, imprecations And so on, You turn all their power back upon themselves- Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
rgyal ba'i bstan la gnod 'tshe'i gdug sems can/ / chos 'azhin la log par 'khu ba rnams/ / myur du lus srog so sor bral mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

From noxious beings, who injure the Conqueror's Doctrine, Perversely rebelling against right Dharma-conduct, You quickly separate the life and body— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
lus sems sdug bsngal bskyed par byed pa yis/ / phyi dang nang gi mi mthun gnod pa las/ / 'di phyi kun tu bsrung zhing skyobs mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

From outer and inner adversities and harm Through producers of suffering physical and mental, You guard and protect us in this and all future lives— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
gang la skyabs su gsol na 'tshe byed pa'i/ / bdud dang mu stegs byed kyi log pa'i sems/ / zhi nas yang dag lam la sbyor mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

If one seeks Refuge in You, You quell his injurious Maras, and perverse thought of tīrthika conduct, And then apply him to the perfect Path- Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
zas nor longs spyod bang mdzod rkang 'gro sogs/ / 'dod dgu'i rin chen char rgyun chen po yis/ / dbul phongs bkres skom ma lus sel mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

With torrents of rain of all desired precious things, Such as food and wealth and stores of enjoyments and beasts, You eliminate every poverty, hunger and thirst— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
bsam pa'i don kun yid bzhin 'grub mdzad cing / / 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i dge legs dang / / bkra shis phyogs dus kun tu khyab mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

You let us achieve every aim we intend, as we wish; With mundane and supermundane auspiciousness and Goodness, You fill the directions all the time— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
bgegs dang bar chad mtshan ma ngan pa rnams/ / khyod sku yid la dran pa tsam gyis kyang / / 'jigs med rdo rje'i gur du 'jug mdzad ma/ / rgyal ma sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

For hindering demons, obstructions and evil signs, Just by one's mentally recollecting Your form, You put him in a vajra tent, without fear— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
khro gnyer shin tu bskyod pa'i gdangs mig gis/ / nye bar 'tsho ba'i sems 'chang log 'dren bgegs/ / thams cad rdul phran bzhin du brlag mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum =
With frowning, very active, open eyes, You smash as if into atoms all bearers in mind Of cruelty, Gaṇeśa and his hindering demons— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
ngan song gnas su 'phen byed las nyon gyi/ / sdig sgrib thams cad khyod zhal dran tsam gyis/ / ma lus byang zhing dag par mdzad pa'i ma/ / rgyal yum =

All sins and obscurations of karma and kleśa Which throw one into the realms of woe, You cleanse And purify, Mother, just through recalling Your face— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
gnas lugs don rtogs zab mo'i shes rab dang / / 'chad rtsod rtsom dang thos bsam sgom gsum gyi/ / shes rab thams cad 'phel zhing rgyas mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum =

Deep Wisdom which realizes True Nature's meaning; explaining, Debating and writing; the wisdoms of listening, thinking And meditation -all these You increase and develop! - Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
'jig rten gsum kun skad cig g.yo ba yi/ / nus pas dgra dang chom rkun ma lus kun/ / 'ching zhing gnon par mdzad pa'i bcom ldan ma/ / rgyal yum =

With power that shakes all the three worlds in an instant, Every enemy, robber and thief, without Exception, Victorious Mother, You bind and subdue— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
dug dang sbyar ba'i dug gi gnod pa dang / / klu dang sa bdag gdug pa'i dug nad kun/ / myur du ming tsam med par zhi mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum =

Harm from poison and contagion, and all Poisoning by noxious nāgas and earth-owning spirits, You quickly allay till the very name does not exist— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
phan tshun rtsod dang rgyal po'i 'jigs pa yis/ / khrims kyis mnar dang rmi lam ngan pa sogs/ / thams cad myur du zhi ba'i las mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum =

Mutual conflict, torment by the law Through fear of the king, and bad dreams—on all such things You perform the action of rapidly pacifying— Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
shin tu mi bzad drag po'i nad rims dang / / mi mthun gnod pa'i tshogs rnams ma lus pa/ / thams cad bsrung zhing kun tu zhi mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum =

Most violent and unbearable sickness and plagues And every adverse and injurious group - All these You protect from, and totally pacify! — Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
gnod dang ro langs gnod sbyin 'jigs zhi zhing / / rgyas dang dbang drag la sogs rab 'byams las/ / don rnams thams cad yid bzhin 'grub mdzad ma/ / rgyal yum sgrol ma'i zhabs la gus phyag 'tshal/ /

Your universal actions, like calming spirits, Corpse-raisers, yakṣas and fears; increasing, subduing And fierceness; and all aims, You accomplish at will- Devout, I prostrate at Your feet, Tārā, Mother of Conquerors!
Song of Longing, and making requests
! kye ma 'phags mas bdag la cung zad dgongs/ / khyod kyi sku gsung thugs kyi yon tan kun/ / 'gro ba'i don du mngon du mdzad lags shing / /
Alas! Lady Āryā, listen a little to me! All qualities of Your Body, Speech and Mind Are manifested for sentient beings' sake.
gdul bya'i bsam pa legs par mkhyen pa dang / / rab 'byams rgyal ba kun gyi 'phrin las su/ / lha mo khyod nyid dngos su shar bas na/ /
You understand well the thoughts of Your disciples, And in all the universal Conquerors' holy Actions, O Goddess, You directly appear!

myur du 'khor ba'i mtshi las sgrol 'gyur ma'i/ / mtshon 'di rna bar lhung ba'i mod nyid du/ / chags sdan skyes bu'i snying la chags yul bzhin/ / bdag gi yid kyi dad pa'i rol mtsho na/ / khyod sku'i zla ba'i snang brnyan yang yang shar/ /

So, as soon as this name of Her Who Quickly Liberates From the Samsaric Ocean falls on my ears, Like the beloved in the heart of a lover, Again and again, Your moon-like Body's reflection Appears in the dancing lake of my mental devotion.
bdag gi tshe sngon thog ma med pa nas/ / nyon mangs dbang gis mi dge'i las bsags pas/ / yang nas yang du ngan 'gro'i gnas su lhung / / bzod dka'i sdug bsngal drag po mtha' yas myong / /

Since, in my previous lives without beginning, I've gathered unwholesome karma through defilements, Again and again I have fallen to realms of woe, And experienced endless, unbearable, violent suffering.
mi yi 'gro ba gcig pu'i lus blangs pa'i / / rnag khrag bsags na rgya mtsho che bas mang / / sha rus spungs na lhun po las kyang mtho/ /
de ltar sdug bsngal drag po myong mod kyang / / skyabs mchog khyod kyi thugs rjes ma bzung na/ / de dung de bas ches mang 'khyams pa 'gyur/ / kye hud 'khor ba'i 'jigs las bdag skyobs shig /

But though I have thus experienced violent suffering, If, Supreme Refuge, You don't seize me with Your Compassion, Still I shall have to wander much more than that. Alas! O, rescue me from the fears of saṃsārā!
sngon tshe phun tshogs dga' ldan lha yul du/ / ston mchog dam pas rgyal sras bajam dpal la/ / legs par bka' stsal rgyud kyi rgyal po las/ / gsungs pa'i bstod pa bstod 'gyur zhing / /

Of yore, in the perfect deity land of Tuṣita, The Supreme Holy Teacher gave utterance to The Conquerors' Son Mañjuśrī, pronouncing that those Who praised with the supreme Praises[8] that are taught In the King of Tantras would win immeasurable virtues.

bzlas bsgom mchod dang gsol ba btab gyur kyang / / snyigs dus skye bo'i spyod tshul ngan gzigs te/ / 'phags mas bdag sogs btang snyoms mdzad lags na/ / dman pa rnams la chas cher brtse ba dang / / myur zhing sgrol ba'i mtshan gyi dgos pa ci/ /

If, although with my effort I've praised with these Praises, Recited and practised, made offerings and requested, You see the foul conduct of beings of times of decline And, Āryā Mother, act with indifference towards us, Then what is the use of Your names of 'Specially Loving Towards Inferior Beings', 'Swift One', and 'Saviour'?

'on kyang khyod kyi brtse ba'i thugs rje ni/ / nye ring bral bas kun la 'dzug pa'i phyir/ / skal dman bdag gi las kyi sgrib pas nongs/ / de ltar mod kyang da ni kho bo yis/ / khyod las lhag pa'i skyabs gzhan mi rnyed pas/ /
tshe rabs kun tu lhag pa'i lha khyod kyis/ / skad cig tsam yang 'bral med rjes bzung ste/ / zhal mchog mig gi bdud rtsir dngos su mdzod/ /
So in all future lives, Superior Deity, will You Look after me without parting for even an instant, And manifest Your supreme face as visual nectar!
phyi nang 'jigs pa brgyad las skyabs pa dang / / nyi shu rtsa gcig las kyi rim pa sogs/ / rab 'byams las kun yid la dran tsam gyis/ / thams cad myur du lhun gyis 'gub par mdzod/ /
Rescuing from the eight fears, outer and inner;[9] Your twenty-one ways of action, and all such Universal actions-just by thinking, Make all these quickly spontaneously arise!
bdag gis dam chos bsgrub la bgegs byed pa'i/ / mi dang mi min 'byung po'i tshogs rnams dang / / 'jigs pa brgyad sogs bar du gcod pa kun/ / thams cad ma lus zhi bar mdzad du gsol/ /
All that hinder my practice of the Dharma— Assemblies of human beings, ghosts and spirits, And all interruptions such as the eight fears— Please will You pacify without exception!
khyad par skyabs mchog khyed kyi thugs rje las/ / bdag gi rgyud la phun ci log pa'i blo/ / skad cig tsam yang skye bar mi 'gyur bar/ / dge sems 'ba' zhig skye bar byin gyis rlobs/ /
Especially, Supreme Refuge, from Your Compassion, In my mindstream let not perverse thoughts Be born for even an instant, but let only Wholesome minds arise—inspire me thus!
khyad par legs tshogs kun 'byung gzhi gcig pu/ / mtshan nyid ldan pa'i gzhes gnyen dam pa mchog / bsam dang sbyor bas tshul bzhin bsten pa dang / / dgyes bzhin rjes su 'dzin par byin gyis rlobs/ /
Especially, on the sole base of all good collections' Arising, a qualified, supreme, holy Guru, Let me rely correctly with thoughts and actions And follow him as he wishes—inspire me thus!
tshe gcig sangs rgyas bsgrub par nus pa'i rten/ / lan cig tsam zhig snyed pa'i dal 'byor 'di/ / nam mkha'i glog star myur du 'jig pa'i sems/ / skyes te snyin po len par byin gyis rlobs/ /

The base with which Buddhahood can be achieved in one life, This opportune, fortunate rebirth, found but once, Perishes fast as lightning. Let me produce This thought, and grasp its essence—inspire me thus!
shi nas ngan 'gror skye ba'i 'jigs bsam ste/ / mi dge spong zhing dge ba bsgrub pa dang / / sngar byas sdig kun 'gyod pas bshags pa dang / / slan chad sdom par nus par byin = /
Driven by fear of woeful rebirth after death, Let me abandon unvirtue and practise virtue, Confess with regret all the sins I've created before, And be able to stop them henceforth—inspire me thus!
mi gtsang btsog chu bdud rtsir mthong ba bzhin/ / 'khor ba'i phun tshogs bde bar mi mthob bar/ / de las myur du thar 'dod blo skyes te/ / rgyal ba'i bstan la slob par byin = /
Like seeing filthy sewage as amṛta, Let me not see saṃsāra's perfections as bliss, But produce the mind that wants to be free of it quickly, And train in the Conqueror's Doctrine—inspire me thus!
sdug bsngal gyis mnar bde bas phongs pa yis/ / mar gyur 'gro rnams sangs rgyas sar 'god pa'i/ / byang chub mchog tu legs par sems bskyed nas/ / rlabs chen spyod la slob par byin = /

Since they are tortured by suffering and poor in happiness, Let me produce well the thought of Supreme Awakening, Which sets in Buddhahood sentient beings, my mothers, And train in the Powerful Conduct[10]— inspire me thus!
khyad par zhi lhag zung du 'brel ba'i lam/ / zab mo dbu ma'i lta ba khyad par can/ / ji bzhin legs par rgyud la skyes gyur nas/ / mthar 'dzin drangs nas 'byin par byin = /
Especially, let the Path uniting Calm And Insight—the Middle View, excellent and profound— Be born within my mindstream well and truly, And grasping at extremes uprooted —inspire me thus!
de nas theg mchog bstan la legs zhugs nas/ / rnam dag dbang gi cho bos rgyud smin te/ / ji ltar khas blangs dam tshig sdom pa rnams/ / mig 'bras bzhin du srung bar byin = /
Then let me enter the Supreme Vehicle teaching And ripen my mind with the rivers of pure empowerments, Protecting the vows and pledges that I've taken As the apple of my eye—inspire me thus!
rnam mang rgyud sde'i snying po rim pa gnyis/ / ji bzhin rtogs nas legs par bsgom pa yis/ / zung 'jug sku bzhi'i go 'phang yid bzhin nor/ / myur du rgyud la skye bar byin = /

Let me understand right the two Stages, heart of the various Tantras, then quickly, by good meditation, produce In my mindstream the state of Union of the Four Kāyas, A wish-fulfilling jewel—inspire me thus!
sngon sangs rgyas nas mar gyur 'gro ba rnams/ / re re'i mdun du sprul pa dpag med pa/ / bstan te sgrib gnyis thams cad spangs pa yis/ / sangs rgyas sa la 'god bar byin =
Showing before each mother sentient being Countless emanations, when I'm Buddha earlier, Let me transfer them to Buddhahood, through the abandonment Of all their two obscurations—inspire me thus!
rang nyid rgyal ba'i mdzad pa bsgrub pa'i zhing / / 'khor dang sku tshe'i tshad la sogs pa kun/ / bde gshegs kun gzigs las kyang ches lhag pa'i/ / yon tan dam pa thob bar byin = /

Let the realm where I accomplish a Conqueror's Deeds, My entourage, the measure of my incarnation, And so on, all far surpass even Sugata All-Seeing's[11]- To gain these excellent qualities, please inspire me!
deng nas byang chub snyin por mchis kyi bar/ / 'khor 'das kun gyi legs tshogs rtsa ba ni/ / rgyal ba'i bstan pa kho nar legs shes nas/ / de 'dzin byed la brtson par byin =

From now till I reach the supreme point of Enlightenment,[12] Let me know well that the root of all good collections, Samsaric and beyond, is only the Conqueror's Doctrine, And strive to support and enact it—inspire me thus!
rnyed bkur grags 'dod 'du 'dzi g.yeng ba sogs/ / dam pas smad pa'i las li 'jug par/ / dben pa bsten nas thos don legs bsams shing / / sgrub pa snying por byed par byin = /

Wealth, respect, fame, desires, entertainments, diversions?- Let me not enter such actions blamed by the holy, But sticking to solitude, think well on meanings I've learned, And do the essential practice—inspire me thus!
rgyal ba'i dgongs pa phra zhing phra ba rnams/ / bde blag nyid du legs par rtogs 'gyur zhing / / 'phags pa'i nor sogs yon tan thams cad kyis/ / bdag rgyud yongs su gang bar byin gyis rlobs/ /
Let me realize easily and correctly The subtlest intentions of the Conqueror! May all qualities, such as the Āryas' Treasures, Completely fill my mindstream—inspire me thus!
de las byung ba'i mtha' yas dge ba yis/ / bdag gzhan 'gro ba ma lus thams cad kun/ / dam pa'i mgon gyi thugs rjes legs bzung nas/ / rnam dag lam dang 'bral bar gyur cig //
Through the infinite virtues arisen from this, May I and all other beings without exception Be well upheld by the Holy Protector's Compassion, Never becoming separate from the pure Path!
ces ba 'di yang rmongs brtul ma ti sA ra zhes bya ba zhig gis dben gnas nyi ma sdings su rang gi 'dod gsol byas pa'o// //
One overcome by obscurations, called Matisāra, made this request for his own wishes in the Nyima Ding (Sun Plateau) retreat.

Translated from the Tibetan [by Martin Willson] at Nalanda Monastery in France, on the 15th day of the 7th month of the Iron Bird year (14 September 1981), and subsequently revised with advice from the Venerable Geshe Rabten.
bkra shis// //
May it be auspicious!
@#/rje btsun sgrol ma'i gdung 'bod rat+na'i phreng ba zhes bya ba bzhugs so//

d.crumb: the garland of jewels, a song of longing

f.d: THE GARLAND OF JEWELS, A SONG OF LONGING FOR VENERABLE ARYA-TĀRĀ
(Dung-bö ratnä tr'eng-wa) By Lo-dr'ö gyats'o
@##/ /na mo gu ru many+dzu g+ho ShA ya/
Homage to Guru Mañjughoṣa![13]

gang zhig dran pas 'jigs brgyad kun sel zhing / / gzhan phan nam yang mi ngal brtse ba'i gter/ / gtan gyi skyabs mgon rje btsun sgrol ma yi/ / zhabs kyi pad+mor mgo bos gtug byas te/ / nyams thag smre ngag 'don la cung zad dgongs/ /

Dispelling the eight fears of whoever remembers You, Treasure of Love, never tired of helping others, Constant Protector, Venerable Tārā— I touch my head to the lotus of Your feet. Listen a little, while I lament my sorrows!
bdag ni mtha' med 'khor ba'i nags khrod du/ / nyon mongs gnyis 'thung bag med rgyu bas na/ / 'phags ma'i thugs rje'i lcags kyu gang du bzhugs/ /
While in the endless dense forest of saṃsāra I wander, careless, drenched in both kinds of defilements,[14] Āryā Mother, where is Your hook of Compassion?
kye ma kyi hud byams brtse'i rang bzhin ma/ / khyod ni phyogs bcu'i rgyal ba thams cad kyi/ / 'gro ba'i skyabs su dpang bskur mnga' gsol zhing / /
Ah me! Alas! O loving, kind-natured Mother! All the Conquerors of the ten directions Ordained and appointed You a Refuge for beings.
rang yang zhi bde'i ro lam chags par/ / 'gro don mdzad ces ring nas thos pa yis/ / bdag yid khyod kyi rjes su rab phyogs nas/ / skyabs gzhan spangs nas khyod la skyabs su gsol/ /
Unattached to enjoying Your own Nirvanic bliss, You help migrators, I've long heard it said. So, turning my mind in Your direction, I Renounce other refuge and seek Refuge in You.

da ni 'phags mas gzigs par ma gyur par/ / bdag nyid sdig pa'i khrod du bskyar lags na/ / brtse ldan ma yi thugs rje gang du song / / rlabs chen sems bskyed yal bar 'dor ba na/ / dam pa'i las la de ni rung ngam ci/ /

If now, Āryā Mother, without a glance You abandon me amid my mass of sins, Where has Your loving Mother's Compassion gone? If You damp down Your surging Bodhicitta, In Your sacred office, is this quite the thing?
sngon du khyod kyi zhal bstan rjes bzung ba/ / gangs ri'i ljongs 'dir grangs las 'das zhes thos/ / de dag rdzun nam 'phags mas nye ring mdzad/ /
Of yore, You've shown Your face and cared for people Times past counting, here in Tibet, I've heard. Āryā, is this a lie, or have You favourites?
'on te khyod ni dman la lhag par du/ / brtse bar gyur na dus 'dir zhal bstan zhing / / gsung gi bdud rtsis bdag gi dbugs dbyung la/ / sdig pa'i dri ma ma lus 'khrud par mdzod/ /
Well, if You're specially kind to inferior beings, Then, this minute, come and show Your face! With the nectar of Your voice, give me refreshment, Wash off all my stains of evil actions!
'di nas tshe yi 'du byed gtong ma thag / zhing mchog rmad byung bde ba can zhing du/ / mgon po 'od dpag med mgon zhabs drung du/ / gsung gi bdud rtsi myong bar byin gyis rlobs/ /
Next, as soon as I leave this life's formations, In His wonderful Pure Land, Sukhāvatī, Near the Protector, Amitābha Buddha, May I taste His Speech's nectar-inspire me thus!
zhing mchog de nas dag pa'i zhing gzhan du/ / rdzu 'phrul shugs kyis bgrod par nus gyur cing / / bdag gi sprul pas 'gro ba sgrol ba la/ / spyan ras gzigs dbang lta bur 'gyur bar shog /
From that most excellent Realm, to other Pure Lands Let me be able to travel through magical powers, And saving migrating beings by my emanations, Let me become like Lord Avalokita!
der ma son pa'i tshe rabs kun tu yang / / rje btsun bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma yi/ / zhal mdzal gsung thos rjes su 'dzin pa dang / / bka' bzhin sgrub pa bgyid par rlobs/ /
Throughout all my lifetimes yet to come, Let me meet the Venerable Lady, Tārā, hear Her Speech, be cared for by Her, And carry out Her orders—inspire me thus!
rigs 'byor phun tshogs shes rab snying rje che/ / dad dang nges 'byung bsam pa brtan po yis/ / rtag tu byang chub bsgrub la brtson pa la/ / bar chad ma lus zhi bar byin = /
With rank, wealth, fortune, wisdom, great compassion, Faith, renunciation and firm intention, Let me always strive to achieve Enlightenment, While every hindrance is quelled—inspire me thus!
rab tu byung ste ji srid 'tsho yi bar/ / so thar sdom par bgal ba'i bya ba ni/ / cung zad tsam yang bgyid par mi 'gyur zhing / / thun mong lam la slob par byin =
From my ordination, as long as I live, Contrary to my Prātimokṣa vows Let me not perform the slightest action, But practise the common Path—inspire me thus!
srid pa'i phun tshogs spu gri'i dong ring dang / / tshe 'di'i snang ba sgyu ma'i rol rtsed du/ / shes shing rgyud la skyes te rnam mkhyen sar/ / bgrod pa'i thabs la 'bad par byin = /

The best of saṃsāra's a razor-edge sticking up; This life's appearances just a play of illusion— This knowledge born in my mind, let me strive in the means Of reaching Omniscience—please inspire me thus!
rang rgyud smin byed pha rol phyin drug dang / / gzhan la phan phyir bsdu ba bzhi la ni/ / rtag tu brtson pa'i shugs kyis bslab byas te/ / ji bzhin rgyud la skye bar byin = /

In the six Perfections which ripen one's own mindstream, And four Attractions whose purpose is helping others, Let me train with the force of continuous effort, Growing them right in my mindstream- inspire me thus!
de nas thun mong ma yin zab mo'i lam/ / rdo rje theg pa'i lam la nyer zhugs te/ / mtshan nyid kun ldan bshes gnyen dam pa las/ / dbang bzhi rnam dag thob par byin = /
Then, let me enter swiftly the Profound Uncommon Path, the Path of the Vajra Vehicle, And from a fully qualified Spiritual Friend Receive the four pure empowerments—inspire me thus!
rim pa dang po'i lam la legs bsgoms pas/ / skye shi bar do 'i dri ma kun sbyangs te/ / bde chen lha yi 'khor lo'i zhal mthong nas/ / rim pa gnyis par slob par byin = /

Through practising well the path of the First Tantric Stage, May I purify all the stains of birth, death and bardo, And seeing the circle of deities of Great Bliss, Train in the Second Stage—inspire me thus!
rim pa gnyis pa'ang rgyud las gsungs pa bzhin/ / re re la yang myong ba legs thon te/ / slob pa'i zung 'jug mtha' ru phyin gyur nas/ / mi slob zung 'jug thob par byin = /
On the Second Stage also, as taught in the Tantras, Let me gain the full experience of each level, And having perfected the Learning Union, gain The Union Beyond Learning[15]—inspire me thus!
de nas ma dag zhing khams du ma na/ / bdag gis sprul pa du ma spros gyur te/ / stong nyid lta dang 'brel ba'i sngags lam gyis/ / 'gro ba ma lus 'dren par byin gyis rlobs/ /
After that, to many impure lands Let me send out many emanations, And by the Mantra Path linked with the view of Emptiness Guide every sentient being—inspire me thus!
rje btsun bcom ldan 'das ma'i thugs rje yis/ / bdag gi ji ltar smras pa'i bden tshig rnams/ / ji bzhin 'grub cing mdor na bsam pa kun/ / ma lus bde blag nyid du 'byung gyur cig /
Through Your Compassion, Venerable Lady, May my sincere words, just as I've expressed them, Be fulfilled! In short, may all my wishes Without exception easily come to pass!

ces pa gdung 'bod rat+na'i 'phreng ba 'di/ / dus gsum rgyal ba'i yum mchog rje btsun ma'i/ / thugs rgyud bskul byed byin rlabs dpag tu med/ / tshul 'dir sgo gsum gus pas 'bad par rigs/ / de skad dad ldan slob mas nan cher du/ / bsku tshe 'jam dbyangs bla ma tsong kha par/ mi phyed dad thob rje btsun sgrol ma nyid/ / ring nas lhag pa'i lhar bsnyen gus bstan pa/ / shAkya'i btsun pa blo gros rgya mtshos sbyar / / dge 'dis 'gro kun kun mkhyenathob phyir bsngo / / tshe rabs kun tu rje btsun 'phags ma rjes su 'dzin par gyur cig/ //

This is a Song of Longing, the Garland of Jewels. When a faithful disciple strongly urged That an exhortation to the Venerable Supreme Mother of Conquerors of the three times Would have immeasurable blessings, and in that way One should strive devotedly with the three doors, The Buddhist monk, Lo-dr'ö gyats'o, composed it, having With unchanging faith in the Mañjughoṣa Guru Tsongk'a-pa, long revered as his Special Deity Venerable Tārā, so that by These merits, all beings may gain Omniscience.
Translated from the Tibetan [by Martin Willson]
@#//rje btsun sgrol ma'i gsung 'bod bslu med ma gzhugs so/ /

d.crumb: a song of longing for tārā, the infallible

f.d: A SONG OF LONGING FOR TĀRĀ, THE INFALLIBLE
(Dung-bö lu-me-ma) By Lozang tänpä gyälts'än
@##/ /na mo gu ru Ar+ya tA re ya/
Homage to Guru Ārya-Tārā!

skyabs gnas rin chen bslu med rnam pa gsum/ / gcig bsdus thugs rje'i bdag nyid rje btsun mar/ / [gus pas {?}snying nas ]'dud do byang chub snying po'i bar/ / khyed kyis thugs rje'i lcags kyus bzung du gsol/ /
Three infallible Jewels of Refuge combined In one, Divine Mother Whose nature is Compassion, I bow to You from my heart! Till I'm enlightened, Support me, I pray, with the hook of Your Compassion!

kha tsam ma yin dkon mchog dbang [gsol {?}tshol ]nas/ / snying khong rus pa'i gting nas gsol 'debs kyi/ / cung zad dgongs ma 'dzum pa'i zhal bstan nas/ / gsung gi bdud rtsi stsol dang brtse ldan ma/ /

I call the Jewels as witness-from not just my mouth, But the depth of my inmost heart and bones, I pray— Think of me somewhat! Show me Your smiling face! Loving One, grant me the nectar of Your Speech!
rang bzo'i chos kyis gzhan mgo bskor byed cing / / mtshan nyid mi rtag nor ngor chos mtshongs ba/ / mi shes shes par bsgrogs shing chos brgyad gyis/ / rnam par 'gying pa'i bla chen bla chung sogs/ /

Others cheat us with their made-up teachings, Selling Dharma for money that's marked by impermanence,[3] Proclaiming ignorance knowledge, puffed up with pride Through the eight worldly dharmas,[4] gurus great and small.
snyigs dus bshes la blo gtad mi 'dug pas/ / nga yi bla ma'i gtso bo khyed rang yin/ / byin gyis rlobs shig brtse pa'i bdag nyid ma/ / thugs rje'i mthu dpung bskyed cig nges par dgongs/ /
Since I cannot trust such Friends[5] of degenerate times, The principal Guru of mine is You Yourself. Inspire me, Mother of the nature of love! Arouse Your great power of Compassion! Think of me!

skyabs su bsten na kun [gyis {?}kyang ]mi bslu mod/ / 'on kyang snyigs dus spyod tshul ngan gzigs nas/ / sangs rgyas phal cher zhi bde'i ro la g.yengs/ / la la thugs rje'i che yang las 'brel chung / /
bdag la yi dam gzhan na mi 'dug pas/ / nga yi yi dam gtso bo khyed rang yin/ / dngos grub stsol zhig brtse ba'i bdag nyid ma/ / thugs rje'i mthu dpung bskyed cig nges par dgongs/ /
Since I have no other Yidam Deity, My principal Deity is You Yourself. Grant me siddhis, Mother of loving nature! Arouse Your great power of Compassion! Think of me!
chos bsrung phal cher nus mthu rtsal mi maton/ / sgrub pa po la 'khrel nas las mi sgrub/ / la la 'jig rten dregs pas khengs pa yis/ / 'phral legs phugs su bslu ba la sogs pa/ /
Most protectors[7] don't show their powers and skills— Disgusted with their practitioners, they do not act. Others, proud of worldly fame, may be Good for a while, but cheat us in the end.

chos [bsrung {?}skyong ]rnams la blo gtad mi [gtug {?}'dug ]pas/ / nga yi bsrung ma'i gtso bo khyed rang yin/ / 'phrin las sgrub shig brtse ba'i bdag nyid ma/ / thugs rje'i mthu 'apung bskyed cig nges par dgongs/ /
Since I cannot trust protectors such as these, My principal Protector is You Yourself. Fulfil the Activities, Mother of loving nature! Arouse Your great power of Compassion! Think of me!
ming dang don mtshungs 'jig rten phal ba'i nor/ / nyon mongs bskyed cing 'khor bar 'ching bas na/ / 'phags nor ma gtogs yid bzhin yin na yang / / 'chi tshe til tsam 'khyer dbang ga la mchis/ /

Common worldly riches, the meaning like the name,[8] Arouse defilements and bind one in saṃsāra. What jewels,[9] except the Āryas', though they grant wishes, Can let me take even a sesame seed when I die?
[sgyu {?}rgyu ]ma'i nor la blo gtad mi 'dug pas/ / nga yi nor gyi gtso bo khyed rang yin/ / dgos 'dod stsol zhig brtse ba'i bdag nyid ma / / thugs rje mthu dpung bskyed cig nges par dgongs/ /
Since I cannot trust illusory riches, The principal wealth I have is You Yourself. Grant my desires, O Mother of loving nature! Arouse Your great power of Compassion! Think of me!

nyin gcig la yang blo gtad [me phong {?}mi pher ]zhing / / log par spyod pa'i bsam pa 'char byed pa/ / nye nye ltar ston [sdig pa'i {?}mi dge'i ]grogs po ni/ / [grogs {?}'dod ]tshe grogs byed [min tshe {?}mi 'dod ]dgra po byed/ /
Not fit to be trusted even for one day, Their thoughts determinedly set on misbehaviour, Just acting friendly, these friends of no virtue Play the friend when they wish, the enemy when they don't.
snyigs dus grogs la blo gtad mi 'dug pas/ / nga yi grogs kyi gtso bo khyed rang yin/ / je nyer mdzod cig brtse ba'i bdag nyid ma/ / thugs rje'i mthu dpung bskyed cig nges par dgongs/ /
Since I cannot trust these friends of degenerate times, The principal friend of mine is You Yourself. Be close to me, O Mother of loving nature! Arouse Your great power of Compassion! Think of me!
mdor na bla ma yi dam chos bsrung dang / / skyabs dang gnas mal zas nor grogs 'khor sogs/ / gang dang gang gi don kun khyod yin pas/ / ma lus bde blag nyid du 'grub par mdzod/ /
In short, my Guru, my Deity and Protector, My Refuge, dwelling, food, wealth, friends and all— Everything whatsoever I wish, You are; So make me accomplish everything easily!
bdag kyang da lta'i lang shor blo 'di nyid/ / dgags te 'gro ba re re'i don du yang / / lus srog khri 'bum gtong la thug na yang / / ngal med snying rje skyes par byin gyis rlobs/ /
Let me stop also my present stubborn mind, And rouse the Compassion that even on coming to give A billion times for every being's sake My body and life, tires not—inspire me thus!
'khor ba'i byed po bdag 'dzin drungs 'byin pa/ / shin tu rtogs dka' zab mo dbu ma'i lam/ / rtag chad nor 'khrul thams cad rab spangs pa'i/ / rnam dag lta ba rtogs par byin gyis rlobs/ /
The uprooter of saṃsāra's maker, self-grasping, The deep Middle Way, so hard to understand, Avoiding all errors of the two extremes,[10] Pure Right View—please inspire me to realize it!

'gro ba'i don du sangs rgyas thob 'dod cing / / rang bde'i bsam pa skad cig mi byed par/ / dge ba gang byas bstan 'gror bsngo ba yis/ / [des {?}nges ]'byung byang sems ['byor {?}'byung ]par byin gyis rlobs/ /

Wishing, for sentient beings' sake, to win Buddhahood, Let me not think for a moment of my own pleasure, But dedicating all virtues to beings and Doctrine, Perfect my renounced Bodhi-mind—inspire me thus!
dad sogs 'phags pa'i nor gyis rab phyugs cing / / rgyal bas gsungs pa'i bcas pa phra mo yang / / khyad gsod med par bsrung par nus pa yis/ / rgyal sras mchog tu 'gyur par byin gyis rlobs/ /
Rich in the Āryas' Treasures, faith and the rest, Let me become the best of Buddha-sons, able To keep the smallest precept taught by the Conquerors, Never contemptuous of it—inspire me thus!
phyi na nyan thos spyod pa [spyod {?}skyong ]tshul dang / / nang na zab mo rdo rje theg pa la/ / yid ches mos par rim gnyis lam bsgoms pas/ / myur du byang chub thob par gyin gyis rlobs/ /
In outward behaviour keeping the Hearer's conduct,[11] Let me, in inward belief, revere the Profound Vajrayāna, and practise the Two-Stage Path, So winning Enlightenment swiftly—inspire me thus!
skyid dam sdug gam legs sam nyes na yang / / bdag gis bya ba*gang dang gang byung yang / / rje btsun sgrol ma khyed rang mkhyen [lags {?}legs ]pas/ / brtse bar dgongs shing bdag gi ma gcig bu/ /
Whether I'm happy or troubled, whether things Go well or badly for me, whatever I do You know about it, Venerable Tārā, so Think of me lovingly, my only Mother!
bdag dang bdag la re ba'i 'gro ba kun/ / rje btsun sgrol ma khyed la 'bul lags pas/ / bdag gir 'dzad de dag pa'i zhing mchog tu/ / skyes pas ma chod myur du ['grol {?}'grod ]par mdzod/ /
Myself and all the beings with hopes of me I offer to You, Venerable Tārā! Make us Your own, and to the highest Pure Land Make us go quickly, with no births intervening!

rgyal ba'i bstan [zhing mi skyod {?}bzhin mi spyod ]bdag gi ma/ / ma gyur 'gro ba gang dag ci yod kun/ / khyod kyi thabs mkhas thugs rje'i lcags kyu yis/ / blo yid chos la 'gyur par [mdzad du gsol{?}byin gyis rlob]/ /
My mothers, who do not follow the Conquerors' Teachings, All mother sentient beings, whoever they are— With Your hook of compassionate skilful Means Please transform their minds into the Dharma!
'di nyid dus gsum dag du 'don byed cing / / rje btsun sgrol ma yid la bsam pa dang / / bdag la re ba'i 'gro ba ma lus pa/ / zhing mchog gang la mos der skyes par mdzod/ /
Reciting this at morning, noon and night, And bearing in mind Venerable Tārā, Let all sentient beings with hopes of me Be born in whatever Pure Land they desire!

dkon mchog rin chen gsum [du gsum {?}dang ]gtogs kun dang / / khyad par thugs rje'i bdag nyid rje btsun mas/ / byang chub snying po'i bar du rjes bzung ste/ / myur du bdud bzhi'i g.yul las rgyal par shog/ //

May every member of the Three Precious Jewels, Especially the Venerable Mother, compassionate-natured, Look after me till I reach the point of Enlightenment, Letting me conquer quickly the four Maras' hosts!

ces pa 'di kha tsam tshig tsam min par snying [khor {?}khong ]rus pa'i gting nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dus gsum du lan re brjod cing / brjod pa'i don bzhin khyod shes kyi blo [ling skyur {?}lengs sgyur ]byas nas rje btsun sgrol mas rjes su 'dzin cing zhal mthong par 'gyur ro/ bar chad gang [gis {?}kyang ] mi tshugs shing / bsam pa'i don grub par 'gyur par ro/ sangs rgyas sras dang bcas pas kyang mnyes shing rjes su 'dzin par 'gyur ro/ phyag 'tshal nyer gcig dang tshul 'di la 'bad cing / rje btsun sgrol ma sgrubs shig / ces pa ni bdag gi snying gtam yang dag pa yin no/ zhes rje btsun ma sgrol ma la gsol ba 'debs pa rang [gi 'dod gsol dang ]gzhan bslu med kyi snying gtam smras pa 'di yang / shA kya'i btsun blo bzang bstan pa'i rgyal mtshan gyis/ rang lo bcu dgu pa chu [byi {?}bya ]lo'i cho 'phrul zla ba'i tshe gsum la baN [rgad {?}sgar ]rnam rgyal gling du sbyar 'di yang phan yon che ba'i nges pa yang dang pa yod pa yin no// //

If you recite this morning, noon and night as long as you live, not just from your mouth, but from the depths of your innermost heart and bones, with your consciousness penetrating its inner meaning each time you recite it, Venerable Tārā will care for you and you will see Her face. No hindrance can harm you, and your intentions will be fulfilled. The Buddhas and their Offspring also will be pleased and will take care of you. Making effort in the Twenty-one Homages and this practice, realize Venerable Tārā! This is my heartfelt speech and quite certain. This prayer to the Venerable Tārā, in heartfelt words making his own requests and also non-deceptive to others, was composed by the Buddhist monk Lozang tänpä gyälts'än, in his nineteenth year, the Water Mouse year (1852), on the third day of the Miracle month,[12] at B'än-gar nam-gyäl ling. It is sure to have great benefits.
Translated from the Tibetan [by Martin Willson] in accordance with teachings of the Venerable Lama Thubten Yeshe.[13]
bsod nams 'di yi tshe rabs kun tu bdag / zhes dang / skad cig tsam yang bral par ma 'gyur cig /
bkra shis par gyur cig / dge'o// //
May auspiciousness prevail!
'phags ma sgrol ma 'jigs pa brgyad las skyob pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa'i thabs
SĀDHANA OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ CALLED PROTECTION FROM THE EIGHT FEARS (By Candragomin)
@##/ /rgya gar skad du/ Ar+ya tA rASh+Ta b+ha ya tra ta nA ma sA d+ha naM/ bod skad du/ 'phags ma sgrol ma 'jigs pa brgyad las skyob pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa'i thabs/
(Ārya-tārā-aṣṭabhaya-trāta-nāma-sādhana) SĀDHANA OF ĀRYA-TĀRĀ CALLED PROTECTION FROM THE EIGHT FEARS
[Translators' homage]
rje btsun ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the Venerable Tārā!
[Author’s homage]

kun mkhyen rgyal ba'i bdag po lhan cig skyes pa'i chos sku de bzhin du/ / longs spyod rdzogs dang sprul pa'i sku ste pad+ma'i 'dab ma bzhin du yangs pa'i spyan/ / rnal 'byor dag par rnam par thar gyur srid dang srid las bral ba'i sku gsung thugs chags pa/ / thabs dang shes rab gnyis med lha dang lha min mis mchod de la phyag 'tshal te/ /

Homage to the Omniscient Ruler of Conquerors with the innate Dharmakāya and Saṃbhogakāya and Nirmāṇakāya, Whose eyes are broad like petals of a lotus, Whose Body, Speech and Mind appear in saṃsāra and out of it, purely liberated by Practice; Who is non-dual Method and Wisdom, worshipped by gods, asuras and human beings!
[Promise of composition]

skye 'jig rnam par spangs phyir chos nyid mi 'gyur yang dag nyid du dbyer med kyang / / 'khrul bcas 'gro ba'i don phyir sku gsung thugs kyi phrin las khyad par gsang sngags lam/ / sgrib pa myur 'joms sna tshogs phyag rgya'i gzugs 'phros sangs rgyas thams cad skyed byed yum/ / 'jigs pa brgyad las sgrol ba 'di deng sgrub la dga' phyir dad pas brtsam par bya/ /

Since You've abandoned birth and destruction,[8] really You are inseparable from the unchanging True Nature (dharmatā); But for the sake of deluded migrators, You emanate manifold Goddess forms, acting with Body, Speech And Mind, in particular quickly subduing veils[9] of the Secret Mantra Path. Mother producing all Buddhas, Saving from the eight dangers! I shall now write in faith for [those who] delight in Your practice.
[PREPARATORY PRACTICES]
[Preparation]

dad ldan rab brtson dam tshig ldan/ / rje btsun sgrub la dga' ba yis/ / rnam par 'tshe med dben pa'i gnas/ / nyams dga' dngos grub 'byung gnas su/ /
rten dang mchod rdzas sna tshogs pa/ / bshams nas bde ba'i stan nyid la/ / rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi bzhugs tshul gyis/ / phyi nang khrus kyis dag byas te/ /

You who delight to practise the Goddess, faithful, diligent, keeping your pledges (samaya), Without violence, set out in a pleasant, lonely place An image as source of siddhis and various offerings. On a comfortable Seat sit in the Buddha's manner, purified outside and in by ablutions.
[Visualization]

de nas rang gi snying ga ru/ / nga ro dang po las byung ba'i/ / chu shel dbus su yi ge ni/ / sde tshan bzhi pa'i dang po la/ / lnga pa'i tha ma'i thig les brgyan/ / de yi 'od kyis rje btsun dang / / 'phags pa'i tshogs rnams spyan drangs te/ /

Then, at your heart, from the first vowel (A) appears a moonstone;[10] at its centre Is the first letter of the fourth series (TA), adorned with the dot of the last of the fifth (Ṃ).[11] This invokes with its light-rays the Goddess and the host of Āryas.
[The Seven Limbs, with Refuge and Bodhicitta]
[1. Prostration]
sangs rgyas kun gyi ye shes sku/ / gti mug ldongs pa'i sems can gyi/ / ma rig mun pa sel mdzad ma/ / bde gshegs sgrol ma phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Wisdom-body of all the Buddhas, dispelling the darkness of ignorance Of delusion-blinded sentient beings! Sugata Tārā, homage to You!
[2. Offering]

dri zhim me tog thams cad dang / / a ga ru sogs bdug spos dang / / rab tu mun sel sgron me dang / / ga pur la sogs dri yi mchog / gtsang sbyar bshos dang gzhan yang ni/ / sgra snyan la sogs mchod pa'i tshogs/ / thams cad dbul te sngags dang ni/ / phyag rgya'i rgyas kyang gdab par bya/ /

All kinds of sweet-scented flowers; incense such as aloe-wood (agaru); Lamps, eliminating darkness; camphor and other finest perfumes, Pure and mixed; foodstuffs; also melodious sounds-hosts of all such Offerings I offer [You), augmented with mantras and mudrās.
[3. Confession]
'khor ba thog ma med bar du/ / sdig bgyis gang lags ma lus pa/ / da lta nyid du bshags bgyis nas/ / slan chad nam yang mi bgyid do/ /
Every evil I have done in beginningless saṃsāra At this moment I confess; henceforth I shall never do it.
[4. Rejoicing in virtue]
rdzogs sangs rgyas sogs 'phags rnams dang / / 'gro ba kun gyi dge ba ni/ / zag med zag dang bcas pa la/ / bsam pas rjes su yi rang ngo / /
Thinking of the virtue done, with and without contamination, By perfect Buddhas, other Āryas and all migrators, I rejoice.
[5. Requesting Teachings]
'gro mgon sprin bral nyi ma yi/ / dkyil 'khor rgyas par gyur rnams la/ / 'gro ba rnams la phan pa'i phyir/ / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul/ /
Sentient beings' Protectors, like the full, unclouded disk of the sun, I exhort to turn the wheel of Dharma so as to aid[12] migrating beings.
[6. Asking to remain]
rgyal ba zag med dbyings nyid du/ / mya ngan 'das gzigs bzhed rnams la/ / ji srid 'khor ba gnas kyi bar/ / mya ngan mi 'da' bzhugs par gsol/ /
Conquerors who wish to receive Nirvana in the uncontaminate sphere: As long as saṃsāra remains, please stay, not entering Nirvāṇa!
[7. Going for Refuge]
don dam rang bzhin mtshan ma med/ / rnam par mi rtog chos sku las/ / gzugs sku lta bu'i tshul 'chang ba'i/ / 'gro mgon khyed la skyabs su mchi/ /
To You, beings' Protectors, taking in the signless, ultimate Nature, The non-conceptual Dharmakāya, the aspect of Form Bodies, I go for Refuge.
[8. Generating Bodhicitta]
ji ltar dus gsum mgon po rnams/ / byang chub mchog tu thugs bskyed ltar/ / bdag kyang 'gro rnams bsgral ba'i phyir/ / byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed do/ /
Just as Protectors in the three times produce the thought of supreme Awakening, I too, to save migrating beings, produce the thought of supreme Awakening.
[9. Dedication of merits]
phyag 'tshal la sogs bgyis pa las/ / bdag gis bsod nams gang thob des/ / sems can ma lus sangs rgyas kyi/ / sa ni myur du thob par shog /
Through the merit I've received from prostration and the rest, May sentient beings without exception quickly attain Buddhahood!
[The Four Immeasurables]
'gro ba bde dang phrad la sogs/ / tshad med bzhi yang bsgom par bya/ /
Meditate too on the four Measureless— may beings meet happiness, and so forth.
[Dissolution of the Field of Accumulation of Merit]
de nas 'phags rnams gshegs byas la/ / brtan g.yo'i chos kun stong par bsgom/ /
Then let the Āryas leave, and reflect on all dharmas, fixed and moving, as Empty.
oM shU n+ya tA dz+nyA na badzra swa b+hA wa At+ma ko&haM/
OṂ ŚŪNYATĀ-JÑĀNA-VAJRA-SVABHĀVÂTMAKO 'HAM. (OṂ, I have the nature of the vajra essence that is Wisdom-knowledge of Emptiness.)
[THE MAIN PRACTICE]
[Visualization]
de nas chu skyes steng du ni/ / chu shel de steng sa bon no/ / de yongs gyur las ut+pa la/ / sa bon nyid kyis mtshan pa'o/ /
Now, a lotus, upon which a moonstone, and on that the seed (TĀṂ). This turns into an utpala, marked with the same seed syllable.

de yi 'od kyis skye dgu rnams/ / sbyangs nas yongs gyur bcom ldan ma/ / zhal gcig phyag gnyis dUr ba'i mdog / bcu drug na tshod rgyan rnams rdzogs/ /
mchog sbyin pa dang ut+pa la/ / g.yas dang g.yon du shes bya ste/ / phyed krung gis bzhugs 'dzum pa'i bzhin/ / mtsho steng rin chen brag phug nang / /

This cleanses all beings with its light, then transforms into the Lady, One-faced, two-armed, the colour of grass (dūrvā), sixteen years old, with full adornments. Note Her right and left [hands] have boon-granting and utpala. Half-cross-legged; smiling face; on a lake, in a jewel cavern.

ltos 'gros zhabs brten bsgom par bya/ / g.yas dang g.yon gyi dang po ni/ / maM dang praM las lha mo ni/ / 'od zer can dang so so 'brang / / gser mdog zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma/ / rgyan mdzes g.yon na shing lo ni/ / mya ngan med dang rdo rje bsnams/ / g.yas pa 'dud pa'i tshul du'o/ /

Visualize the attendants She emanates[13] and supporters. On right and left First, Goddesses from MAM and PRAṂ— Mārīcī and Pratisarā,[14] Golden-coloured, one-faced, two-armed, lovely with ornaments, in their left [hands] Holding aśoka tree and vajra, right in the manner of wish-[granting].[15]

g.yas kyi 'og mar phag gdong ma/ / pA la sha mdog rgyan gyis mdzes/ / chos 'chad pa yi phyag rgya can/ / g.yon gyi 'og mar khro gnyer ma/ / mig sman mdog can khro mo'i tshul/ / gri gug thod khrag bsnams pa'o/ /

At lower right, the Pig-faced Goddess, palāśa-coloured,[16] lovely with ornaments, With mudrā of explaining the Dharma. At lower left is Bhṛkuṭī, The colour of kohl, of wrathful mien, holding a knife[17] and bloody skull.

de dag rnams kyi phyogs mtshams ni/ / brgyad na 'jigs pa rnam pa brgyad/ / bgegs dang dgra dang glang chen dang / / me dang sbrul dang mi rgod dang / / lcags sgrog gis bcings chu rnams las/ / skyob byed sgrol ma brgyad 'phro ba/ /
To eight intermediate points between these, emanate eight Taras Who protect from the eight dangers— hindering demons, enemies, Elephants, fire and serpents, robbers, being bound in chains, and water.
rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya/ /
Thus should the yogin visualize.
[Invocation of the Wisdom-knowledge Beings]
de nas snying ga'i sa bon las/ / 'od 'phros ye shes sems dpa' ni/ / snga ma'i tshul can spyan drangs la/ / mchod nas yi ge bzhi po yis/ / gnyis su med par bstim par bya/ /
Now, from the seed at the heart spreads light Invoking Wisdom-knowledge Beings who have the manner as above. Make offerings, then with the four syllables[18] let them absorb non-dually.
[Empowerment]
yi ge gsum gyis gnas gsum du/ / byin gyis brlab bya de yi rjes/ / dbang bskur rigs kyi bdag po ni/ / don yod grub pas spyi gtsug brgyan/ /
With the three letters in the three places, do blessing. After that You are empowered. The Lord of the Family, Amoghasiddhi, adorns your crown.
[Concentrating on oneself as Tārā]
de nas sa bon las byung ba'i/ / 'od kyi spro bsdu cung zad bya/ /
Then for a while let light from the seed radiate and come together.
[Recitation of mantra]
skyo na gsang sngags bzlas pa ni/ / yi ge bcu pa bgrang bar bya/ /
When tired of this, recite the mantra: that of ten syllables is to be counted,
oM tA re tut+tA re tu re swA hA/
OṂ TĀRE TUTTĀRE TURE SVĀHĀ!
'bum phrag gsum mam yang na drug / 'bum phrag bcu yis las rnams 'grub/ /
The rites are accomplished from [four][19] or six hundred thousand, or else a million.
[CONCLUSION]
[Offering-cake]
gal te 'byung po rnams la ni/ / gtor ma sbyin na snod gtsang du/ / zan blugs cho gas byin brlabs te/ /
If you are giving an off ring-cake to spirits, put in a clean vessel[20] Food, and bless it ritually.
lag gnyis thal mo sbyar ba las/ / mdzub gnyis gung mo gnyis po la/ / legs bcang ba ni ut+pa la/ / kha 'byed pa'i ni phyag rgya ste/ /
With the palms of both hands joined, separate well both forefingers And middle fingers, in the mudrā of the opening utpala.
gnas gsum dag tu gtugs byas nas/ / 'byung po rnams la gtor ma sbyin/ /
Touching this to the three places, offer the offering-cake to the spirits.
oM a kA ro mu khaM sarba d+ha rmA NAM Ad+ya nut+pan+na twAta

OṂ A-KĀRO MUKHAṂ SARVA-DHARMĀṆĀM ĀDY-ANUTPANNATVĀT
(OṂ The letter a is a door [to insight] because all dharmas are unproduced from the very beginning)[21]
oM AHhUM phaT swA hA/
OṂ ĀḤ HŪṂ PHAṬ SVĀHĀ!
[Concluding remarks]
las kyi yan lag thams cad ni/ / rgyas par rgyud las gsungs pa'i phyir/ / 'di ru ma bkod de ru blta/ /
Since all branches of the rites are taught extensively in the Tantra, Here they're not set out-look there.

rnal 'byor pa ni gang zhig gis/ / 'di don nyams su len byed na/ / dngos dang dngos med zad gtso bo/ / thog ma tha ma med zhi ba/ / skye dang zag pa rnam spangs pa/ / dpal ldan yum nyid thob 'gyur te/ / bum pa bzang sogs dngos grub dang / / gzhan yang gsad dang bskrad dang dbye/ / dgug dang zhi dang rgyas pa yi/ / las 'grub 'gyur ba smos ci dgos/ /

A yogin who practises this meaning [Has] excellent food, actual and non-actual, peace without beginning or end, Abandons rebirth and contaminations, and finds the Glorious Mother Herself, Not to mention accomplishing such siddhis as the vase of fortune, Or rites of killing, expelling, dividing, summoning, calming and increasing.
[Author's dedication of merits]

de ltar stong dang snying rje'i bdag nyid srid pa gsum skyes zad dngos shes dang ni/ / shes bya gnyis su med sku kun du bzang po spyod pa'i bdag nyid sna tshogs yum/ / bcom ldan 'das ma'i sgrub thabs rgyud bzhin legs bkod pa las bsod nams dri ma med/ / bdag gis gang thob des ni 'gro ba ma lus rtag bde mya ngan 'das thob shog /

Through the immaculate merits I've received from thus presenting according to the Tantra The sādhana of Our Lady, Mother of all whose nature is Samantabhadra's conduct, The Kāya Whose subject and object are non-dual, Her of nature of Emptiness and Compassion, Whose rebirths in the three realms are truly exhausted, may all beings find Nirvāṇa's eternal bliss!
'phags pa 'jigs pa brgyad las skyob pa zhes bya ba'i sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs slob dpon chen po tsan+d+ra go mis mdzad pa rdzogs so// //
The sādhana of Ārya-Tārā called Protection from the Eight Fears, by the great Master Candragomin, is complete.

rgya gar gyi mkhan po dI paM ka ra shrI dz+nyA na dang / bod kyi lo tsA ba tshul khrims rgyal bas bsgyur ba las/ slad kyi rgya gar gyi mkhan po byang chub sems dpa' dA na shI la dang / bod kyi lo tsA ba mal gyo blo gros grags pas bcos te gtan la phab pa'o//

It was translated by the Indian upādhyāya Dipaṃkara-śrī-jñāna and the Tibetan translator Ts'ül-tr'im Gyäl-wa, and subsequently corrected and finalized by the Indian upādhyāya Bodhisattva Dāna-śrī and the Tibetan translator Mäl-gy'i Lodr'ö dr'a-pa. [Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson.]

PROTECTING FROM THE EIGHT FEARS
([Aṣṭabhaya-trāṇa]) (By Atīśa)
@##/ /bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to Bhagavatī Tārā!
[PREPARATORY PRACTICES]
rnal 'byor pa'i dbang phyug bsam gtan gyi khang par zhugs te/ stan bde ba la 'dug cing / snying rje chen pos 'gro ba thams cad gdon par bya'o zhes dam bcas nas/ lha mo sgrol ma bsgom par bya'o/ /

The adept of yoga enters the meditation chamber and, sitting on a comfortable seat, makes the promise, 'With great Compassion I shall raise up all migrating beings.' Then she or he should meditate on the Goddess Tārā.
[Visualization; Seven Limbs; Refuge]

de yang rim pa 'di ltar bya ste/ rnal 'byor pa rang gi snying gar a las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge tAM bsams la/ de las 'od zer lcags kyu 'dra ba spros pas/ lha mo dang rang gi bla ma dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mdun gyi nam mkha' la gsal bar bltas te/ de la phyag 'tshal ba dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba dang / lus dbul ba dang / smon lam gdab pa rnams byas la/

This is done according to the following procedure. At your own heart, visualize coming from an a a moon disk, with the syllable TĀṂ on it. From this spread hook-like light-rays [drawing] to the space before you the Goddess, your own Guru and the Complete and Perfect Buddhas; behold these clearly. To them prostrate, confess your sins, go for Refuge to the Three [Jewels], dedicate your roots of virtue, offer your body, and make prayers.
[Emptiness]

de nas don dam par bdag dang lha la sogs pa rang bzhin med cing gdod ma nas ma skyes par bsam zhing / de brtan par bya ba'i phyir oM shU n+ya tA dz+nyA na badzra swa b+hA ba At+ma ko&haM zhes pas stong pa nyid du bsgom mo/ /

Next, meditate on Emptiness, thinking 'Ultimately, I, the Deity and all are without inherent nature and have been unproduced from the very beginning,'[22] and saying
OṂ ŚŪNYATĀ-JÑĀNA-VAJRA-SVABHĀVÂTMAKO 'HAM,
to make it firm.
[THE MAIN PRACTICE]
[Visualization]

de nas paM las pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i dbus su/ rang gi sems nyid sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis yi ge tAM las lha mo sgrol ma bskyed par bya ste/ de yang sku mdog ljang gu zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma/ phyag g.yas pa mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgyas gnas pa/ g.yon pa ut+pal bsnams pa/ don yod grub pa'i dbu rgyan can/ skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs pa/

Now [visualize coming] from paṂ an eight-petalled lotus, in the centre of which your own mind [appears] by the power of your previous vows as a syllable TĀṂ, from which the Goddess Tārā is produced. She is green in colour, with one face and two arms, with Her right hand resting in the mudrā of granting boons (vara-da) and the left holding an utpala. She has Amoghasiddhi as head ornament and is in ardha-paryaṅka.
[Concentration on oneself as Tārā]
ji srid mi skyo ba'i bar du bsgoms la/
Meditate on this until tired.
[Recitation of mantra]
skyo na bzlas pa la 'jug par bya'o/ /
When tired, begin the recitation. The mantra-string,
oM tA re tut+tA re tu re swA hA/
OṂ TĀRE TUTTĀRE TURE SVĀHĀ,

zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi phreng ba rang gi snying ga nas phyung ste/ yang rang gi zhal du zhugs yang rang gi kha nas 'byung ba'i rim pa sngags kyi kha dog dkar po dal bus 'khor bar bsam zhing bzlas par bya'o/ /
is sent out from your heart and in stages either enters your mouth or emerges from your heart. Visualizing the mantra as white in colour and slowly rotating, recite it.
[CONCLUSION]

bzlas pas kyang skyo na mchod pa dang gtor ma btang ste smon lam btab pa/ lha mo'i nga rgyal gyis spyod lam thams cad la gnas par bya'o/ / nyal ba'i tshe stong pa nyid du zhugs te nyal bar bya'o/ / yang langs pa'i tshe skad cig tsam gyis lha mo'i nga rgyal gyis ldang bar bya'o/ / 'jigs pa brgyad las skyob pa slob dpon mkhas pa dpal mar me mdzad ye shes kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so//

When you are tired even of reciting, make offerings and give the offering-cake, and make prayers. In all your postures you should remain in the pride of the Goddess [i.e. feeling that you are Her]. When you go to sleep, do so entering Emptiness. When you wake up, arise instantaneously [as the Goddess]. Protecting from the Eight Fears, by the wise Master Śrī-Dīpaṃkara-jñāna, is complete.
(Catalogued as having been translated by the author and Lotsawa Ts'ül-tr'im gyäl-wa.) Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson.

SĀDHANA OF THE VENERABLE TĀRĀ
([Tārā-bhaṭṭārikā-sādhana]) By Atīśa
[Translators' homage]
@##/ /rje btsun ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the Venerable Tārā!
[PREPARATORY PRACTICES]
[Preparation]

de la dang por sngags pas gdong bkru ba la sogs pa byas te/ yid dang mthun par bsam gtan gyi gnas gtsang zhing dri zhim po gcal du bkram par stan gtsang ma la bde bar skyil mo krung gis 'dug ste 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma'i sngags kyis gtor ma byin gyis brlabs la/
oM A bi g+h+nAn+ta kr-ita hUM phaT/
ces bya ba'i sngags lan bcu'i bar du brjod de/ phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i bgegs thams cad bskrad par bya'o/ /

First the mantric practitioner washes her or his face, and so forth. In a dean, agreeable place of meditation, she sprinkles perfume, and sits cross-legged on a clean, comfortable seat.[23] She blesses the offering-cake with the mantra for offering-cakes for all spirits (bhūta). Rearing ten rimes the mantra
OṂ ĀḤ VIGHNÂNTAKṚT HŪṂ PHAṬ! (OṂ ĀḤ Putting an end to hindrances HŪṂ PHAṬ!),[24]
she should expel all the hindrances that are in the ten directions.
[Visualization]

de nas rang gi snying gar chos thams cad chos dbyings kyi rang bzhin skye ba med par ston par byed pa ston ka'i zla ba ltar dkar ba 'od zer dkar po 'phro bas rang gi lus gsal bar byed pa shin tu 'phro ba bsams la/ de yongs su gyur pa'i 'od zer dkar po'i thig le shel sgong dag pa lta bu de rim gyis 'phel bar gyur pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs su bsam zhing / de'i steng du yi ge tAM 'od zer gyi tshogs 'phro ba'i rin po che'i sgron ma ltar dkar ba rnam par bsam mo/ / de nas yi ge tAM de 'od zer shin tu dkar ba'i tshogs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad gsal bar byas pa sngon du 'gro bas lha mo sgrol ma la sogs pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang bla ma rnams bskul te/ spyan drangs pa mdun gyi nam mkha'i phyogs la rnam par bsam par bya'o/ /

Then she visualizes at her heart white light-rays radiating, their whiteness like the autumn moon indicating that all dharmas are of the nature of the Dharmadhātu, lacking production; they radiate strongly, lighting up her body. This she visualizes transforming into a dot of white light, like a pure piece of crystal, which gradually grows into the form of a moon disk. Upon this she visualizes the syllable TĀṂ, emitting a mass of light-rays like a white Jewel Tārā. Then she should visualize that the TĀṂ-syllable illuminates the entire universe with masses of exceedingly white light-rays, whereupon the Goddess Tārā and other Buddhas, Bo-dhisattvas and Gurus are exhorted and invoked to the region of space in front of her.[25]
[Offering]
de'i steng du yid kyis rang bzhin gyi mchod par bya ba yin la/ de la mchod pa'i cho ga'i rim pa ni 'di yin te/
In addition, she should make offerings, of mental nature. The method for the offering ritual is as follows.
oM badzra puSh+pe hUM zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod la yi ge tAM las byung ba'i me tog gi mchod pa'i tshogs kyis mchod par bya'o/ /
(a) Reciting the mantra OṂ VAJRA-PUṢPE HŪṂ! (OṂ Vajra Flower-Goddess HŪṂ!), make offering with masses of offerings of flowers that come from the TĀṂ-syllable.
de nas oM badzra d+hU pe hUM zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod la yi ge tAM de nyid las yang dag par spros pa'i bdug pa'i mchod pa'i tshogs kyis mchod par bya'o/ /
(b) Then recite the mantra OṂ VAJRA-DHUPE HŪṂ! (OṂ Vajra Incense-Goddess HŪṂ!) and make offering with masses of offerings of incense[26] sent out from the same TĀṂ-syllable.
de'i 'og tu oM badzra dI pe hUM zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod la yi ge tAM de nyid las rin po che'i sgron ma spros la mchod par bya'o/ /
(c) After that, recite the mantra OṂ VAJRA-DĪPE HŪṂ! (OṂ Vajra Lamp-Goddess HŪṂ!) and make offering with precious lamps sent out from the TĀṂ-syllable.
de nas oM badzra gan+d+he hUM zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod la yi ge tAM de nyid las byung ba'i dri'i mchod pa'i sprin yang dag par spros pas mchod par bya'o/ /
(d) Next, recite the mantra OṂ VAJRA-GANDHE HŪṂ! (OṂ Vajra Scent-Goddess HŪṂ!) and make offering by sending out offering-clouds [of perfume] that come from the TĀṂ-syllable.

de nas oM badzra nai bi d+ye hUM zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod la yi ge tAM de nyid las rin po che sna tshogs bcug pa'i lha'i zhal zas ro mchog dang ldan pa'i mchod pa'i sprin rnam pa sna tshogs yang dag par spros pas mchod par bya'o/ /

(e) Then recite the mantra OṂ VAJRA-NAIVEDYĀ HŪṂ! (OṂ Vajra Food-offering-Goddess HŪṂ!) and make offering by sending out from the TĀṂ-syllable diverse offering-clouds of heavenly foodstuffs, of the finest tastes, served in all kinds of jewel [vessels].

de nas oM sar+b+ba bi shiSh+Ta pU dza me g+ha pra sa ra sa mu dra HhUM/ zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod la yi ge tAM de nyid las rin po che sna bdun gyi gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / dril bu dang / ba dan dang / bla re la sogs pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rin po che sna bdun gyis mchod par bya'o/ /

(f) Then recite the mantra OṂ SARVA-VIŚIṢṬA-PŪJA-MEGHA-PRASARA-SAMUDRA ĀḤ HŪṂ! (OṂ Ocean of a multitude of clouds of every distinguished offering HŪṂ!) and make offering with parasols, banners, bells, pennants, canopies and so forth of the seven precious things, and the seven precious possessions of a universal monarch,[27] all from the TĀṂ-syllable.
[Remaining limbs]

de ltar mchod pa byas nas/ de dag gi spyan sngar sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba byas la/

Having made offering in this way, she should in front of those [holy beings] confess her sins, rejoice in merits, urge [them to give teachings], request [them to stay until saṃsāra ends], dedicate her merits, and go for Refuge to the Three [Jewels].
[Four Immeasurables and Bodhicitta]
byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms te tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgoms nas byang chub kyi sems brtan por bya'o/ /
Then she should meditate on the four Divine States of mind (brahmā-vihāra), namely Loving-kindness, Compassion, Joy and Equanimity, and so make firm her Awakening Attitude (Bodhicitta).
[Emptiness]

de nas
oM swa b+hA ba shud+d+haHsar+b+ba d+harmAHswa b+hA ba shud+d+ho&haM/
zhes bya ba'i sngags lan gsum brjod la/ 'gro ba thams cad rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bur stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du dmigs par bya'o/ /

Next, she should recite three times the mantra
OṂ SVABHĀVA-ŚUDDHĀḤ SARVA-DHARMĀḤ, SVABHĀVA-ŚUDDHO 'HAM (OṂ All dharmas are pure of own-being, I am pure of own-being),
and perceive all sentient beings as of the nature of Emptiness, like dreams, illusions or mirages.
[THE MAIN PRACTICE]
[Visualization: self-generation as Tārā]

de nas yi ge a yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du bsam/ de'i steng du yi ge tAM dkar po las 'od zer dkar po 'khrigs par bsam/ de yongs su gyur pa las ut+pa la sngon po/ de'i dbus su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na yi ge tAM dkar po bsam/ de las 'od zer dkar po phyogs bcur 'phros pa des sems can thams cad sbyangs nas lha mo sgrol ma'i skur gyur pa 'od zer de nyid kyis bkug / ut+pal dang yi ge tAM la bstims pas/

Now she visualizes a letter a, transforming into a moon disk. Upon this is visualized the white syllable TĀṂ, as a collection of white light-rays. This transforms into a blue utpala, at whose centre is visualized on a moon-disk the white syllable TĀṂ. From this, white light-rays spread to the ten directions. They purify all sentient beings so that they become of the form of Tārā. The same light-rays draw them back so that they absorb into the utpala and TĀṂ-syllable. Because of this,

pad+ma dkar po'i dbus gnas pa'i/ / zla ba'i gzugs kyi gdan steng du/ / rdo rje skyil krung bcas nas ni/ / mchog sbyin ma dang ut+pal bsnams/ / ston ka'i zla ba'i mdangs 'dra ba'i/ / zla ba la ni rgyab brten pa/ / rgyan rnams thams cad yongs su rdzogs/ / bcu drug lo lon lus dang ldan/ / rdzogs sangs rgyas dang de 'dra'i sras/ / kun gyi yum gyur 'dod dgu 'chang / /

In the centre of a white lotus is a seat of lunar form Where I sit cross-legged in vajra, granting boons,[28] holding an utpala, Resting my back upon a moon of colour like the autumn moon. Complete with all the ornaments, I have a sixteen-year-old's body. Mother of all the Perfect Buddhas and their Offspring, I end all desires.[29]
'phags ma sgrol ma de'i snying gar zla ba'i steng gi tAM dkar po yongs su gyur pa las/
By transforming the white TĀṂ on the moon-disk at the heart of this Ārya-Tārā,

'khor lo 'od zer dkar po bsgom/ / rtsibs brgyad pa la yi ge ni/ / brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba la/ / lte bar oM tA'i yi ge yi/ / dbus gnas bsgrub bya'i ming dang ldan/ / zla drug bsten zhing nges pas ni/ / rtse gcig pa yi sems kyis bsgom/ / yi ge bcu po'i sngags 'di ni/ / skyo bar ma gyur sems kyis bzlas/ / dang por oM ni bzhag nas su/ / de 'og tA re rab tu sbyar/ / de 'og tA re tut+tA re/ / swA hA'i mtha' can las kun byed/ /

Visualize a wheel of white light. On its eight spokes are eight Syllables, while at the hub that they surround are OṂ and TĀ With the name of the object of practice between.[30] With the name[31] firm and definite, meditate with one-pointed mind. Recite in the mind, until you're tired, this mantra of ten syllables. First we place an OṂ, and then after that we add TĀRE, After that ture and tuttĀre, finally SVĀHĀ—this does all rites.
[Invocation of the Wisdom-knowledge Being]

thugs ka'i 'khor lo de las 'od zer dkar po 'phros pas dam tshig sems dpa' 'dra ba'i ye shes sems dpa' rang bzhin gyis grub pa kun nas spyan drangs pa mdun gyi nam mkha' la rnam par bsams nas/ snga ma bzhin du yang dag par mchod de/ de nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcing bar bya ste/ thal mo khong stong du sbyar nas mdzub mo gnyis gung mo gnyis kyi rgyab tu sbyar la mthe bong gnyis nang du bkug pa ni/ ut+pala'i phyag rgya'o/ / de'i dbus su yi ge tAM dkar po bsams te/ de las 'od zer dkar po 'phros pa des ye shes sems dpa' la bskor bar byas la/ de nas dzaHhUM baM hoHzhes bya ba'i yi ge bzhis spyan drangs nas dam tshig sems dpa' bdag nyid la gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang / dgyes pa byas la/
oM d+harma d+hA tu dz+nyA na badzra swa b+hA ba At+ma ko&haM/
zhes nga rgyal bya'o/ /

From the wheel at the heart, white light-rays spread, exhorting and invoking the naturally-existing Wisdom-knowledge Being similar to the Symbolic Being; She is visualized in space in front. Offerings are made, as before. Then [the practitioner] should assume the samaya-mudrā ('Pledge Gesture'). Joining the palms with a hollow inside, she joins the forefingers to the backs of the middle fingers and bends the thumbs inside: this is the utpala-mudrā. In the middle of it she visualizes a white syllable TĀṂ, radiating white light-rays, which surround the Wisdom-knowledge Being. Then with the four syllables jaḤ HŪṂ baṂ hoḤ, she invokes Her, makes Her enter herself, the Symbolic Being, binds [Her there] and rejoices.[32] She expresses her selfconsciousness [of being the Deity] with
OṂ DHARMA-DHĀTU-JÑĀNA-VAJRA-SVABHĀVÂTMAKO 'HAM (OṂ I have the nature of the vajra essence that is the Dharmadhātu Wisdom-knowledge).
[Empowerment]

de'i rjes la 'khor lo yi ger bcas pa las 'od zer spro ba byas la/ de bzhin gshegs pa lnga mdun gyi nam mkha' la rnam par bsams la/ dbang bskur ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis don du gnyer bar bya ba ste/
byang chub rdo rjes sangs rgyas la/ / ji ltar mchog chen stsol mdzad pa/ / bdag la bsrung ba'i don gyi phyir/ / nam mkha'i rdo rje deng bdag stsol/ /

After that, she visualizes that light-rays spread from the wheel and the syllables, so that the five Tathāgatas [come] in space before her. She seeks empowerment with this stanza:
Just as Bodhivajra made request for the most high to the Buddhas, Now do I request the vajra of space for the sake of my protection.

de nas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi sku las byung ba'i lo tsA na dang / mA ma kI dang / gos dkar mo dang / tA ra rin po che'i bum pa ye shes kyi bdud rtsis bkang ba phyag na bsnams pas/
rdo rje chen po'i dbang bskur ba/ / khams gsum po yis phyag byas pa/ / gsang ba gsum gyi gnas las byung / / sangs rgyas kun gyis sbyin par bya/ /
zhes bya ba 'don cing dbang bskur bar bsam mo/ /

Then she visualizes that from the bodies of the Tathāgatas come Locanā, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī and Tārā, holding in their hands precious flasks full of nectar of Wisdom-knowledge; saying
The empowerment of the Great Vajra, which the three Realms pay homage to, Will be bestowed by all the Buddhas come from the places of the Three Secrets,[33]
they give empowerment.
dbang bskur ba rdzogs ma thag tu rin po che'i cod pan gyi steng du de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag tu med pa sku mdog dkar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa/ ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya can bsam mo/ /
As soon as the empowerment is complete, she visualizes on her jewel crown the Tathāgata Amitābha, his body white in colour, with one face and two arms, in the mudrā of concentration.
[Recitation of mantra]

lus dang ngag dang yid gsum byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir/ spyi bor yi ge oM dkar po zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa dang / lkog mar yi ge AHdmar po zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa dang / snying gar yi ge hUM nag po zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa rnam par bkod do/ / yi ge bcu po las 'od zer dkar po spros pas 'gro ba kun sbyangs nas sangs rgyas su bsgrubs nas slar bkug ste/ 'khor lo dang yi ge la bstims te gsal bar bsgom zhing bzlas brjod bya'o/ /

For the blessing of her body, speech and mind, she sets at her crown a white OṂ, resting on a moon-disk; at her throat a red ah, resting on a moon-disk; and at her heart a dark blue HŪṂ, resting on a moon-disk. Visualizing clearly that white light-rays spreading from the ten syllables purify all sentient beings, so that they realize Buddhahood and are then drawn back and absorb into the wheel and syllables, she should say the recitation.
[CONCLUSION]

ji srid mi skyo ba'i bar du bsgom pa dang bzlas par byas nas de las ldang bar 'dod na cho ga nyams pa bskang bar bya ba'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa'i snying po/ yi ge brgya pa zhes bya ba bzlas nas ye shes sems dpa' yang dag par mchod bsod nams yongs su bsngos la gshegs su gsol lo/ / de la ye shes sems dpa' gshegs su gsol ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni/
oM khyed kyis sems can don kun mdzad/ / rjes su mthun pa'i dngos grub stsol/ / sangs rgyas yul du gshegs nas ni/ / slar yang 'byon par mdzad du gsol/ / muHzhes bya ba 'di yin no/ /

When she has meditated and recited until she is tired, and wants to finish, she recites the heart mantra of Vajrasattva, known as the hundred-syllable [mantra], to make up for faults in the ritual. Then she makes proper offering to the Wisdom-knowledge Being, dedicates the merits, and asks Her to leave. The verse for asking the Wisdom-knowledge Being to leave is:
OṂ! You do all that's good for sentient beings; grant [me] favourable siddhis! I request, when You've departed to Your Buddha Land, come again! MUḤ!
de la bzlas pa'i sngags ni/ oM tA re tut+tA re tu re swA hA/
The mantra recited is OṂ TĀRE TOTTĀRE TORE SVĀHĀ!

de la rdo rje sems dpa'i snying po yi ge brgya pa'i sngags ni/
oM badzra sa twa sa ma ya/ ma nu pA la ya/ badzra satwa twe no pa/ tiSh+Tha dr-i D+ho me b+ha ba/ su to Sh+yo me b+ha ba/ su po Sh+yo me b+ha ba/ a nu rak+to me b+ha ba/ sar+b+ba sid+d+him+me pra yats+tsha/ sarba karma su tsa me/ tsit+taM shre yaHku ru hUM/ ha ha ha ha hoH/ b+ha ga wAn sar+b+ba ta thA ga ta/ badzra mA me muny+tsa/ badzrIb+ha ba ma hA sa ma ya satwa AH/ zhes bya ba 'di yin no/ /

The hundred-syllable heart mantra of Vajrasattva is:
OṂ VAJRASATTVA SAMAYAM ANUPĀLAYA, VAJRASATTVA TENÔPATIṢṬHA, DṚḌHO ME BHAVA, SUTOṢYO ME BHAVA, SUPOṢYO ME BHAVA, ANURAKTO ME BHAVA. SARVA-SIDDHIM ME PRAYACCHA, SARVA-KARMA-SŪCA ME CITTAṂ ŚRE YAḤ KURU HŪṂ! HA HA HA HA HOḤ! BHAGAVĀN SARVA-TATHĀGATA-VAJRA MĀ ME MUÑCA. VAJRĪ-BHAVA MAHĀ-SAMAYA-SATTVA ĀḤ!
[Dedication]
bsod nams 'di yis 'gro ba kun/ / rje btsun sgrol ma 'dra bar shog / bdag kyang ting 'dzin 'di bsgrubs nas/ / 'gro ba'i don du sangs rgyas shog /
Through these merits, may all migrators be like Venerable Tārā! May I too realize this meditation and become Buddha for beings' sake!
rje btsun sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs slob dpon chen po dpal mar me mdzad ye shes kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so// //
The Sādhana of the Venerable Tārā, by the great Master Śrī-Dīpaṃkara-jñāna, is complete.
rgya gar gyi mkhan po dI paM ka ra shrI dz+nyA na dang / bod kyi lo tsA ba dge slong dge ba'i blo gros kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o// //
It was translated, revised and finalized by the Indian upādhyāya Dīpaṃkara-śrī-jñāna and the Tibetan translator Gelong Ge-wäi lo-dr'ö. [Translated from the Tibetan by Martin Willson.]
